analyzed: de la rgyun du goms pas dang po nyid du spong ba'i lam dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa skye ste /

analyzed: des nyon mongs pa chen po'i rnam pa spong bar byed pas rab tu dben pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o // de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral nas rnal 'byor pa de de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' ba dang / spong ba la rjes su bsngags pa'i bsam pa skye zhing bden pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba shas chung ngu dang ldan la dus dus su bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu 'am de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa gang yang rung ba sems dang
translated: Since that abandons the aspect of great affliction, it is called mental attention of complete seclusion.

analyzed: bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas gzengs bstod cing sems can spro ba skyed par byed de /
translated: When the practitioner is free from the afflictions that are discordant with that, then after that, the attitude of delighting in abandonment and praising abandonment arises. He possesses a small amount of joy and pleasure born of the truth and from time to time he encourages himself and generates enthusiasm in sentient beings through mental attention that is exalted and that is any of the following: the result of meditative stabilization, the qualities of the TathƒÅgata, and so on.

analyzed: de yang rmugs pa dang rgod pa'i sgrib pa bsal ba'i phyir 'di ni dga' ba yang dag par sdud pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, in order to remove the hindrances of torpor and agitation, this is called the mental attention that gathers joy.

original: des de ltar yang dag par zhugs pa na dge ba'i rtsa bas yang dag par bstan pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa rnams 'gro ba'am gnas pa na yang dag par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: des de ltar yang dag par zhugs pa na dge ba'i rtsa bas yang dag par bstan pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa rnams 'gro ba'am gnas pa na yang dag par mi 'byung ste /
translated: When he has thus entered, the entanglements of the defilements of the realm of desire do not arise in him, whether he is walking or standing, because he is sustained by the roots of virtue.

original: de de'i tshe 'di snyam du ci bdag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la chags pa yod pa'am mi 'byung zhing 'byung bar tshor ram 'on te med pa las mi 'byung zhing 'byung bar ma tshor zhes rtog cing gzhan yang rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de de'i tshe 'di snyam du ci bdag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la chags pa yod pa'am mi 'byung zhing 'byung bar tshor ram 'on te med pa las mi 'byung zhing 'byung bar ma tshor zhes rtog cing gzhan yang rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba /
translated: At that time he thinks: ‚ÄúDo I feel the arising of desire-attachment that exists or do I feel the arising of desire-attachment that does not exist?‚Äù Moreover, he thinks:

analyzed: dge ba'i mtshan ma dag pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is called the mental attention to the pure sign of virtue.

original: de ni 'jig pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig pa yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mental attention to destruction.

original: des de ltar gnyen po'i phyogs so sor 'jig cing btsal nas bsgoms pa na dus ji srid cig gi bar du 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: des de ltar gnyen po'i phyogs so sor 'jig cing btsal nas bsgoms pa na dus ji srid cig gi bar du 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa 'byung ste /
translated: When one has thus individually destroyed and sought the side of the antidote, and then cultivated it, for how long a time does the mental attention that is the antidote of the final preparation of the first concentration arise, free from all the afflictions of the desire realm?

original: de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //

original: de'i 'og tu rtsa ba'i bsam gtan dang po thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rtsa ba'i bsam gtan dang po thob par 'gyur te /

original: de'i sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed do //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed do //
translated: That is the mental attention of the result of the final preparation.

original: de la mtshan nyid yang dag par rig pa yid la byed pas ni //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid yang dag par rig pa yid la byed pas ni //
translated: Among those, by the mental attention that is the knowledge of the characteristics,

original: gang spang bar bya ba dang thob par bya ba de dag yang dag par shes nas spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i phyir sems @123b rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang spang bar bya ba dang thob par bya ba de dag yang dag par shes nas spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i phyir sems @123b rab tu 'dzin to //

original: lhag par mos pa yid la byed pas ni de'i 'og tu yang dag par sbyor ba la brtson par byed do //üîΩrab tu dben pa yid la byed pas ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i rnam par spong bar byed do //

original: dga' ba yang dag par sdud pa yid la byed pas ni nyon mongs pa 'bring gi rnam pa spong bar byed do //üîΩ'jig pa yid la byed pas ni /üîΩthob pa yid la byed pa yang sems nga rgyal med par 'jog par byed do //

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pas ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pas ni /

original: nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i rnam pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i rnam pa spong bar byed do //

analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pas ni legs par bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong bar byed de /

original: ji ltar bsam gtan dang po la yid la byed pa bdun yod pa bzhin du cung zad med min skye mched kyi bar du yang yid la byed pa bdun dang ldan par ci rigs par sbyar te /

analyzed: rgyas par bshad na yi ge gzhung mangs pas zhib tu ni ma bshad do //

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'og tu tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /

analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams 'dir zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: Bhik·π£us, having addressed them, he spoke as before.

analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni dge slong ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúmonk‚Äù refers to the spiritual practitioner who cultivates the four immeasurables.

analyzed: de la tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /

original: de thob par byed pa'i gnas ni tshangs pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i gnas ni tshangs pa'i gnas so //
translated: The state that causes one to attain that is the ‚Äústate of Brahma.‚Äù

analyzed: yang na tshangs pa ni sdig pa thams cad la mi 'jug cing spong bar byed pa ste /

analyzed: sdig pa la mi 'jug pa'i chos bzhi ni tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'o //

analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin ma smos kyang byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don te /

analyzed: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na / de'i khyad par bstan pa ni /

analyzed: dgra med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @124a * //

original: gsungs so // mdza' ba dang dgrar dbyer med pa sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa'i sems dang ldan pas na dgra med pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs so // mdza' ba dang dgrar dbyer med pa sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa'i sems dang ldan pas na dgra med pa'o //
translated: He is without enemies, because he has a mind that is full of the thought of benefit and happiness for all beings, without making distinctions of friend and enemy.

analyzed: sems can rnams dge ba'i phyogs la dgod cing 'phags pa'i lam bsgom du bcug gcig pa ni phan pa'i sems te /

analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa dang ldan pas na mi mthun pa med pa'o //

original: don du na sems can kun la phan par sems kyi /
analyzed: don du na sems can kun la phan par sems kyi /

original: sems can rnams lha dang mi'i bde 'gro rnams mya ngan las 'das par dgongs par sems pa ni bde ba'i bsam pa ste bsam pa de dang ldan pas na gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams lha dang mi'i bde 'gro rnams mya ngan las 'das par dgongs par sems pa ni bde ba'i bsam pa ste bsam pa de dang ldan pas na gnod pa med pa'o //

analyzed: yang na dgra la yang gnod par bya ba'i sems med pas na gnod pa med pa'o //

analyzed: las dang po pa'i dus na phyogs gcig tu je byams khyab par byed pas na yangs pa'o //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa na tshad med pa'o //

analyzed: 'dir ri tshig pa bzhin du snod kyi sgo nas snod la chags pa'i sems can la dmigs par byed pa bstan to //

original: mos zhes bya ba la mos pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: mos zhes bya ba la mos pa yid la byed pa ste /

translated: Just as the nature of loving kindness and the characteristics of its cultivation have been taught, so too should the method be understood for compassion and so on.

analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: de dag gi don kyang sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //

analyzed: mdo kha cig las tshad med pa bzhin zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some s≈´tras, the four immeasurables are mentioned.

analyzed: de'i don kyang tshad med pa'i sems can la dmigs pas na tshad med pa zhes bya'o //

translated: Why are they not explained as the five or three abodes of BrahmƒÅ and so on, but only as four?

analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por gyur bas bzhi kho nar bshad de /

analyzed: mi dga' ba mang ba rnams de spang ba'i phyir dga' ba gnyen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Joy is the antidote for those who have much unhappiness in order to abandon that.

original: 'dod chags dang gnod sems mang ba rnams de spang bar bya ba'i phyir btang snyoms gnyen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gnod sems mang ba rnams de spang bar bya ba'i phyir btang snyoms gnyen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Equanimity is the antidote for those who have much attachment and malice in order to abandon that.

original: 'o na mi gtsang ba bsgom pa yang 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin na ni mi gtsang ba dang btang snyoms gnyis gnyen por gyur pa la khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: 'o na mi gtsang ba bsgom pa yang 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin na ni mi gtsang ba dang btang snyoms gnyis gnyen por gyur pa la khyad par ci yod /
translated: If the meditation on the impure is the antidote to attachment, what is the difference between the meditation on the impure and equanimity as antidotes?

original: smras pa mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi gtsang ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa mi tshangs par spyod pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi gtsang ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the impure is the antidote to attachment to sexual intercourse.üîΩEquanimity is the antidote to attachment to father, mother, and relatives.

original: pha dang ma dang gnyen la chags pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ni btang snyoms te khyad par yod do //
analyzed: pha dang ma dang gnyen la chags pa'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ni btang snyoms te khyad par yod do //
translated: Thus there is a difference.

original: de byams pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //üîΩkyi hud sems sems can 'di dag bde @125a * //
analyzed: de byams pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to // kyi hud sems sems can 'di dag bde @125a * //
translated: The characteristics of love and so on have been explained.

original: ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces yid la byed pa ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces yid la byed pa ni byams pa'o //
translated: The mental attention that thinks, ‚ÄúAlas! May these sentient beings possess happiness!‚Äù is love.

original: ae ma'o sems can 'di dag sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o sems can 'di dag sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: The mental attention that thinks, ‚ÄúAlas! These sentient beings are suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig ces yid la byed pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig ces yid la byed pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: May they be free from suffering!‚Äù is compassion.

original: sems can bde ba dang ldan pa rnam rtag tu bde ba dang dga' bar gyur cig ces yid la byed pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems can bde ba dang ldan pa rnam rtag tu bde ba dang dga' bar gyur cig ces yid la byed pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Sympathetic joy is the mental attention of wishing that all sentient beings who are happy may remain happy and experience joy.

original: grogs la byams pa yang mi skyed dgra la zhe sdang yang mi skyed de /
analyzed: grogs la byams pa yang mi skyed dgra la zhe sdang yang mi skyed de /
translated: It is not the case that one does not generate love for friends or compassion for enemies.

original: sems mnyam pa tsam du 'dzin pa ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa tsam du 'dzin pa ni btang snyoms so //
translated: Equanimity is the mere holding of the mind in balance.üîΩWell, how do beginners cultivate love, etc.

original: 'o na las dang po pa rnams thog ma nyid du byams pa la sogs pa la ji lta bsgom /
analyzed: 'o na las dang po pa rnams thog ma nyid du byams pa la sogs pa la ji lta bsgom /
translated: , at the very outset?

original: de ltar bdag nyid bde ba dang ldan pa'am bdag bde ba med kyang /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid bde ba dang ldan pa'am bdag bde ba med kyang /
translated: Thus, whether one is endowed with happiness or not,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos rnams bde ba thob par mthong ngam thos na sems can rnams kyang bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces mos par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos rnams bde ba thob par mthong ngam thos na sems can rnams kyang bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces mos par byed do //
translated: one should imagine that one sees or hears that the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and Sravakas have obtained happiness, and one should think, ‚ÄúMay all sentient beings come to possess happiness!‚ÄùüîΩIf that person is unable to imagine that all sentient beings possess the happiness of oneself and the Buddhas,

original: gal te gang zag de nyon mongs pa'i mthu che bas na /üîΩsems can kun la bdag dang sangs rgyas kyi bde ba dang ldan par mos par mi nus te /
analyzed: gal te gang zag de nyon mongs pa'i mthu che bas na /üîΩsems can kun la bdag dang sangs rgyas kyi bde ba dang ldan par mos par mi nus te /
translated: because the power of his or her afflictions is great,

original: dgra la lhag par zhe sdang yod la /
analyzed: dgra la lhag par zhe sdang yod la /
translated: There is a special hatred for the enemy.

original: grogs la lhag par byams pa yod na /
analyzed: grogs la lhag par byams pa yod na /
translated: There is a special love for the friend.

original: des grogs kyi phyogs la yang rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ste rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: des grogs kyi phyogs la yang rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ste rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, the friend is divided into three: superior, medium, and inferior.

original: de ltar dbye ba las je grogs po rab la bde ba de dag dang ldan par gyur cig ces mos par bya'o //üîΩde nas de grub na grogs po 'bring la'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbye ba las je grogs po rab la bde ba de dag dang ldan par gyur cig ces mos par bya'o // de nas de grub na grogs po 'bring la'o //
translated: Having made this division, one should wish that the superior friend be endowed with happiness.üîΩThen, if that is accomplished, (one should wish it) for the medium friend.

original: de nas de grub na grogs po tha ma la'o //
analyzed: de nas de grub na grogs po tha ma la'o //
translated: Then, if that is accomplished, (one should wish it) for the inferior friend.

original: de nas grogs po'i phyogs gsum mnyam pa kho nar dmigs pa grub na /
analyzed: de nas grogs po'i phyogs gsum mnyam pa kho nar dmigs pa grub na /
translated: Then, if that is accomplished, one should observe the three divisions of the friend as being equal.

original: tha mal pa'i mi rnams spyir dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i mi rnams spyir dmigs par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should observe ordinary people in general.

original: de nas de grub pa dang dgra tha ma dang 'bring dang rab rnam pa gsum du phye ste /
analyzed: de nas de grub pa dang dgra tha ma dang 'bring dang rab rnam pa gsum du phye ste /
translated: Then, if that is accomplished, one should divide the enemy into three: inferior, medium, and superior.

original: dang por tha ma la bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces mos par bya'o //üîΩde nas dgra 'bring la'o //
analyzed: dang por tha ma la bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces mos par bya'o // de nas dgra 'bring la'o //
translated: First, one should wish that the inferior one be endowed with happiness.üîΩThen, (one should wish it) for the medium enemy.

original: de nas dgra rab la'o //
analyzed: de nas dgra rab la'o //
translated: Then, (one should wish it) for the superior enemy.

original: de nas gang grogs kyi mchog dang / dgra rab gnyis kyi phyogs gnyis la bde bar gyur cig ces byams pas mnyam par gyur na /
analyzed: de nas gang grogs kyi mchog dang / dgra rab gnyis kyi phyogs gnyis la bde bar gyur cig ces byams pas mnyam par gyur na /
translated: Then, with regard to the two groups of friends and enemies, he should be impartial, wishing happiness to both.

original: de nas rim gyis bdag gi rims tsam gyis 'khor la dmigs so //
analyzed: de nas rim gyis bdag gi rims tsam gyis 'khor la dmigs so //
translated: Then, he should gradually extend his meditation to his relatives,

original: de nas grong khyer la'o //
analyzed: de nas grong khyer la'o //
translated: to the people of the town,

original: de nas rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du'o //
translated: to the people of the country,

original: de nas khad kyis je che je che nas phyogs bcu kun tu byams pas khyab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khad kyis je che je che nas phyogs bcu kun tu byams pas khyab par bya'o //
translated: and then to the whole world, pervading it with loving-kindness.üîΩHe should not despise anyone, thinking that he has no good qualities at all.

original: @125b gang kun tu yon tan dang bcas pa'i gang zag gzhan dag la yon tan cung zad yod par yang khyad du mi gsod cing /
analyzed: @125b gang kun tu yon tan dang bcas pa'i gang zag gzhan dag la yon tan cung zad yod par yang khyad du mi gsod cing /
translated: He should consider that everyone has some good qualities, however small.

original: yon tan dang ldan par 'dzin pa des ni myur bar byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan par 'dzin pa des ni myur bar byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this practice, he will quickly attain the concentration of loving-kindness.

original: bzlog ste smras pa /
analyzed: bzlog ste smras pa /
translated: The opponent objects:

original: yon tan gzung bar bya ba na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa la yang yon tan gzung bar nus te /
analyzed: yon tan gzung bar bya ba na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa la yang yon tan gzung bar nus te /
translated: If one is to consider the good qualities of others, one can consider the good qualities of even those whose roots of virtue have been severed.

original: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa la gnas kyang sngon gyi bsod nams kyi 'bras bu mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa la gnas kyang sngon gyi bsod nams kyi 'bras bu mthong nas /
translated: Thus, even though the root of merit is cut off, one sees the result of former merit.

original: khyad kyis bsod nams kyi las byas par gyur pas na /
analyzed: khyad kyis bsod nams kyi las byas par gyur pas na /
translated: Therefore, one does meritorious action.

original: gang gi phyir khyod da ltar gzugs bzang por gyur to zhes bzung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod da ltar gzugs bzang por gyur to zhes bzung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, you now have a good figure.

original: yon tan can la yang nyes pa gzung bar nus te /
analyzed: yon tan can la yang nyes pa gzung bar nus te /
translated: One can also apprehend a fault in a virtuous person.

original: dper na rang sangs rgyas lta bur sgo gsum nas nyes pa cung zad kyang mi 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na rang sangs rgyas lta bur sgo gsum nas nyes pa cung zad kyang mi 'byung mod kyi /
translated: For example, one sees a Pratyekabuddha who does not have the slightest fault in the three doors.

original: sngon gyi bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'bras bu mthong nas /üîΩsngon chad gang gi phyir bsod nams ma yin pa'i las cung zad byas par gyur pas /
analyzed: sngon gyi bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'bras bu mthong nas / sngon chad gang gi phyir bsod nams ma yin pa'i las cung zad byas par gyur pas /
translated: However, one sees the result of former non-merit.üîΩTherefore, one apprehends that one has done a little non-meritorious action in the past.

original: da ltar gzugs mi mdzes pa dang ldan par gyur ces bzung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: da ltar gzugs mi mdzes pa dang ldan par gyur ces bzung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, one has a bad figure now.

original: snying rje la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: One should also apply this to compassion and so forth.

original: sems can 'di dag ni chags pa mang po'i dam du nub pa sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni chags pa mang po'i dam du nub pa sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: These sentient beings are submerged in the mire of their many attachments and are endowed with various kinds of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig ces mos par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig ces mos par byed pa'o //
translated: May they be free from suffering!

original: kha cig na re bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po dang ldan par byed pa'i gnas yin pas tshangs pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po dang ldan par byed pa'i gnas yin pas tshangs pa'i gnas te /
translated: Some say: It is a state of Brahma because it is the state of possessing a great heap of merit.

original: de ltar byas pas bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na sems can rnam phan pa'i sems dang bde ba'i sems yod pas na /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // yang na sems can rnam phan pa'i sems dang bde ba'i sems yod pas na /
translated: Because merit increases by doing that.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya'o ;
translated: Or else, it is called a loving mind because it has a mind that benefits sentient beings and a mind that delights them.

original: / byams pa de yang nyon mongs pa rnams gsum gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dgra med pas na mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / byams pa de yang nyon mongs pa rnams gsum gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dgra med pas na mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that love is called non-hostile because it is the antidote to the three poisons.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni sems can bdag dang rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni sems can bdag dang rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa mnyam pa'am /
translated: The three poisons are the mind that is hostile to sentient beings, the mind that is hostile to oneself, and the mind that is hostile to qualities.

original: khyad zhugs pa gnod par byed pa la zhe sdang ba dang gnod par mi byed pa la phrag dog pa dang / dman pa de gnyi ga la zhe sdang ba'o //
analyzed: khyad zhugs pa gnod par byed pa la zhe sdang ba dang gnod par mi byed pa la phrag dog pa dang / dman pa de gnyi ga la zhe sdang ba'o //
translated: The special ones are: hatred for the one who harms, envy of the one who does not harm, and hatred for the one who is inferior.

original: de la sems can bdag pas rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa nyams pa'am khyad par can gnod par byed pa zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pas na dgra med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩsems @126a * //üîΩcan rigs dang yon tan la sogs pas mnyam pa'am khyad par can gnod par mi byed pa la phrag dog pa'i gnyen por gyur pas na mi mthun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems can bdag pas rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa nyams pa'am khyad par can gnod par byed pa zhe sdang gi gnyen por gyur pas na dgra med pa zhes bya'o // sems @126a * // can rigs dang yon tan la sogs pas mnyam pa'am khyad par can gnod par mi byed pa la phrag dog pa'i gnyen por gyur pas na mi mthun pa med pa'o //
translated: Among them, a sentient being who is inferior in terms of family, good qualities, etc., or who is superior and harms is the antidote to hatred. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúwithout enemies.‚ÄùüîΩA sentient being who is equal or superior in terms of family, good qualities, etc., and does not harm is the antidote to envy. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúwithout rivals.‚Äù

original: sems can rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa bdag pas dman pa la gnod par byed pa dang / gnod par mi byed pa gnyi ga la zhe sdang ba'i gnyen por gyur pas na gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa bdag pas dman pa la gnod par byed pa dang / gnod par mi byed pa gnyi ga la zhe sdang ba'i gnyen por gyur pas na gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: A sentient being who is inferior in terms of family, good qualities, etc., and both harms and does not harm is the antidote to hatred. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúwithout offense.‚Äù

original: byams pa de bsgoms na de'i 'bras bu chen po thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir yangs pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa de bsgoms na de'i 'bras bu chen po thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir yangs pa'o //
translated: It is vast because when one cultivates that love, one attains its great result.

original: byams pa'i sems yang gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan thob pa'i sar gtogs la /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems yang gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan thob pa'i sar gtogs la /
translated: The thought of loving kindness is also called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because it is associated with the stage of attainment of the meditations of the realm of form.

original: gzugs kyi khams thob pa'i sems kyi rgyud la 'byung bas na cher gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams thob pa'i sems kyi rgyud la 'byung bas na cher gyur pa'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because it occurs in the mental continuum of one who has attained the realm of form.

original: kha cig ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sar gtogs pas na cher gyur pa zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sar gtogs pas na cher gyur pa zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some explain that it is called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because it is associated with the stage of the formless realm.

original: dgra dang mdza' bar dbyer med pas na gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: dgra dang mdza' bar dbyer med pas na gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnondual‚Äù because it is not divided into friend and foe.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pas na tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pas na tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúimmeasurable‚Äù because it takes as its object immeasurable sentient beings of the desire realm.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las shin tu rgyal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las shin tu rgyal ba'i phyir /
translated: It is called ‚Äúwell cultivated‚Äù because it is victorious over the opposing side.

original: shin tu bsgom pa ste byams pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhe sdang ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu bsgom pa ste byams pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhe sdang ba'o //
translated: The opposing side to loving kindness is hatred.

original: de ltar na tshig de dag gis gnyen po dang 'bras bu dang sa dang dmigs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sems yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig de dag gis gnyen po dang 'bras bu dang sa dang dmigs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sems yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, these terms indicate the antidote, the result, the stage, the object, and the purification of the mind.

original: dgra med pa dang mi mthun pa med pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i tshig gsum gyis ni gnyen po dang bcas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra med pa dang mi mthun pa med pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i tshig gsum gyis ni gnyen po dang bcas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The three phrases ‚Äúwithout enemies, without adversaries, without harm‚Äù show that it is endowed with the antidote.

original: yangs pa zhes bya ba la 'bras bu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yangs pa zhes bya ba la 'bras bu bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúVast‚Äù shows the result.

original: cher gyur pa zhes bya bas sa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: cher gyur pa zhes bya bas sa bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat‚Äù shows the stage.

original: gnyis su med par gnyis su med pa dang / tshad med pa zhes bya bas dmigs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med par gnyis su med pa dang / tshad med pa zhes bya bas dmigs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNondual, nondifferentiated, immeasurable‚Äù shows the object.

original: shin tu bsgom pa zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu bsgom pa zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell cultivated‚Äù shows the purification.

original: phyogs gcig tu mos shing khyab par byas te bsgrubs nas gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu mos shing khyab par byas te bsgrubs nas gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúHe dwells having pervaded one direction with his thoughts of friendliness, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na ri la gnas pa'i rtsva dang shing tshig na ri tshig ces gnas kyi gnas pa ston pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na ri la gnas pa'i rtsva dang shing tshig na ri tshig ces gnas kyi gnas pa ston pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, when the grass and trees on a mountain burn, one says ‚Äúthe mountain burns.‚Äù

original: 'di la phyogs gcig gi gnas pa'i sems can dmigs par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di la phyogs gcig gi gnas pa'i sems can dmigs par byed pa bstan to //
translated: Here, the object is shown to be the sentient beings who dwell in one direction.

original: mos zhes bya bas mos pa yid la byed pa bstan gyi de kho na yid la byed pa ma yin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mos zhes bya bas mos pa yid la byed pa bstan gyi de kho na yid la byed pa ma yin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word with indicates attention to aspiration, not attention to reality, as before.

original: khyab par bya ste zhes bya bas dus @126b gcig tu dmigs par bya ba'i sems can thams cad la khyab par dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab par bya ste zhes bya bas dus @126b gcig tu dmigs par bya ba'i sems can thams cad la khyab par dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word pervading means pervading all sentient beings to be focused on simultaneously, meaning focused on all sentient beings.

original: bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi mngon du byas pa'am /
analyzed: bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi mngon du byas pa'am /
translated: Having accomplished means having manifested the four basic concentrations,

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid mngon du byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid mngon du byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: or having manifested the concentrations of love, etc.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshig gis skad cig ma gcig la gnas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshig gis skad cig ma gcig la gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The word abides does not mean abiding for one moment,

original: de'i rjes su rgyun du 'brang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rgyun du 'brang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but means following it continuously.

original: yang na tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi ni rim bzhin du bde ba yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bde ba dang mi 'bral bar rjes su mos pa'i mtshan nyid dang gsum char la btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi ni rim bzhin du bde ba yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bde ba dang mi 'bral bar rjes su mos pa'i mtshan nyid dang gsum char la btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: Or else, the four divine abodes are, in order: the characteristic of accomplishing happiness, the characteristic of engaging in removing suffering, the characteristic of being devoted to not being separated from happiness, and equanimity toward all three.

original: de la bde ba yang dag par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba yang dag par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni byams pa'o //
translated: Among them, the characteristic of accomplishing happiness is love.

original: sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni snying rje'o //
translated: The characteristic of engaging in removing suffering is compassion.

original: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar rjes su myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi 'bral bar rjes su myong ba'i mtshan nyid ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of being devoted to not being separated from happiness is joy.

original: rnam pa gsum char ltar mi 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum char ltar mi 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni btang snyoms so //
translated: The characteristic of not engaging in all three is equanimity.

original: tshad med bzhi las kyang je byams pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad med bzhi las kyang je byams pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, in order to teach love from among the four immeasurables,

original: 'di la dge slong dag dge slong byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong dag dge slong byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said here: ‚ÄúMonks, a monk with a mind possessing love‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: de la byams pa de sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i rnam par gnas pa yin pas na byams pa dang ldan pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la byams pa de sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i rnam par gnas pa yin pas na byams pa dang ldan pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that love is established in the form of benefiting sentient beings, it is called the abode of one who possesses love.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristic of benefit is twofold:

original: phan pa bsgrub pa dang / bde ba bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: phan pa bsgrub pa dang / bde ba bsgrub pa ste /
translated: the accomplishment of benefit and the accomplishment of happiness.

original: de'i don yang sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i don yang sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of that is as explained above.

original: sems kyi nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir na dgra med pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir na dgra med pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from the faults of the mind, it is without enemies.

original: sus kyang gnod par mi byed la bdag kyang su la yang gnod par mi byed la mi mthun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sus kyang gnod par mi byed la bdag kyang su la yang gnod par mi byed la mi mthun pa med pa'o //
translated: No one harms it, and it does not harm anyone. It is without opposition.

original: gnod par bya ba'i las mi byed pas na gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba'i las mi byed pas na gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: Since it does not perform the action of harming, it is harmless.

original: dmigs par bya ba'i yul rgya che bas na yangs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i yul rgya che bas na yangs pa'o //
translated: Since the objective domain of its focus is vast, it is vast.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i gtsor bsgrubs pas na rgya chen por 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i gtsor bsgrubs pas na rgya chen por 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Since it is primarily established in benefit and happiness, it is expansive.

original: cher gyur pa'i don ni gtsor bsgrub pa'i don to //
analyzed: cher gyur pa'i don ni gtsor bsgrub pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúexpansive‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúprimarily established.‚Äù

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang med pas na gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang med pas na gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from attachment and aversion, it is nondual.

original: de'i 'bras bu dpag tu med pa 'byung bas tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dpag tu med pa 'byung bas tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it produces immeasurable results.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rab tu rgyal bas na shin tu bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rab tu rgyal bas na shin tu bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is very cultivated because it is victorious over the adverse side.

original: phyogs @127a * //
analyzed: phyogs @127a * //
translated: In one direction,

original: gcig tu mos shing khyab par byas te zhes bya ba la zhe sdang med pas sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa'i mos pa 'byung phyogs gcig tu khyab par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig tu mos shing khyab par byas te zhes bya ba la zhe sdang med pas sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa'i mos pa 'byung phyogs gcig tu khyab par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means in one part. The meaning is that it arises as a part that is pervaded by the aspiration for non-hatred, the intention to benefit and gladden sentient beings.

original: bsgrubs nas gnas zhes bya bas ni byams pa dag par byas pa'am /
analyzed: bsgrubs nas gnas zhes bya bas ni byams pa dag par byas pa'am /
translated: Having established it, one dwells means that one dwells having purified or completed the loving kindness.

original: rdzogs par byas nas gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzogs par byas nas gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one dwells having completed it.

original: lhag ma rnams sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as explained above.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas kyi 'og tu lam bzhi bstan pas /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas kyi 'og tu lam bzhi bstan pas /
translated: After the stations of BrahmƒÅ, the four paths are taught.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas 'dri ba'i tshul du mgo drangs te bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas 'dri ba'i tshul du mgo drangs te bka' stsal pa /
translated: Desiring to explain them as they are taught, he introduces the question in the form of a question:

original: lam bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What are the four paths? and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir lam ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir lam ste /
translated: The path is for the purpose of attaining nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bsgrub pa'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bsgrub pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: for the purpose of attaining the state of nirvana.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs pa mngon par zhen pa yang yod ces bya ba ni lam dang po'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs pa mngon par zhen pa yang yod ces bya ba ni lam dang po'o //
translated: Therein, the first path is the path of suffering that is slow and has clear knowledge of sluggishness.

original: sdug bsngal gyi lam myur du mngon par shes pa yang yod ces bya ba ni lam gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi lam myur du mngon par shes pa yang yod ces bya ba ni lam gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second path is the path of suffering that is slow and has clear knowledge of swiftness.

original: bde ba'i lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa yang yod ces bya ba ni lam gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa yang yod ces bya ba ni lam gsum pa'o //
translated: The third path is the path of pleasure that is slow and has clear knowledge of sluggishness.

original: bde ba'i lam myur du mngon par shes pa yang yod ces bya ba ni lam bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i lam myur du mngon par shes pa yang yod ces bya ba ni lam bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth path is the path of pleasure that is slow and has clear knowledge of swiftness.üîΩTherein, the path of suffering that is slow and has clear knowledge of sluggishness is established as the path of suffering that is slow and has clear knowledge of sluggishness because the concentrations and formless states are respectively weak in serenity and insight.

original: de la mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzugs med pa dag ni rim bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong shas chung bas sdug bsngal gyi lam mngon par shes pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi lam myur du shes pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzugs med pa dag ni rim bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong shas chung bas sdug bsngal gyi lam mngon par shes pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi lam myur du shes pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The path of suffering that is slow and has clear knowledge of swiftness is established as the path of suffering that is slow and has clear knowledge of swiftness because the concentrations and formless states are respectively weak in serenity and insight.

original: nam dbang po rtul po rnams mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa na sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam dbang po rtul po rnams mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa na sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When dull faculties are not to be attained, and when one enters the meditative absorptions and formless [absorptions], it is called the path of suffering and the superknowledge of sluggishness.

original: nam dbang po rnon po rnams mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa na ni /
analyzed: nam dbang po rnon po rnams mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa na ni /
translated: When sharp faculties are not to be attained, and when one enters the meditative absorptions and formless [absorptions],

original: sdug bsngal gyi lam myur du mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi lam myur du mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o//
translated: it is called the path of suffering and the superknowledge of swiftness.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa na ni bde ba'i lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa dang / bde ba'i lam myur du mngon par shes par rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa na ni bde ba'i lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa dang / bde ba'i lam myur du mngon par shes par rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: When entering the four meditative absorptions of the form realm, it is established as the path of pleasure and the superknowledge of sluggishness in the path of pleasure, and the superknowledge of swiftness in the path of pleasure.

original: nam gang zag dbang po rtul po rnams gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms @127b par 'jug pa na ni bde ba'i rmongs pa mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam gang zag dbang po rtul po rnams gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms @127b par 'jug pa na ni bde ba'i rmongs pa mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When individuals with dull faculties enter the four meditative absorptions of the form realm, it is called the superknowledge of sluggishness in the path of pleasure.

original: nam dbang po rnon po gang zag rnams gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa na ni bde ba'i lam myur du mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam dbang po rnon po gang zag rnams gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par 'jug pa na ni bde ba'i lam myur du mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When those of sharp faculties enter into the four concentrations of the form realm, it is called the path of pleasure, the quick superknowledge.

original: lam dang po rgyas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam dang po rgyas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the first path in detail,

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs par mngon par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs par mngon par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: it is said, What is the path of suffering, the superknowledge of delusion?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams 'dir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams 'dir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here means in this desire realm.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni skyes bu la la zhig nam gang zag la la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni skyes bu la la zhig nam gang zag la la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Some means some person, some individual.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'dod chags bdo ba zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dod chags bdo ba zhes bya ba las /
translated: Naturally means by nature.üîΩWith strong desire means

original: bdo ba'i sgra ni 'dod chags shas che ba la bya ste /
analyzed: bdo ba'i sgra ni 'dod chags shas che ba la bya ste /
translated: the word strong refers to excessive desire.

original: 'dod pa'i dngos po chung du la yang lhag par chags pa dang / yang nas yang du 'dod chags kyi sems mngon du byed pa ni 'dod chags bdo ba'o //üîΩzhe sdang bdo ba yang zhe sdang shas che ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos po chung du la yang lhag par chags pa dang / yang nas yang du 'dod chags kyi sems mngon du byed pa ni 'dod chags bdo ba'o // zhe sdang bdo ba yang zhe sdang shas che ba ste /
translated: The predominance of passion is the excessive attachment to even the smallest desirable thing and the frequent manifestation of the mind of passion.

original: gnod pa dang nyes par byas pa'i shas chung yang 'khrug pa dang / gnod sems cher ldan zhing zhe sdang gi sems yang nas yang du rgyun du sems la 'byung ba ni zhe sdang bdo ba'o //üîΩgti mug bdo ba yang gti mug shas che ba ste /üîΩgang gi phyir gti mug shas che bas don bstan pa chung ste /
analyzed: gnod pa dang nyes par byas pa'i shas chung yang 'khrug pa dang / gnod sems cher ldan zhing zhe sdang gi sems yang nas yang du rgyun du sems la 'byung ba ni zhe sdang bdo ba'o // gti mug bdo ba yang gti mug shas che ba ste / gang gi phyir gti mug shas che bas don bstan pa chung ste /
translated: The predominance of aversion is the excessive aversion of a person who is given to harming and wrongdoing.

original: mi rtog pa'i gnas ma yin yang rtogs par mi nus pa ni gti mug bdo ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i gnas ma yin yang rtogs par mi nus pa ni gti mug bdo ba'o //
translated: The predominance of delusion is the excessive delusion of a person who is not capable of understanding even a small amount of the meaning that is taught, because of his excessive delusion.

original: de zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa gsum gyi shas che ba gsum gyi gang zag de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa gsum gyi shas che ba gsum gyi gang zag de'o //
translated: The person who is dominated by the three passions is one who is dominated by one of the three passions.

original: phyir zhing 'dod chags bdo bas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'i chags pa yang nas yang du 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir zhing 'dod chags bdo bas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'i chags pa yang nas yang du 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the predominance of passion‚Äù means that the person who is predominantly passionate is one in whom passion arises again and again.

original: 'dod chags las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba so sor myong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'i rgyu las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal ba so sor myong ba dang / sems mi bde ba la so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba so sor myong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'i rgyu las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal ba so sor myong ba dang / sems mi bde ba la so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHe experiences suffering and grief born of passion‚Äù means that he experiences suffering born of the cause of the predominance of passion, and he experiences mental unhappiness.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to hatred and delusion.

original: de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga la rmongs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas che bas shas che ba'i gang zag de 'phags pa'i dbang po zag pa med pa dad pa la sogs pa lnga la
analyzed: de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga la rmongs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas che bas shas che ba'i gang zag de 'phags pa'i dbang po zag pa med pa dad pa la sogs pa lnga la
translated: ‚ÄúHe is confused about the five supramundane faculties‚Äù means that the person who is predominantly passionate, hateful, or deluded is confused about the five supramundane faculties of faith, etc., which are the pure faculties of the noble disciples.

original: rmongs pa yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa yin te /
translated: He is confused about them.

original: dbang po @128a * //
analyzed: dbang po @128a * //
translated: The faculties of faith, etc.,

original: de lnga ste mthu chung ba dang stobs chung ba dang nyam chung ba yin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lnga ste mthu chung ba dang stobs chung ba dang nyam chung ba yin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These are the five: weak power, weak strength, and weak vigor.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The supramundane faculties are called the uncontaminated faculties.

original: gang thob par bya ba la mthu chung zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir zag pa zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang thob par bya ba la mthu chung zhe na / de'i phyir zag pa zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why are they weak in attaining?üîΩTherefore, it is said that they are weak in attaining the cessation of contaminants.

original: gang zag pa zad par thob par bya ba'i phyir de dag mthu chung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zag pa zad par thob par bya ba'i phyir de dag mthu chung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are weak in attaining the cessation of contaminants.

original: mthu chung ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩzhan pa dang myur du mi thob po //
analyzed: mthu chung ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir / zhan pa dang myur du mi thob po //
translated: In order to explain the meaning of weak,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said that they are slow and not swift.

original: dang po nyid du 'jug pa'i dus na yang myur du 'jug par mi nus pas na zhan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid du 'jug pa'i dus na yang myur du 'jug par mi nus pas na zhan pa'o //
translated: At the time of first entering, they are unable to enter swiftly, so they are slow.

original: bsgom pa'i dus na yang 'bras bu thob par mi nus pas na myur du mi thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i dus na yang 'bras bu thob par mi nus pas na myur du mi thob pa'o //
translated: Even at the time of cultivation, they are unable to attain the fruit, so they are not swift.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the five supramundane faculties, he says:

original: 'di ltar dad pa'i dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩdbang po lnga'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pa'i dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dbang po lnga'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: Thus, the faculty of faith, etc.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi skabs su zhib tu bstan to //üîΩde 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po de la zhan pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa gsum shas che ba'i gang zag de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga mthu chung bas nyon mongs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zad par bya
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi skabs su zhib tu bstan to // de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po de la zhan pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa gsum shas che ba'i gang zag de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga mthu chung bas nyon mongs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zad par bya
translated: The characteristics of the five faculties have been extensively taught in the section on the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: ba'i phyir / nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: ba'i phyir / nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: In regard to those supramundane faculties, the weak, etc., refers to the person in whom the three moral defilements predominate. Since the five supramundane faculties are weak, he enters into the meditative concentration which is immediately antecedent to the path of the abandonment of moral defilement for the purpose of eliminating the dharmas that are associated with moral defilement and which are subject to the influence of the contaminants.

original: ting nge 'dzin la myur du 'jug par mi nus pa ni sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la myur du 'jug par mi nus pa ni sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is unable to enter into meditative concentration quickly and this is described as the 'obstruction to direct intuition that is due to the path of suffering'.

original: don du na nyon mongs pa gsum gyi shas che bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga mthu chung zhing dbang po rtul lo //
analyzed: don du na nyon mongs pa gsum gyi shas che bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po lnga mthu chung zhing dbang po rtul lo //
translated: In fact, the five mundane faculties are weak and the faculties are dull because of the predominance of the three afflictions.

original: dbang po de dag gis mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mnyam par 'jog pa na sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po de dag gis mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mnyam par 'jog pa na sdug bsngal gyi lam rmongs pa mngon par shes pa ste /
translated: They are painful because they are not suitable for obtaining the unobtainable, the absorptions, the formless realm meditative attainments and the meditative development of the higher faculties, since one is confused about the path to their attainment when one is absorbed in meditative concentration.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar na ni yan lag bsdu ba med pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong shas chung bas bsgrims te bsgrub dgos pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yan lag tu bsdu ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan gyi bar na ni yan lag bsdu ba med pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong shas chung bas bsgrims te bsgrub dgos pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yan lag tu bsdu ba med pa dang /
translated: Why is this?

original: lhag mthong shas chung bas na bsgrims te bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong shas chung bas na bsgrims te bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: They are painful because they are not suitable for obtaining the unobtainable, the absorptions, since one must strive to achieve them by means of the absence of the inclusion of the branches, the weakness of calm abiding and insight. original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: yang na bsten pa dang / bsnyen pa dang / bsgom pa dang mang du byas pa tshig bzhir gzhag go //
translated: Alternatively, reliance, proximity, cultivation and frequent practice are established as four terms.

original: de nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po yang bzhi ste /

original: sgom pa'i lam ni mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam ni mngon du byas pa'o //

original: ci'i phyir bsgom zhe na /

analyzed: bar gnas pa ni tshe 'di la 'khrug pa med pa dang / zhi bar gnas pa ste /
