original: dper na smig rgyu ba chu ma yin yang chu 'dra bar snang bas chu 'dod pa'i mi dag de'i drung du 'ongs nas chu med par 'gyur bas gzhan slu bar byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu ba chu ma yin yang chu 'dra bar snang bas chu 'dod pa'i mi dag de'i drung du 'ongs nas chu med par 'gyur bas gzhan slu bar byed pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, a mirage is not water, but it appears as if it were water, and so it deceives people who want water and come to it, because there is no water there.

original: phung po 'di dag kyang bde ba dang / gtsang ba ma yin yang bde ba dang / gtsang ba lta bur snang bas sems can slu bar byed pa'i phyir stod par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po 'di dag kyang bde ba dang / gtsang ba ma yin yang bde ba dang / gtsang ba lta bur snang bas sems can slu bar byed pa'i phyir stod par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, these aggregates are not happiness and purity, but they appear as if they were happiness and purity, and so they deceive sentient beings.

original: chu skyes kyi shing ltar bshig na snying po med pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chu skyes kyi shing ltar bshig na snying po med pa zhes pa ni /
translated: They are like a plantain tree, which has no core.

original: dper na chu shing gi zlum po pags pa phyi shun re re nas bshig na phyi shun tsam las gzhan snying po med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na chu shing gi zlum po pags pa phyi shun re re nas bshig na phyi shun tsam las gzhan snying po med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if you peel away the outer skin of a plantain, one layer at a time, there is nothing but outer skin, and no core.

original: phung po 'di dag kyang re re nas bshig ste bsal na /
analyzed: phung po 'di dag kyang re re nas bshig ste bsal na /
translated: In the same way, if you peel away these aggregates, one by one,

original: dam pa'am snying po gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'am snying po gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is nothing at all that is real or a core.

original: sgyu ma lta bur slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are like an illusion, in that they deceive.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i glang po dang / mi'i glang po dang / mi ma yin pa'i glang po dang / mi 'dra bar snang bas sems can slu bar byed pa de bzhin du phung po lnga po dag la yang bdag gam sems can zhes bya ba med na /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i glang po dang / mi'i glang po dang / mi ma yin pa'i glang po dang / mi 'dra bar snang bas sems can slu bar byed pa de bzhin du phung po lnga po dag la yang bdag gam sems can zhes bya ba med na /
translated: Just as an illusory elephant, a real elephant, and a mental elephant appear differently and deceive sentient beings, in the same way, although there is no self or sentient being in the five aggregates,

original: bdag dang sems can lta bur snang bas sems can slu bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can lta bur snang bas sems can slu bar byed do //
translated: they appear as if they were a self or a sentient being and deceive sentient beings.

original: rgyal po ltar bka' mang ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal po ltar bka' mang ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a king with many orders.

original: dper na rgyal po bka' mang bas de'i bya ba mang du bsgrub dgos pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po bka' mang bas de'i bya ba mang du bsgrub dgos pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a king with many orders has to accomplish many tasks,

original: lus 'di yang de'i phyir bya ba mang po bsgrub dgos na /
analyzed: lus 'di yang de'i phyir bya ba mang po bsgrub dgos na /
translated: in the same way, this body has to accomplish many tasks.

original: rgyal po bka' mang po bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal po bka' mang po bzhin no //
translated: It is like a king with many orders.

original: dgra ltar glags lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgra ltar glags lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like an enemy, it looks for an opportunity.

original: dper na dgra bdag bsad pa dang / ma rung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na dgra bdag bsad pa dang / ma rung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as an enemy looks for an opportunity to kill you or to ruin you,

original: glags tshol ba bzhin du lus 'di yang dus thams cad du /
analyzed: glags tshol ba bzhin du lus 'di yang dus thams cad du /
translated: in the same way, this body always

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: looks for an opportunity to destroy the roots of virtue.

original: glags tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glags tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it seeks opportunities.üîΩLike a thief, it is untrustworthy.

original: rkun po ltar yid mi brtan pa zhes pa ni dper na rkun po 'di mi rku zhes de la yid brtan du mi rung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rkun po ltar yid mi brtan pa zhes pa ni dper na rkun po 'di mi rku zhes de la yid brtan du mi rung ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as one cannot rely on a thief, thinking, ‚ÄúThis thief will not steal,‚Äù

original: lus 'di yang 'di dang rtag par 'grogs so zhes yid brten du mi rung ste /
analyzed: lus 'di yang 'di dang rtag par 'grogs so zhes yid brten du mi rung ste /
translated: in the same way, one cannot rely on this body, thinking, ‚ÄúI will always be accompanied by this body.‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar skabs su 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar skabs su 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it will certainly destroy you at some point.

original: mi mdza' ba ltar gnod par sems pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mdza' ba ltar gnod par sems pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like an enemy, it is harmful.

original: @132a * // mi mdza' ba ni grogs po ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: @132a * // mi mdza' ba ni grogs po ma yin pa ste /
translated: An enemy is not a friend.

original: gang yid kyi sems mi mthun par gyur pa'o //üîΩji ltar mi mdza' bar bdag la phan par bya bar mi sems pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang yid kyi sems mi mthun par gyur pa'o // ji ltar mi mdza' bar bdag la phan par bya bar mi sems pa de bzhin du /
translated: It is someone whose mind is not in harmony with yours.üîΩJust as an enemy does not think, ‚ÄúI will benefit myself,‚Äù

original: lus 'di yang bdag la phan par bya bar mi sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di yang bdag la phan par bya bar mi sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the same way, this body does not think, ‚ÄúI will benefit myself.‚Äù

original: gshed ma ltar shes rab kyi 'tsho ba'i bar chad byed pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sems can gsod pa'i gshed po dag sems can gyi srog gi bar chad byed pa bzhin du lus 'dis kyang mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi srog gi bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gshed ma ltar shes rab kyi 'tsho ba'i bar chad byed pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sems can gsod pa'i gshed po dag sems can gyi srog gi bar chad byed pa bzhin du lus 'dis kyang mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi srog gi bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLike an executioner, it is an obstacle to the life of wisdom‚Äù means that just as executioners are an obstacle to the life of sentient beings, this body is an obstacle to the life of wisdom, which consists of listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: grong stong pa ltar bcud med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grong stong pa ltar bcud med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúLike an empty village, it is without essence‚Äù means that

original: dper na grong stong pa na mi dang phyugs dang rdzas kyi bcud med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na grong stong pa na mi dang phyugs dang rdzas kyi bcud med pa bzhin du /
translated: just as an empty village has no essence of people, animals, or goods,

original: phung po lnga'i nang na yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi bcud phung po gang la yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i nang na yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi bcud phung po gang la yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so also in the five aggregates there is no essence of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: rdza mkhan gyi snod ltar 'jig pa la thug pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi snod ltar 'jig pa la thug pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúLike a potter‚Äôs vessel, it is subject to destruction‚Äù means that

original: dper na rdza mkhan gyi snod kham phor dang bum pa mthar chag pa dang / 'jig pa 'byung ba bzhin du phung po skyes pa 'di mtha' yang mjug tu gnas pa med kyi 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na rdza mkhan gyi snod kham phor dang bum pa mthar chag pa dang / 'jig pa 'byung ba bzhin du phung po skyes pa 'di mtha' yang mjug tu gnas pa med kyi 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, just as a potter's vessels, such as dishes and pots, eventually break and are destroyed, so also this body, once born, will eventually cease to exist, for its destruction will occur.

original: bang ba ltar mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bang ba ltar mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a granary, it is filled with various impurities.

original: dper na mi gtsang ba'i snod dang gnas gcin skyugs la sogs pa mi gtsang ba mang pos gang ba bzhin du lus 'di la yang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa sna tshogs kyis gang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na mi gtsang ba'i snod dang gnas gcin skyugs la sogs pa mi gtsang ba mang pos gang ba bzhin du lus 'di la yang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa sna tshogs kyis gang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, just as a container for filth and a place for urine and vomit are filled with much filth, so also this body is filled with various impurities.

original: glum snod ltar mi gtsang ba 'dzag pa dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: glum snod ltar mi gtsang ba 'dzag pa dang zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a sack for grain, it oozes impurities.

original: ji ltar glum snod las glum gyi khu ba 'dzag pa bzhin du lus 'di las kyang snabs dang / mchil ma la sogs pa'i mi gtsang ba 'dzag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar glum snod las glum gyi khu ba 'dzag pa bzhin du lus 'di las kyang snabs dang / mchil ma la sogs pa'i mi gtsang ba 'dzag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as grain juice oozes from a sack for grain, so also impurities such as mucus and saliva ooze from this body.

original: sbrul dang mi dang khyi dang ro ltar dri mi zhim pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbrul dang mi dang khyi dang ro ltar dri mi zhim pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a snake, a human being, a dog, and a corpse, it has a bad smell.

original: dper na sbrul gyi ro dang mi ro dang khyi ro rul pa dri mi zhim pa bzhin du lus 'di las kyang dri mi zhim pa rgyun du ldang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na sbrul gyi ro dang mi ro dang khyi ro rul pa dri mi zhim pa bzhin du lus 'di las kyang dri mi zhim pa rgyun du ldang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, this body is like a corpse of a snake, a human, or a dog, because it constantly emits a foul smell.

original: phyi sa khung ltar mi gtsang ba'i 'byung khung zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyi sa khung ltar mi gtsang ba'i 'byung khung zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a latrine, it is a source of impurities.

original: dper na snabs phyis la sogs pa mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na snabs phyis la sogs pa mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, various kinds of impurities such as mucus come out of a latrine.

original: lus 'di las kyang mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i 'byung khung byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di las kyang mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i 'byung khung byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, this body is the source of various kinds of impurities.

original: rma ltar bskyod pa mi bzod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rma ltar bskyod pa mi bzod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a wound, it cannot bear to be touched.

original: dper na rma kha 'bye ba yang gzung ba dang mnye ba la sogs pas bskyod na na ba bzhin du lus 'di yang dbyug pa la sogs pa cung @132b zad kyis phog na yang gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na rma kha 'bye ba yang gzung ba dang mnye ba la sogs pas bskyod na na ba bzhin du lus 'di yang dbyug pa la sogs pa cung @132b zad kyis phog na yang gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, if one touches a wound that is open, it hurts. In the same way, this body is harmed even by a slight blow with a stick, and so on.

original: zug rngu ltar gnod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zug rngu ltar gnod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a dart, it causes pain.

original: dper na zug rngu zug na ji srid du zug rngu de ma phyung ste /
analyzed: dper na zug rngu zug na ji srid du zug rngu de ma phyung ste /
translated: For example, as long as a painful thorn has not been extracted,

original: 'grogs kyi bar du rtag tu gnod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'grogs kyi bar du rtag tu gnod pa bzhin du /
translated: it will always cause harm.

original: lus 'di dang ji srid 'grogs kyi bar du yang gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrje bo mi srun pa ltar rim gro bya dka' ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus 'di dang ji srid 'grogs kyi bar du yang gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro // rje bo mi srun pa ltar rim gro bya dka' ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the same way, as long as one is accompanied by this body, it will cause harm.üîΩIt is difficult to please, like an unruly master.

original: dper na rje bo mi bgrungs pa ji ltar rim gro byas kyang mgu bar dka' ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rje bo mi bgrungs pa ji ltar rim gro byas kyang mgu bar dka' ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, no matter how much one serves an unruly master, it is difficult to please him.

original: phung po 'di yang dngos po gang gis sten cing rim gro byas kyang mgu zhing chog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po 'di yang dngos po gang gis sten cing rim gro byas kyang mgu zhing chog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, no matter what one does to serve the aggregates, one is never satisfied.

original: khyim zhig pa ltar bcos dka' ba dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khyim zhig pa ltar bcos dka' ba dang zhes pa ni /
translated: It is difficult to repair, like a dilapidated house.

original: dper na khyim rnying pa zhig na slar gso zhing bcos dka' la phyogs gar bcos kyang /
analyzed: dper na khyim rnying pa zhig na slar gso zhing bcos dka' la phyogs gar bcos kyang /
translated: For example, an old house is difficult to repair and restore.

original: phyogs gzhan du zhig pa bzhin du /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan du zhig pa bzhin du /
translated: No matter how much one repairs it in one place, it collapses in another.

original: lus 'di yang rtag tu kha zas dang skom gyis gso dka' zhing bar 'ga' gsos kyang mi mthun pa'i kha zas dang phrad na dus gzhan du 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di yang rtag tu kha zas dang skom gyis gso dka' zhing bar 'ga' gsos kyang mi mthun pa'i kha zas dang phrad na dus gzhan du 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This body is also difficult to nourish with food and drink, and even if it is nourished, it will perish at another time if it encounters incompatible food.

original: rdza ma bcos pa ltar dka' ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdza ma bcos pa ltar dka' ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Like an unfired clay pot, it is difficult to protect.

original: ji ltar rdza mkhan gyis snod so ma btang ba bsrung dka' ste cung zad cig bskyod na 'chag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rdza mkhan gyis snod so ma btang ba bsrung dka' ste cung zad cig bskyod na 'chag pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a potter has difficulty protecting a vessel that has not been fired, and if it is moved even slightly it breaks,

original: lus 'di yang cung zad cig gi rkyen gyis 'jig pas na bsrung dka' ba'o //
analyzed: lus 'di yang cung zad cig gi rkyen gyis 'jig pas na bsrung dka' ba'o //
translated: so this body is difficult to protect because it perishes due to slight conditions.

original: grogs po mi srun pa ltar rtag par bsrung dgos pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: grogs po mi srun pa ltar rtag par bsrung dgos pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Like an unruly friend, it must be constantly guarded.

original: grogs po mi bgrungs pa rtag tu bsrung dgos te /
analyzed: grogs po mi bgrungs pa rtag tu bsrung dgos te /
translated: An unruly friend must be constantly guarded,

original: rtag tu yid ma bsrungs na cung zad cig gis kyang mi dga' bar 'gyur zhing ring du 'phangs pa de bzhin du phung po 'di yang rtag tu ma bsrungs na 'tsho ba'i bar chad du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: rtag tu yid ma bsrungs na cung zad cig gis kyang mi dga' bar 'gyur zhing ring du 'phangs pa de bzhin du phung po 'di yang rtag tu ma bsrungs na 'tsho ba'i bar chad du gyur pa'am /
translated: because if the mind is not constantly protected, it becomes displeased even by slight things and is cast far away. In the same way, if this body is not constantly protected, it becomes an obstacle to life.

original: lus dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it will be separated from the body.

original: chu 'gram gyi shing ltar g-yo zhing 'gul ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chu 'gram gyi shing ltar g-yo zhing 'gul ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a tree on the bank of a river, it moves and shakes.

original: dper na chu 'gram gyi shing g-yo zhing mi brtan pa ste /
analyzed: dper na chu 'gram gyi shing g-yo zhing mi brtan pa ste /
translated: For example, a tree on the bank of a river moves and is unstable.

original: nam zhig ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nam zhig ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: At some point it will fall down

original: chus khyer bar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: chus khyer bar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: and be carried away by the water.

original: phung po 'di yang 'jig pa la gnas pas mi brtan pa ste /
analyzed: phung po 'di yang 'jig pa la gnas pas mi brtan pa ste /
translated: In the same way, this body is unstable because it is situated in a state of destruction.

original: mthar mi rtag pa'i chu bos khyer bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar mi rtag pa'i chu bos khyer bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the end, it will be carried away by the river of impermanence.

original: 'bab chu chen po'i rgyun ltar 'chi ba'i rgya mtsho la thug pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'bab chu chen po'i rgyun ltar 'chi ba'i rgya mtsho la thug pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Like the current of a great river, it ends in the ocean of death.

original: dper na 'bab chu'i rgyun mjug tu rgya mtsho chen por thug pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'bab chu'i rgyun mjug tu rgya mtsho chen por thug pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, the current of a river ends in the great ocean.

original: phung po'i skad cig ma'i chu bo'i rgyun 'di la yang mthar 'chi ba'i rgya mtsho la thug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbla thabs su 'ongs pa'i khyim @133a * //
analyzed: phung po'i skad cig ma'i chu bo'i rgyun 'di la yang mthar 'chi ba'i rgya mtsho la thug pa'i phyir ro // bla thabs su 'ongs pa'i khyim @133a * //
translated: In the same way, this current of the moments of the aggregates ends in the ocean of death.

original: ltar sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gnas shes pa ni /
analyzed: ltar sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gnas shes pa ni /
translated: Like a house that has come to the end of its life, it is the abode of all suffering.

original: dper na glo bur ba'i khyim du byas pa de na mal stan dang kha zas med pas /
analyzed: dper na glo bur ba'i khyim du byas pa de na mal stan dang kha zas med pas /
translated: For example, in a temporary home there are no beds or food.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, a house that is not inhabited is a place of suffering because it has no beds or food.

original: phung po 'di dag kyang bde ba med kyi /
analyzed: phung po 'di dag kyang bde ba med kyi /
translated: In the same way, these aggregates are not happy.

original: skye rga na 'chi dang ldan pas sdug bsngal kun gyi gnas so //
analyzed: skye rga na 'chi dang ldan pas sdug bsngal kun gyi gnas so //
translated: Since they are endowed with birth, aging, sickness, and death, they are the abode of all suffering.

original: skyabs med pa'i gnas ltar kun ma bzung ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: skyabs med pa'i gnas ltar kun ma bzung ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a place without a protector, they are not taken care of.

original: dper na bdag pos ma bzung ba'i lam srang ngam bzhi mdo dag tu 'dron po'i don du brtsigs pa'i khang khyim 'chos pa'i bdag po med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bdag pos ma bzung ba'i lam srang ngam bzhi mdo dag tu 'dron po'i don du brtsigs pa'i khang khyim 'chos pa'i bdag po med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a road or a crossroads that is not owned by anyone, or a house built for the benefit of travelers in a place that is not owned by anyone, is not taken care of by anyone.

original: lus 'di la yang phan par byed pa'i grogs po dang skyabs byed pa'i bdag po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di la yang phan par byed pa'i grogs po dang skyabs byed pa'i bdag po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, this body has no friend who would take care of it or a master who would protect it.

original: btson bsrung ltar gsug chud pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: btson bsrung ltar gsug chud pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a prisoner, it is a burden.

original: dper na btson bsrung gsug gis mgu na btson gtong bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na btson bsrung gsug gis mgu na btson gtong bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a prisoner is released when he is satisfied with the reward he has received.

original: lus 'di yang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten pa ste /
analyzed: lus 'di yang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten pa ste /
translated: In the same way, this body is sustained by the five sense pleasures.

original: mgu na dge ba'i rtsa ba gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgu na dge ba'i rtsa ba gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when it is satisfied, it gives up the roots of virtue.

original: yang na brtson bsrung gsug cung zad kyis mgu bar dka' ba bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na brtson bsrung gsug cung zad kyis mgu bar dka' ba bzhin du /
translated: Or, just as it is difficult to satisfy with a little the one who guards and protects his effort,

original: lus 'di yang bde ba cung zad tsam gyis mgu bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di yang bde ba cung zad tsam gyis mgu bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: so it is difficult to satisfy this body with a little pleasure.

original: mtha' khob kyi grong ltar rtag par gtses pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mtha' khob kyi grong ltar rtag par gtses pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a border-town, it is always beset.

original: dper na yul mtha' khob kyi grong 'joms pa dang 'phrog pa'i dgra mang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na yul mtha' khob kyi grong 'joms pa dang 'phrog pa'i dgra mang ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as a border-town is beset by many enemies who destroy and plunder,

original: lus 'di yang nang gi gnod pa nad la sogs pa dang / phyi'i gnod pa grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di yang nang gi gnod pa nad la sogs pa dang / phyi'i gnod pa grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: so this body is beset by many inner and outer harms, such as disease and cold and heat.

original: bye ma'i grong khyer 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye ma'i grong khyer 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a city of gandharvas, it is doomed to destruction.

original: dper na bye ma'i khyim mi brtan cin 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa bzhin du phung po 'di yang skad cig mas 'jig cing mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na bye ma'i khyim mi brtan cin 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa bzhin du phung po 'di yang skad cig mas 'jig cing mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as a city of gandharvas is by nature unstable and doomed to destruction, so this body is by nature unstable and doomed to destruction, moment by moment.

original: me ltar chog mi shes pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: me ltar chog mi shes pa zhes pa ni /
translated: It is like a fire, insatiable.

original: dper na me bsreg pa'i dngos por ci bcug kyang chog pa med de kun sreg par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na me bsreg pa'i dngos por ci bcug kyang chog pa med de kun sreg par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a fire is never satisfied with the things it burns,

original: lus 'di la yang tshva chu 'thung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: lus 'di la yang tshva chu 'thung ba bzhin du /
translated: so too is this body,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga spyad pa la chog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga spyad pa la chog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for there is no satisfaction in the enjoyment of the five senses, just as there is no satisfaction in drinking salt water.

original: rgya mtsho ltar rgal dka' ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rgya mtsho ltar rgal dka' ba zhes pa ni /
translated: It is like an ocean, difficult to cross.

original: dper na rgya mtsho chen po chu srin la sogs pa'i gnod pa mang bas mthar phyin par dka' ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho chen po chu srin la sogs pa'i gnod pa mang bas mthar phyin par dka' ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the great ocean is difficult to reach the other side of because of the many dangers of sea monsters and so forth,

original: lus 'di la yang nyon mongs pa'i gdug pa mang po dang ldan pas spang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di la yang nyon mongs pa'i gdug pa mang po dang ldan pas spang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: so too is this body difficult to get rid of because it is full of the many dangers of the afflictions.

original: sbrul gyi snod ltar nan tan du spang bar bya ba zhes @133b pa ni /üîΩdper na sbrul gdug pa'i 'jigs pa las 'dzem pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: sbrul gyi snod ltar nan tan du spang bar bya ba zhes @133b pa ni / dper na sbrul gdug pa'i 'jigs pa las 'dzem pa rnams kyis /
translated: It is like a snake‚Äôs nest, to be carefully avoided.üîΩJust as those who fear the danger of poisonous snakes

original: de'i gnod pa dang mi phrad par bya ba'i phyir sbrul gdug pa'i snod ring du spang bar bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i gnod pa dang mi phrad par bya ba'i phyir sbrul gdug pa'i snod ring du spang bar bya ba bzhin du /
translated: avoid the snakes‚Äô nests in order to avoid their harm,üîΩso too

original: skye rga na 'chi'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa rnams kyi phung po 'di ring du spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye rga na 'chi'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa rnams kyi phung po 'di ring du spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this body is to be abandoned for a long time by those who fear the suffering of birth, old age, sickness, and death.

original: byis pa gzhon nu ltar rtag par bsrung dgos pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byis pa gzhon nu ltar rtag par bsrung dgos pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a young child, it must always be guarded.

original: dper na byis pa chung du rtag par ma bsrungs na mer 'jug pa'am /üîΩg-yang du lhung ba'am /
analyzed: dper na byis pa chung du rtag par ma bsrungs na mer 'jug pa'am / g-yang du lhung ba'am /
translated: For example, if a small child is not always guarded, he will touch fire,üîΩfall into a ravine,

original: mtshon gyis zug par gyur pas /
analyzed: mtshon gyis zug par gyur pas /
translated: or be pierced by a weapon.

original: rtag tu bsrung dgos pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rtag tu bsrung dgos pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, it must always be guarded.

original: lus 'di yang dbang po'i sgo rnams yul la mi 'jug pa'i tshul du ma bsrungs na nyon mongs pa'i mtshon la sogs pa zug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di yang dbang po'i sgo rnams yul la mi 'jug pa'i tshul du ma bsrungs na nyon mongs pa'i mtshon la sogs pa zug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, if this body is not guarded by not engaging the doors of the senses in objects, it will be pierced by the weapons of the afflictions and so forth.

original: snod chag pa ltar rtag par spangs pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: snod chag pa ltar rtag par spangs pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a broken vessel, it must always be abandoned.

original: dper na snod chag pa'i nang du rtag tu chu mi gnas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na snod chag pa'i nang du rtag tu chu mi gnas pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, water does not remain in a broken vessel.

original: lnga phung 'dir yang rtag tu dge ba mi gnas shing 'dzag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga phung 'dir yang rtag tu dge ba mi gnas shing 'dzag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, virtue does not remain in this body-aggregate and it leaks out.

original: yang na dper na snod chag pa yang rtag tu yang phyir 'dor ba bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na dper na snod chag pa yang rtag tu yang phyir 'dor ba bzhin du /
translated: Or, just as a broken vessel is always to be discarded,

original: phung po lnga dag kyang 'phags pa mkhas pa rnams kyis rtag tu 'dor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga dag kyang 'phags pa mkhas pa rnams kyis rtag tu 'dor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so the five aggregates are always to be discarded by the wise noble ones.

original: yul ngan pa ltar rtag par gtses pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yul ngan pa ltar rtag par gtses pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a bad country, it is always to be harassed.

original: dper na yul ngan pas dpon po dang bdag po med pa la 'tshe bar byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na yul ngan pas dpon po dang bdag po med pa la 'tshe bar byed pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a bad country is always to be harassed by the absence of a ruler or master,

original: lus 'di la nad kyi dgras 'tshe ba mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di la nad kyi dgras 'tshe ba mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: so this body is always to be harassed by the enemy of disease.

original: yang na yul ngan pa bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad du mi ldan pas rtag tu yang gnod pa dang / phongs pas gtses pa bzhin du lus 'di la yang 'dod pa mi rnyed pa dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang mdza' ba dang bral ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis rtag tu gtses pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na yul ngan pa bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad du mi ldan pas rtag tu yang gnod pa dang / phongs pas gtses pa bzhin du lus 'di la yang 'dod pa mi rnyed pa dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang mdza' ba dang bral ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis rtag tu gtses pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, just as a bad country is always to be harassed by the harm and poverty of lacking necessities such as food and clothing, so this body is always to be harassed by the suffering of not obtaining what is desired, encountering the undesirable, and being separated from the desirable.

original: kha zas dug can ltar spang bar bya ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kha zas dug can ltar spang bar bya ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Like poisoned food, it is to be rejected.

original: dper na dug dang bcas pa'i kha zas zos na lus la gnod pa sna tshogs 'byung bas spang bar bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dug dang bcas pa'i kha zas zos na lus la gnod pa sna tshogs 'byung bas spang bar bya ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, if one eats food that is mixed with poison, it will harm the body in various ways, so it should be abandoned.

original: lus 'di yang mkhas pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di yang mkhas pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the wise should abandon this body.

original: snod brnyes pa ltar skad cig gcig la dgos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snod brnyes pa ltar skad cig gcig la dgos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is needed for only an instant, like a vessel that is obtained.

original: dper na snod gzhan las brnyes par skad cig gcig yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: dper na snod gzhan las brnyes par skad cig gcig yod par zad kyi /
translated: For example, a vessel is obtained from another vessel and it lasts for only an instant.

original: dus thams cad du phan pa med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dus thams cad du phan pa med pa bzhin du /
translated: It is not helpful at all times.

original: lus 'di chos byed pa na dgos pa tsam du zad @134a * //
analyzed: lus 'di chos byed pa na dgos pa tsam du zad @134a * //
translated: In the same way, when one practices the Dharma, this body is only needed for that.

original: kyi ; de las ma gtogs pa'i dus thams cad du dgos pa med bya'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi ; de las ma gtogs pa'i dus thams cad du dgos pa med bya'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not needed at all times except for that.

original: de ltar mod kyi lus 'di thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mod kyi lus 'di thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pa ma yin te /
translated: However, this body is not abandoned in every way.

original: dper na shing las shing rta byas shing so sor dgos pa med kyang shing rtar byas na /
analyzed: dper na shing las shing rta byas shing so sor dgos pa med kyang shing rtar byas na /
translated: For example, a chariot is made from wood, and each piece is not needed separately. But if the chariot is made,

original: khal dgal bar dgos pa bzhin du lus 'di la gong du brtag pa'i tshul du so sor bshig na dgos pa med kyang /
analyzed: khal dgal bar dgos pa bzhin du lus 'di la gong du brtag pa'i tshul du so sor bshig na dgos pa med kyang /
translated: Just as a load is needed for an animal, so too this body, when it is destroyed part by part in the manner described above, is not needed.

original: chos spyad pa'i khal dgal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: chos spyad pa'i khal dgal ba'i phyir //
translated: But it is needed for carrying the load of Dharma practice.

original: de'i don du gtang bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du gtang bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not to be given up for the sake of that.

original: de bas na chos kyi sems 'ba' zhig tu gzung bar bya zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi sems 'ba' zhig tu gzung bar bya zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, one should hold only the thought of Dharma.

original: de bas na lus 'di chos spyad par dgos pa'i sems kyis de tsam gyi don 'ba' zhig tu bzung bar zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na lus 'di chos spyad par dgos pa'i sems kyis de tsam gyi don 'ba' zhig tu bzung bar zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that this body is held only for the sake of that thought which is needed for practicing the Dharma.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spang bar bsgom pa rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spang bar bsgom pa rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Another alternative for the meditation on the abandonment of attachment to sense objects is taught:

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, monks,

original: de'i don ni lus dang po'i rgyu dang tha ma'i rgyu brtag pa'i sgo nas nan tan gyis bshig nas /
analyzed: de'i don ni lus dang po'i rgyu dang tha ma'i rgyu brtag pa'i sgo nas nan tan gyis bshig nas /
translated: The meaning is that by diligently destroying the body through the analysis of its initial and final causes,

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one will abandon attachment to sense objects.

original: 'di lus tsam du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lus tsam du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This body is just so much filth means

original: lus 'di snga phyi gnyis kyang mi gtsang ba las gyur pa tsam mam /
analyzed: lus 'di snga phyi gnyis kyang mi gtsang ba las gyur pa tsam mam /
translated: that this body is just so much filth, whether it is the two, past and future, orüîΩwhether it is just the nature of filth.üîΩThis is the meaning of the word

original: mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin tsam du rtag par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin tsam du rtag par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: just.

original: ji ltar rtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag ce na /
translated: How is it just so much filth?

original: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i rgyu rtag ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i rgyu rtag ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it says, The cause of the past and the future is always the same.

original: lus 'di rgyu snga ma gang yin pa dang / phyi ma'i rgyu gang yin pa dag kyang mi gtsang ba nyid las gyur pas rtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus 'di rgyu snga ma gang yin pa dang / phyi ma'i rgyu gang yin pa dag kyang mi gtsang ba nyid las gyur pas rtag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cause of this body is always the same, whether it is the past cause or the future cause, because it is just so much filth.

original: lus kyi snga ma'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: lus kyi snga ma'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to demonstrate the past cause of the body, it says,

original: pha ma'i khu ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pha ma'i khu ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: semen and blood of the parents, etc.

original: lus 'di snga ma'i rgyu ni pha'i khu ba dang ma'i khrag yin te /
analyzed: lus 'di snga ma'i rgyu ni pha'i khu ba dang ma'i khrag yin te /
translated: The past cause of this body is the semen of the father and the blood of the mother.

original: dang por yang mi gtsang ba'i rgyu las gyur pa rtag go //
analyzed: dang por yang mi gtsang ba'i rgyu las gyur pa rtag go //
translated: From the beginning, it is just so much filth.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the future cause, it says,

original: phyi ma'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir kha zas 'ju ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir kha zas 'ju ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the digestion of food, etc.

original: lus 'di skyed pa'i rgyu phyi ma'i kha zas zos pas zhu ba ste /üîΩstsogs pa'i sgra ni kha zas rnams zhu nas gnas gcig na gcig tu ji ltar rgyu ba /
analyzed: lus 'di skyed pa'i rgyu phyi ma'i kha zas zos pas zhu ba ste / stsogs pa'i sgra ni kha zas rnams zhu nas gnas gcig na gcig tu ji ltar rgyu ba /
translated: digested.üîΩThe words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the statements in the sutras about how

original: mdo las gsungs pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: the food is digested and how it is transformed into a single substance.

original: bsdu ba'i don bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i don bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the summary, the text says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe food that is eaten by mouthfuls, immediately after it is eaten,

original: zas kham gyis za ba zos ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs @134b pa gsungs te /üîΩkha zas kham gyis zos pa ste /üîΩzos ma thag tu de dang por je bad kan gyi gnas su 'gro'o //
analyzed: zas kham gyis za ba zos ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs @134b pa gsungs te / kha zas kham gyis zos pa ste / zos ma thag tu de dang por je bad kan gyi gnas su 'gro'o //
translated: goes into the stomach.‚ÄùüîΩThe food that is eaten by mouthfuls, immediately after it is eaten, firstüîΩgoes into the stomach.

original: bad kan gyi gnas su song ba dang bad kan gyis sla bar byas nas /
analyzed: bad kan gyi gnas su song ba dang bad kan gyis sla bar byas nas /
translated: After it goes into the stomach, it is softened by the phlegm.üîΩOtherwise, it would be transformed into a liquid that has the characteristics

original: gzhan du na bad kan dang 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khu bar gyur pa mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te ;
analyzed: gzhan du na bad kan dang 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khu bar gyur pa mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te ;
translated: of a mixture of phlegm and bile, and it would be impure.

original: bad kan gyi gnas su zhu ba dang de nas mkhris pa'i gnas su 'gro'o //
analyzed: bad kan gyi gnas su zhu ba dang de nas mkhris pa'i gnas su 'gro'o //
translated: After it is digested in the stomach, it goes to the place of bile.

original: de nas mkhris pa'i gnas su phyin pa dang / de dag smin cing chos nas 'ju zhing skyur por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mkhris pa'i gnas su phyin pa dang / de dag smin cing chos nas 'ju zhing skyur por 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having reached the place of bile, they are ripened and digested, becoming sour.

original: skyur por gyur ba dang / rlung gi gnas su 'gro'o //
analyzed: skyur por gyur ba dang / rlung gi gnas su 'gro'o //
translated: Having become sour, they go to the place of wind.

original: bad kan gyi gnas nas zhu nas rlung gi gnas su phyin pa dang ; rlung gis de rnams tha dad par 'byed de /
analyzed: bad kan gyi gnas nas zhu nas rlung gi gnas su phyin pa dang ; rlung gis de rnams tha dad par 'byed de /
translated: Having been digested in the place of phlegm, they reach the place of wind, and the wind separates them.

original: snyigs ma logs shig tu khu ba logs shig tu 'byed do //
analyzed: snyigs ma logs shig tu khu ba logs shig tu 'byed do //
translated: The waste is separated from the juice.

original: de la snyigs ma logs shig tu phye ba las ni gcin rkyag la sogs pa dri mar 'gyur /üîΩkhu ba dang snying po las ni khrag tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de la snyigs ma logs shig tu phye ba las ni gcin rkyag la sogs pa dri mar 'gyur / khu ba dang snying po las ni khrag tu 'gyur /
translated: From the waste, urine, feces, and so forth arise, which are impure.üîΩFrom the juice and the essence, blood arises.

original: khrag las shar 'gyur /üîΩsha las tshil du 'gyur /
analyzed: khrag las shar 'gyur / sha las tshil du 'gyur /
translated: From blood, flesh arises.üîΩFrom flesh, fat arises.

original: tshil las rus par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshil las rus par 'gyur /
translated: From fat, bones arise.

original: rus pa las rkang du 'gyur /
analyzed: rus pa las rkang du 'gyur /
translated: From bones, marrow arises.

original: rkang las slar khu chu la sogs pa mi gtsang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkang las slar khu chu la sogs pa mi gtsang bar 'gyur te /
translated: From marrow, semen and so forth arise, which are impure.

original: de ltar lus 'di dang po dang mjug tu yang rgyu mi gtsang ba las gyur pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar lus 'di dang po dang mjug tu yang rgyu mi gtsang ba las gyur pa yin pas na /
translated: Thus, since this body is initially and finally produced from impure causes,

original: lus 'di mi gtsang bar lta zhing bsam mo zhes dge slong dag la bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lus 'di mi gtsang bar lta zhing bsam mo zhes dge slong dag la bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the monks, You should view and contemplate this body as impure.

original: gzhan yang mi gtsang ba'i tshogs kyis bstan pa cam du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi gtsang ba'i tshogs kyis bstan pa cam du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach that it is a collection of impurities,

original: lus 'di ni rus pa dgu brgya rtsa drug gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus 'di ni rus pa dgu brgya rtsa drug gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, This body is supported and held up by nine hundred bones and so on.

original: ji ltar khang pa ka bas brten zhing bteg pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar khang pa ka bas brten zhing bteg pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a house is supported and held up by pillars,

original: lus 'di yang rus pa dgu brgya rtsa drug gis brten zhing bteg pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di yang rus pa dgu brgya rtsa drug gis brten zhing bteg pa'o //
translated: in the same way, this body is supported and held up by nine hundred bones and six.

original: shing ngan pa'i khyim ltar zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: shing ngan pa'i khyim ltar zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of like a house made of bad wood is as follows:

original: dper na shing ngan pa las byas pa'i khang pa mthud ma 'brel ba'i mtshams mang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shing ngan pa las byas pa'i khang pa mthud ma 'brel ba'i mtshams mang ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as a house made of bad wood has many joints that are not well connected,

original: lus 'di yang rus pa mang po sbrel ba'i mtshams mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'di yang rus pa mang po sbrel ba'i mtshams mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in the same way, this body has many joints that connect many bones.

original: rtsa mang pos zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: rtsa mang pos zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of many sinews is as follows:

original: dper na khang pa la dral bu mang po bres pa dang ldan pa bzhin hes bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na khang pa la dral bu mang po bres pa dang ldan pa bzhin hes bzhin du /
translated: Just as a house is endowed with many crossbeams,üîΩin the same way, this body is endowed with many sinews that connect the bones.

original: lus 'di la rtsa mang po bzhi brgyas so sor dral bu bzhin du bres pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus 'di la rtsa mang po bzhi brgyas so sor dral bu bzhin du bres pa'i don to //
translated: This means that there are many channels in this body, which are woven like a net with four hundred individual strands.üîΩIt is covered with five hundred pieces of meat.

original: de la dran pa srung bar byed pa ni dang po nas dbang po dang / sems rnams yul la mi 'jug par sdom pa dang / yul la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par byed pa ni yul la zhugs nas yang /
analyzed: de la dran pa srung bar byed pa ni dang po nas dbang po dang / sems rnams yul la mi 'jug par sdom pa dang / yul la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par byed pa ni yul la zhugs nas yang /
translated: Among them, it protects mindfulness, because it restrains the senses and the mind from engaging with objects from the very beginning. It prevents defilement of the object, because, having engaged with the object,

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mtshan mar mi 'dzin bzang por mi 'dzin pa'o //

original: dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'jog par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'jog par byed pa ni /
translated: It fixes the mind on the objective support,

original: sgom par byed pa'i yul la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //üîΩnang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba la nam bdag nyid kyi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs @142a * //
analyzed: sgom par byed pa'i yul la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o // nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba la nam bdag nyid kyi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs @142a * //
translated: because it fixes the mind onepointedly on the object of meditation.üîΩHe abides contemplating the body as a body internally, etc. When one sees with wisdom that one‚Äôs own body, which is included in the enumeration of sentient beings,

original: pa'i gzugs la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du shes rab kyis mthong bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: pa'i gzugs la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du shes rab kyis mthong bar byed pa ni /
translated: is form, in terms of its general and specific characteristics,

analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ste / lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: This is called contemplating the internal body as a body.

original: rdul phra mo du ma bsags pa las gyur pa snabs dang / mchil ma dang / khrag dang / chu ser la sogs pa mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang ba'o //üîΩde ltar bsgom pa na yang gnyen pos gsal bar mthong bar bya ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs nas gnas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdul phra mo du ma bsags pa las gyur pa snabs dang / mchil ma dang / khrag dang / chu ser la sogs pa mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang ba'o // de ltar bsgom pa na yang gnyen pos gsal bar mthong bar bya ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs nas gnas par bya ba ste /
translated: The specific characteristic of the body is that it is composed of many subtle particles, and is filled with various kinds of impurities such as mucus, saliva, blood, pus, and so on.

original: rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: When one cultivates this contemplation, there are two aspects: seeing clearly through antidotes and abiding in the abandonment of adverse factors.

original: de la gnyen po yang shes rab kyis lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba dang / shes rab kyis lus kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid mthong ba dang / de ltar shes rab kyis mthong ba'i chos de la zhi gnas rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnyen po yang shes rab kyis lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba dang / shes rab kyis lus kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid mthong ba dang / de ltar shes rab kyis mthong ba'i chos de la zhi gnas rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: The antidotes are also two: seeing the specific characteristic of the body through wisdom and seeing the general characteristic of the body through wisdom, and placing the mind one-pointedly in tranquil abiding on the phenomena seen through wisdom in this way.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang gnyis te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang gnyis te /
translated: The adverse factors are also two: the adverse factors of tranquility and the adverse factors of insight.

original: lus dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la chags pa dang / de dag nyid la khong khro ba'i lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid shes rab kyis mi gtsang ba la sogs par phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la chags pa dang / de dag nyid la khong khro ba'i lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid shes rab kyis mi gtsang ba la sogs par phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni gsal ba'o //
translated: The clear seeing of the body, form, etc., as impure, etc., by means of the wisdom which is unmistaken with regard to the individual characteristics of the body is clarity.

original: lus kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyis phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni yang dag par rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyis phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni yang dag par rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The unmistaken seeing of the general characteristics of the body by means of wisdom is thorough knowledge.

original: shes rab kyis lus kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mthong ba de nyid kyi don ma brjed cing de la rtag tu zhi gnas kyi sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni dran pa dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: shes rab kyis lus kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mthong ba de nyid kyi don ma brjed cing de la rtag tu zhi gnas kyi sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni dran pa dang ldan pa'i //
translated: The non-forgetting of the meaning of the seeing of the individual and general characteristics of the body by means of wisdom, and the constant placement of the mind of calm abiding one-pointedly on that is mindfulness.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bar du gcod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa lus dang gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa spangs pa ni 'jig rten gyi chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bar du gcod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa lus dang gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa spangs pa ni 'jig rten gyi chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of attachment to the body, form, etc., which is the counteragent to the obstruction of the application of mindfulness to the body is freedom from worldly attachment.

original: de'i bar du gcod pa zhe sdang spangs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod pa zhe sdang spangs pa ni /
translated: The abandonment of hatred, which is its obstruction, is freedom from hatred.

original: yid mi bde ba spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe abandonment of mental dissatisfaction.‚Äù

original: gnas pa'i gong du bshad pa ltar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i gong du bshad pa ltar bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the internal body should be understood as explained above.

original: nam phyi'i lus gzugs la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa rnams kyis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: nam phyi'i lus gzugs la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa rnams kyis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the external body is the understanding of the general and specific characteristics of all bodies, etc., that are not included among the bodies of sentient beings.

original: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe observation and understanding of the external body.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The specific characteristic is the nature of the collection of atoms.

original: phyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: phyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa ste /
translated: The general characteristic is impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: gsal ba yang dag par @142b rab tu shes pa yang de'i slad du sbyar zhing /
analyzed: gsal ba yang dag par @142b rab tu shes pa yang de'i slad du sbyar zhing /
translated: The clear understanding of the external body should be understood in the same way.

original: de dag gi don yang slar bstan pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: de dag gi don yang slar bstan pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: The meaning of the above should be understood as explained.

original: sems can gzhan dag gi las sems can gyi grang su gtogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag gi las sems can gyi grang su gtogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the internal and external body is the understanding of the general and specific characteristics of one‚Äôs own body that is included among the bodies of sentient beings and of the bodies of other sentient beings that are not included among the bodies of sentient beings.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The internal and external body is called the observation of the body in the body.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: The general and specific characteristics are to be seen as explained above.

original: nang gi tshor ba dang phyi'i tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba dang phyi'i tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: The internal feeling, the external feeling, etc. Here, what is feeling?

original: 'di lta ste bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: It is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang ; bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la yang lus dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang ; bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la yang lus dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feelings are associated with the body, and likewise with the mind.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa bde ba yang zang zing dang bcas pa dang / zang zing med pa dang / chags pa la brten pa dang / 'byung ba la brten pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa bde ba yang zang zing dang bcas pa dang / zang zing med pa dang / chags pa la brten pa dang / 'byung ba la brten pa ste /

original: 'di dag ni tshor ba'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni tshor ba'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: These are the divisions of feeling.

original: de la lus dang sems la sim pa phan par byed pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o //üîΩlus dang sems la gnod pa las gdung bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus dang sems la sim pa phan par byed pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o // lus dang sems la gnod pa las gdung bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //
translated: Pleasant feeling is that which benefits body and mind.üîΩPainful feeling is that which harms body and mind.

original: lus dang sems la phan par yang mi byed /üîΩgdung bar yang mi byed pa ni ;
analyzed: lus dang sems la phan par yang mi byed / gdung bar yang mi byed pa ni ;
translated: Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is that which does neither.

original: bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is neither beneficial nor harmful.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: It is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: tshor ba de gsum yang nam mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa lnga dang 'brel ba'i dus na ni lus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba de gsum yang nam mig gi rnam par shes pa nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa lnga dang 'brel ba'i dus na ni lus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: These three feelings are bodily when they are associated with the five consciousnesses from eye consciousness to body consciousness.

original: tshor ba de gsum yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa'i dus na ni sems dang ldan pa'o //üîΩtshor ba gsum mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun par gyur na ni /
analyzed: tshor ba de gsum yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa'i dus na ni sems dang ldan pa'o // tshor ba gsum mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun par gyur na ni /
translated: They are mental when they are associated with mental consciousness.

original: zang zing med pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'o //
translated: When these three feelings are in accord with nirvana, they are uncontaminated.

original: khams gsum du gtogs pa'i tshor ba thams cad ni zang zing dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum du gtogs pa'i tshor ba thams cad ni zang zing dang bcas pa'o //
translated: All feelings belonging to the three realms are contaminated.

original: nam 'phags pa'i lam dang rjes su mthun par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: nam 'phags pa'i lam dang rjes su mthun par gyur pa ni /
translated: When it becomes concordant with the ƒÅrya path,üîΩ

original: 'byung ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba la brten pa'o //
translated: When it is in conformity with the noble path, it is based on emergence.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la zhen pa ni zhen pa la brten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la zhen pa ni zhen pa la brten pa zhes bya'o //

original: de la rjes su lta ba dang dran pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa'i don rnams ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //üîΩde la @143a * //
analyzed: de la rjes su lta ba dang dran pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa'i don rnams ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin du blta'o // de la @143a * //
translated: The meaning of the terms ‚Äúcontemplation of the body,‚Äù etc., should be understood as explained in the chapter on the applications of mindfulness.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa la dmigs pa las /üîΩtshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa la dmigs pa las / tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: The internal body is the body that is counted as a sentient being and is the object of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa skyes pa ni nang gi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa skyes pa ni nang gi tshor ba'o //
translated: Pleasant, painful, and neither pleasant nor painful feelings that arise from it are internal feelings.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa las tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa ni phyi'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa las tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa ni phyi'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Pleasant, painful, and neither pleasant nor painful feelings that arise from the external body, which is not counted as a sentient being, such as form, etc., are external feelings.üîΩThe internal mind is the mind that is counted as a sentient being and is the object of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: sems can gzhan dag gi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa la dmigs pa las /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag gi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa la dmigs pa las /
translated: The focus is on the bodies of other sentient beings, which are included in the number of sentient beings.

original: tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa ni nang dang phyi'i tshor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa ni nang dang phyi'i tshor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The arising of the feelings of pleasure and so forth is called inner and outer feelings.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gsum yang sdug bsngal dang 'brel par mthong ba ni /
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gsum yang sdug bsngal dang 'brel par mthong ba ni /
translated: The seeing of the three kinds of feelings as connected with suffering is

original: tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su blta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su blta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum la sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of suffering are the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the composite.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang 'brel /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang 'brel /
translated: The feeling of suffering is connected with the suffering of suffering.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba ni thang cig bder zin kyang phyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur bas na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'brel /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba ni thang cig bder zin kyang phyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur bas na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'brel /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is connected with the suffering of change, because even though it is pleasant for a while, later it becomes the cause of suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni mi rtag pa'i chos dang ldan pas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang 'brel te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni mi rtag pa'i chos dang ldan pas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang 'brel te /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain is related to the suffering of conditioned existence because it is a phenomenon that possesses impermanence.

original: gsal ba la sogs pa'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //üîΩnang gi sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems dbye na rnam pa nyi shu ste /
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs pa'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o // nang gi sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems dbye na rnam pa nyi shu ste /
translated: The meanings of clear and so on should be viewed in accordance with the above explanation.üîΩThe internal mind and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems dang / gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i sems dang ; 'dus pa'i sems dang /
