translated: The mind is classified in twenty ways: a mind possessing attachment, a mind free from attachment, a mind possessing aversion, a mind free from aversion, a mind possessing delusion, a mind free from delusion, a mind possessing the three roots of nonvirtue, a mind possessing the three roots of virtue, a mind possessing the three roots of neutral states, a contracted mind, a distracted mind, an expanded mind, an unexpanded mind, a surpassed mind, an unsurpassed mind, a concentrated mind, an unconcentrated mind, a liberated mind and an unliberated mind.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems dang / zhum pa'i sems dang / gzengs mtho ba'i sems dang / rgod pa'i sems dang / rgod pa med pa'i sems dang / zhi ba'i sems dang / ma zhi ba'i sems dang / shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems dang / zhum pa'i sems dang / gzengs mtho ba'i sems dang / rgod pa'i sems dang / rgod pa med pa'i sems dang / zhi ba'i sems dang / ma zhi ba'i sems dang / shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang /
translated: a distracted mind, a depressed mind, an elated mind, an excited mind, an unexcited mind, a peaceful mind, an unpeaceful mind, a very concentrated mind,

original: shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sems dang / lam shin tu bsgom pa'i sems dang / lam shin tu bsgom pa ma yin pa'i sems dang / shin tu bsgom pa las grol ba'i sems dang / shin tu bsgom pa las grol ba ma yin pa'i sems so //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sems dang / lam shin tu bsgom pa'i sems dang / lam shin tu bsgom pa ma yin pa'i sems dang / shin tu bsgom pa las grol ba'i sems dang / shin tu bsgom pa las grol ba ma yin pa'i sems so //
translated: a very unconcentrated mind, a mind that is a very cultivated path, a mind that is not a very cultivated path, a mind that is liberated from very cultivated [paths], and a mind that is not liberated from very cultivated [paths].

original: de la gang chags par @143b bya ba'i dngos po la 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa mngon sum du spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de la gang chags par @143b bya ba'i dngos po la 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa mngon sum du spyod pa ni /
translated: Among them, the mind that is associated with desire is the mind that engages in the direct experience of the entanglement of desire towards an object of attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a mind with desire.

original: 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa bag la nyal tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa bag la nyal tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The mind that is not associated with desire is the mind that is merely a latent tendency of the entanglement of desire,

original: dngos su spyod pa med pa ni /
analyzed: dngos su spyod pa med pa ni /
translated: but does not engage in direct experience.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a mind free from attachment.

original: zhe sdang gi dngos po la zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa mngon sum du spyod pa ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi dngos po la zhe sdang gi kun nas dkris pa mngon sum du spyod pa ni /
translated: A mind that is directly engaged in the envelopments of aversion toward a thing that is a basis for aversion

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: is called a mind with aversion.

original: zhe sdang bag la nyal tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: zhe sdang bag la nyal tsam du zad kyi /
translated: A mind that is only a latent tendency to aversion,

original: dngos su byung ba med pa ni /
analyzed: dngos su byung ba med pa ni /
translated: but does not actually occur,

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: is called a mind free from aversion.

original: kun tu gti mug par gyur pa'i dngos po la rmongs pa kun tu 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: kun tu gti mug par gyur pa'i dngos po la rmongs pa kun tu 'byung ba ni /
translated: A mind that is directly engaged in the occurrence of delusion toward a thing that is a basis for delusion

original: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: is called a mind with delusion.

original: gti mug bag la nyal tsam du gnas pa ni //
analyzed: gti mug bag la nyal tsam du gnas pa ni //
translated: A mind that is only a latent tendency to delusion

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya ste /
translated: is called a mind free from delusion.

original: sems drug po de dag ni kun tu spyod pa'i dus na 'byung ba las gzhag par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: sems drug po de dag ni kun tu spyod pa'i dus na 'byung ba las gzhag par rig par bya'o // de la gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs so //
translated: These six kinds of mind should be understood as occurring at the time of their occurrence.üîΩThree are on the side of affliction,

original: gsum ni de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gsum ni de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: and three are on the side of their antidotes.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi rnam par sems nang du gnas par gyur pa 'dus pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi rnam par sems nang du gnas par gyur pa 'dus pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind that is concentrated is the mind that is internally settled in the aspect of calm abiding.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rjes su 'brang ba g-yengs pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rjes su 'brang ba g-yengs pa'i sems so //
translated: The distracted mind is the mind that pursues the five sense pleasures.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa dang ldan pa ni zhum pa'i sems so /
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa dang ldan pa ni zhum pa'i sems so /
translated: The depressed mind is the mind that is associated with sleepiness and lethargy.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa sel bar byed pa'i chos rab tu dang bar byed pa 'ga' zhig la dmigs nas sems dga' bar byas pa ni gzengs mthos pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa sel bar byed pa'i chos rab tu dang bar byed pa 'ga' zhig la dmigs nas sems dga' bar byas pa ni gzengs mthos pa'i sems so //
translated: The elated mind is the mind that is gladdened by focusing on something that inspires faith, such as the Dharma, in order to dispel sleepiness and lethargy.

original: sems gzengs bstod pa las slar g-yengs bar gyur pa ni rgod pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sems gzengs bstod pa las slar g-yengs bar gyur pa ni rgod pa'i sems so //
translated: The agitated mind is the mind that is distracted again after it has been uplifted.

original: zhum rgod spangs nas sems btang snyoms su gyur pa ni rgod pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: zhum rgod spangs nas sems btang snyoms su gyur pa ni rgod pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: The non-agitated mind is the mind that is equanimous after it has abandoned depression and agitation.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ni zhi ba'i sems so //
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba ni zhi ba'i sems so //
translated: The peaceful mind is the mind that is free from the obscurations of sleepiness, lethargy, regret, doubt, and so forth.

original: sgrib pa de dag dang ma bral ba ni ma zhi ba'i sems so //
analyzed: sgrib pa de dag dang ma bral ba ni ma zhi ba'i sems so //
translated: The non-peaceful mind is the mind that is not free from those obscurations.

original: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la zhugs pa ni shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la zhugs pa ni shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind that is in the four basic meditations is a very concentrated mind.

original: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la ma zhugs pa ni shin tu mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i sems so //üîΩrtsa ba'i bsam gtan de dag nyid la shin tu bsgoms pa dang / dus ring du bsgoms pas ci dgar dbang du @144a * //üîΩgyur pa ni lam shin tu bsgom pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan bzhi la ma zhugs pa ni shin tu mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i sems so // rtsa ba'i bsam gtan de dag nyid la shin tu bsgoms pa dang / dus ring du bsgoms pas ci dgar dbang du @144a * // gyur pa ni lam shin tu bsgom pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind that is not in the four basic meditations is a very unconcentrated mind.üîΩThe mind that is in the four basic meditations, and which, by being cultivated and practiced for a long time, has become free and independent, is a very cultivated mind.

original: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan thob kyang shin tu ma bsgoms la /üîΩdus ring du ma bsgoms pas ci dgar dbang thob par ma gyur pa ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan thob kyang shin tu ma bsgoms la / dus ring du ma bsgoms pas ci dgar dbang thob par ma gyur pa ni /
translated: The mind that is not in the four basic meditations, but which, by being cultivated and practiced for a long time, has become free and independent, is a very cultivated mind.

original: lam shin tu bsgom pa ma yin pa'i sems so //
analyzed: lam shin tu bsgom pa ma yin pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind that is in the four basic meditations, but which, not being cultivated and practiced for a long time, has not become free and independent, is a mind that is not very cultivated.üîΩThe mind that is not in the four basic meditations, but which, by being cultivated and practiced for a long time, has become free and independent, is a mind that is very cultivated.

original: lam shin tu bsgoms pa las nyon mongs pa thams cad byang ba dang / shin tu byang ba ni shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba'i sems so //
analyzed: lam shin tu bsgoms pa las nyon mongs pa thams cad byang ba dang / shin tu byang ba ni shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba'i sems so //
translated: The mind that is in the four basic meditations, and which, by being cultivated and practiced for a long time, has become free and independent, and in which all the defilements have been completely destroyed, is a mind that is liberated by very thorough cultivation.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang shin tu byang ba ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa kha cig byang ba ni shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba ma yin pa'i sems te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang shin tu byang ba ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa kha cig byang ba ni shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba ma yin pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind that is not liberated by thorough cultivation is the mind that is not completely purified of all the defilements and of some of the defilements that are not completely purified.

original: sems bcu drug po de dag ni gnas pa'i dus kyi dbang du byas nas bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems bcu drug po de dag ni gnas pa'i dus kyi dbang du byas nas bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: These sixteen types of mind should be understood as explained in terms of the time of their occurrence.

original: sems nyi shu po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems nyi shu po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: These twenty types of mind are summarized as three types:

original: nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi nang gi sems so //
analyzed: nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi nang gi sems so //
translated: internal mind, external mind, and internal-external mind.

original: de la bdag gi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa las dmigs pa las sems nyi shu po byung ba ni nang gi sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa las dmigs pa las sems nyi shu po byung ba ni nang gi sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The twenty types of mind that occur in relation to the object of observation that is included in the number of sentient beings, such as one‚Äôs own body, are called ‚Äúinternal mind.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa la dmigs pa las sems nyi shu po de dag byung ba ni phyi'i sems zhes ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa la dmigs pa las sems nyi shu po de dag byung ba ni phyi'i sems zhes ba'o //
translated: The twenty types of mind that occur in relation to the object of observation that is not included in the number of sentient beings, such as form, are called ‚Äúexternal mind.‚Äù

original: sems can gzhan gyi gzugs sems can gzhan gyi grangs su gtogs pa la sems dmigs pa las sems nyi shu po de dag byung ba ni nang dang phyi'i sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi gzugs sems can gzhan gyi grangs su gtogs pa la sems dmigs pa las sems nyi shu po de dag byung ba ni nang dang phyi'i sems zhes bya ste /
translated: The twenty minds that arise from observing the minds of other sentient beings as belonging to the class of other sentient beings are called internal and external minds.

original: sems la yang skad cig tu 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / skad cig tu 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems la yang skad cig tu 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / skad cig tu 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: A mind may be associated with attachment in one moment and free from attachment in another moment.

original: skad cig kyang mi gnas pa rang bzhin gzhan dang du 'gyur bar rtogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig kyang mi gnas pa rang bzhin gzhan dang du 'gyur bar rtogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The realization that it does not remain for a second moment and that its nature changes is called

original: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: the observation of the mind by the mind.

original: gsal ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan ni gong du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan ni gong du bshad par zad do //
translated: The meanings of clarity and so on have already been explained above.üîΩWith regard to internal phenomena and so on, phenomena are divided into two classes:

original: nang gi chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos ni nag po'i phyogs dang / dkar po'i phyogs rnam pa gnyis las dbye na /
analyzed: nang gi chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos ni nag po'i phyogs dang / dkar po'i phyogs rnam pa gnyis las dbye na /
translated: the dark side and the bright side.

original: rnam pa nyi shur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shur rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as twenty types.

original: nyi shu po de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu po de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / zhe sdang dang zhe sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug dang gti mug 'dul ba dang / @144b 'dus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / gzengs mthos pa dang / rgod pa dang /üîΩrgod pa med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa dang / lam shin tu bsgoms pa dang / lam shin tu bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / zhe sdang dang zhe sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug dang gti mug 'dul ba dang / @144b 'dus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / gzengs mthos pa dang / rgod pa dang / rgod pa med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa dang / lam shin tu bsgoms pa dang / lam shin tu bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: It is the taming of desire and the taming of anger, the taming of ignorance, the taming of attachment, and the taming of aversion.üîΩIt is the taming of distraction and the taming of dullness, the taming of agitation and the taming of lack of agitation, the taming of peace and the taming of lack of peace, the taming of complete equipoise and the taming of lack of complete equipoise, the taming of the well-cultivated path and the taming of the path that is not well-cultivated,

original: shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba dang / shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba dang / shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: and the taming of liberation through complete cultivation and the taming of lack of liberation through complete cultivation.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma zhi ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / lam legs par ma bsgoms pa dang / legs par bsgoms pas grol ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma zhi ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / lam legs par ma bsgoms pa dang / legs par bsgoms pas grol ba med pa ste /
translated: attachment, aversion, confusion, distraction, depression, excitement, non-calmness, non-concentration, non-cultivation of the path, and non-liberation through cultivation.

original: bcu ni nag po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bcu ni nag po'i phyogs so //
translated: These ten are on the dark side.

original: 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / zhe sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / 'dus pa dang / gzengs mthos pa dang / mi rgod pa dang ; zhi ba dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / lam legs par bsgoms pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / zhe sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / 'dus pa dang / gzengs mthos pa dang / mi rgod pa dang ; zhi ba dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / lam legs par bsgoms pa dang /
translated: Subduing attachment, subduing aversion, subduing confusion, gathering, uplifting, non-agitation, calmness, concentration, cultivation of the path,

original: legs par bsgoms pas grol ba ste bcu ni dkar po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: legs par bsgoms pas grol ba ste bcu ni dkar po'i phyogs so //
translated: and liberation through cultivation. These ten are on the bright side.

original: de la gzugs dang 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de la gzugs dang 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Among them, attachment is attachment to form and desirable qualities.

original: mi gtsang ba bsgom pa ni 'dod chags 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba bsgom pa ni 'dod chags 'dul ba'o //
translated: Cultivating impurity is subduing attachment.

original: dgra la sogs pa la khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: dgra la sogs pa la khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Aversion is hostility towards enemies and so on.

original: byams pa ni zhe sdang 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: byams pa ni zhe sdang 'dul ba'o //
translated: Loving-kindness is subduing aversion.

original: las dang las kyi 'bras bu mi shes pa ni gti mug go //
analyzed: las dang las kyi 'bras bu mi shes pa ni gti mug go //
translated: Ignorance is the non-understanding of action and the results of action.

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i shes rab ni gti mug 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i shes rab ni gti mug 'dul ba'o //
translated: The understanding of the general and specific characteristics of things is the subduing of ignorance.

original: sems nang du rtse gcig tu gnas pa ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: sems nang du rtse gcig tu gnas pa ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: sems 'dod pa'i yon tan la zhugs pa ni g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'dod pa'i yon tan la zhugs pa ni g-yengs pa'o //
translated: Distraction is the mind engaged in the objects of desire.

original: sems gnyid dang rmugs pas non pa ni zhum pa'o //üîΩbsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: sems gnyid dang rmugs pas non pa ni zhum pa'o // bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'am /
translated: Depression is the mind oppressed by sleep and laziness.üîΩExaltation is the mind that has overcome sleep and laziness by thinking of the results of concentration

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan bsams nas gnyid dang rmugs pa bsal ba ni gzengs mthos pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan bsams nas gnyid dang rmugs pa bsal ba ni gzengs mthos pa'o //
translated: or of the qualities of the Tathagata.

original: sems gzengs bstod pa las slar sems 'phros par gyur pa ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: sems gzengs bstod pa las slar sems 'phros par gyur pa ni rgod pa'o //
translated: Excitement is the mind that is scattered again after it has been uplifted.

original: zhum rgod gnyis spangs te sems mnyam par gyur pa ni rgod pa med pa'o //üîΩgnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang @145a * //
analyzed: zhum rgod gnyis spangs te sems mnyam par gyur pa ni rgod pa med pa'o // gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang @145a * //
translated: Non-excitement is the mind that is even after it has abandoned both depression and excitement.

original: bral ba ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bral ba ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Tranquility is the mind that is free from the obscurations of sleep, laziness, etc.

original: sgrib pa dang ma bral ba ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang ma bral ba ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Agitation is the mind that is not free from the obscurations.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa ste /
translated: The first, second, third and fourth absorptions.

original: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan la zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan la zhugs pa ni /
translated: Those who have entered the fundamental absorptions

original: shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: are well-equipoised.

original: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan lam zhugs pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bsam gtan lam zhugs pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those who have not entered the fundamental absorptions are not well-equipoised.

original: de la 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa thob pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa thob pa ni /
translated: Among them, those who have attained the cultivation of the noble path

original: lam shin tu bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: lam shin tu bsgoms pa'o //
translated: are those who have well-cultivated the path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa ma thob pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa ma thob pa ni /
translated: Those who have not attained the cultivation of the noble path

original: lam shin tu bsgoms pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam shin tu bsgoms pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: are those who have not well-cultivated the path.

original: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas phyis mi skye ba ni shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas phyis mi skye ba ni shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba'o //
translated: Those who have abandoned all the afflictions of the three realms and will not be reborn again are liberated by well-cultivating.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa ma yin pa ni shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa ma yin pa ni shin tu bsgoms pas grol ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those who have not abandoned all the afflictions are not liberated by well-cultivating.

original: chos de dag kyang rnam pa gsum du bzhag ste /
analyzed: chos de dag kyang rnam pa gsum du bzhag ste /
translated: Those phenomena are also presented in three ways:

original: nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / nang dang phyi'i chos so //
analyzed: nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / nang dang phyi'i chos so //
translated: internal phenomena, external phenomena, and internal and external phenomena.

original: de la bdag rang nyid kyi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa las nag po 'am dkar po'i chos byung ba ni nang gi chos so //
analyzed: de la bdag rang nyid kyi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa las nag po 'am dkar po'i chos byung ba ni nang gi chos so //
translated: The internal phenomena are those that arise from the body of a self that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe external phenomena are those that arise from the body of a sentient being that is not included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe internal and external phenomena are those that arise from the body of another sentient being that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: gzugs la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa la dmigs pa las /üîΩdkar po'am / nag po'i chos byung ba ni /üîΩphyi'i chos so //üîΩsems can gzhan gyi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa la dmigs pa las dkar po 'am nag po'i chos byung ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa la dmigs pa las / dkar po'am / nag po'i chos byung ba ni / phyi'i chos so // sems can gzhan gyi lus sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa la dmigs pa las dkar po 'am nag po'i chos byung ba ni /
translated: The internal phenomena are those that arise from the body of a self that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe external phenomena are those that arise from the body of a sentient being that is not included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe internal and external phenomena are those that arise from the body of another sentient being that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: nang dang phyi'i chos zhes bya ste /üîΩnag po'i chos kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i chos zhes bya ste / nag po'i chos kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: The internal phenomena are those that arise from the body of a self that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: dkar po'i chos kyis ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kyis ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The external phenomena are those that arise from the body of a sentient being that is not included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe internal and external phenomena are those that arise from the body of another sentient being that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: 'di na kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i bdag gam /
analyzed: 'di na kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i bdag gam /
translated: The internal phenomena are those that arise from the body of a self that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe external phenomena are those that arise from the body of a sentient being that is not included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: rnam par byang bar byed pa'i bdag med do zhes lta ba ni chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar byed pa'i bdag med do zhes lta ba ni chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The internal and external phenomena are those that arise from the body of another sentient being that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe internal phenomena are those that arise from the body of a self that is included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe external phenomena are those that arise from the body of a sentient being that is not included in the number of sentient beings, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.üîΩThe internal and external phenomena are those that arise from the body of another

original: gsal ba la sogs pa'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs pa'i don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of clarity and so on is as explained above.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yang rnam par lngar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yang rnam par lngar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Therein, the four foundations of mindfulness are also established as fivefold.

original: rnam pa lnga ni dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The five aspects are: objective support, nature, companion, cultivation, and the result of cultivation.

original: ji ltar na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la rnam pa lngar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la rnam pa lngar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the four foundations of mindfulness are established as fivefold,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs lhag ma rnams la yang rnam pa @145b lnga lngar gzhag go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs lhag ma rnams la yang rnam pa @145b lnga lngar gzhag go //
translated: so too the remaining factors of awakening are established as fivefold.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the objective support of the four foundations of mindfulness?

original: de yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang bzhi ste /
translated: It is also fourfold:

original: lus dang / sems dang / tshor ba dang / chos so //
analyzed: lus dang / sems dang / tshor ba dang / chos so //
translated: body, mind, feeling, and phenomena.

original: yang na bdag gi rten gyi dngos po dang / bdag kun nas longs spyod pa'i dngos po dang / bdag nyid kyi dngos po dang / bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: yang na bdag gi rten gyi dngos po dang / bdag kun nas longs spyod pa'i dngos po dang / bdag nyid kyi dngos po dang / bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: Or else, the object of the four foundations of mindfulness is the object of the self, the object of the enjoyment of the self, the object of the self itself, and the object of the defilement and purification of the self.

original: de bzhi ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhi ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i dmigs par bya'o //
translated: These four are the objects of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: de la bdag gi dngos po ni lus so //
analyzed: de la bdag gi dngos po ni lus so //
translated: The object of the self is the body.

original: bdag kun nas longs spyod par byed pa'i dngos po ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bdag kun nas longs spyod par byed pa'i dngos po ni tshor ba'o //
translated: The object of the enjoyment of the self is sensation.

original: bdag nyid kyi dngos po ni sems so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dngos po ni sems so //
translated: The object of the self itself is the mind.

original: bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i dngos po ni chos so //
analyzed: bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i dngos po ni chos so //
translated: The object of the defilement and purification of the self is the dharmas.

original: de la yang ji ltar dmigs pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang ji ltar dmigs pa zhe na /
translated: How are they objects?

original: blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i byis pa dag phal cher dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la bdag brten cing bde ba la sogs pa kun tu longs spyod par byed la /
analyzed: blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i byis pa dag phal cher dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la bdag brten cing bde ba la sogs pa kun tu longs spyod par byed la /
translated: The foolish, whose minds are perverted, mostly imagine that the self is supported on the body with the sense faculties, that the self experiences pleasure and so on,

original: de ltar kun tu longs spyod par byed pa'i bdag de yang sems nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar kun tu longs spyod par byed pa'i bdag de yang sems nyid yin te /
translated: The self that thus experiences is also the nature of mind.

original: bdag de 'dod chags la sogs pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag de 'dod chags la sogs pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
translated: That self is defiled by attachment and so on,

original: dad pa la sogs pas ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pas ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: and it is purified by faith and so on.

original: zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to realize that,

original: lus la sogs pa bsgom zhing rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bsgom zhing rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the body and so on are cultivated and established.

original: rang bzhin gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhe na /
translated: What is their nature?

original: shes rab dang zhi gnas te /
analyzed: shes rab dang zhi gnas te /
translated: It is wisdom and calm abiding.

original: lus la rjes su lta ba zhes smra bas shes ras smra ba yin //
analyzed: lus la rjes su lta ba zhes smra bas shes ras smra ba yin //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone observes the body‚Äù indicates wisdom.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa dang / gnas pa zhes smras pas zhi gnas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa dang / gnas pa zhes smras pas zhi gnas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone is mindful and stable‚Äù indicates calm abiding.

original: grogs po ni de dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: grogs po ni de dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: Friends are the mind and mental factors that possess those two.

original: shes rab dang zhi gnas gnyis kyang brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba gzhan dang mi ldan pa 'ba' zhig 'byung mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang zhi gnas gnyis kyang brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba gzhan dang mi ldan pa 'ba' zhig 'byung mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible for wisdom and calm abiding to occur alone, without other mental factors such as effort.

original: bsgom pa ni nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gnyis kyi lus kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid goms par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gnyis kyi lus kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid goms par bya'o //
translated: Meditation is the cultivation of the general and specific characteristics of the body, internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni phyin ci log bzhi spangs pa dang / bden pa zhi la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //üîΩde la phyin ci log bzhi ni mi gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni phyin ci log bzhi spangs pa dang / bden pa zhi la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o // de la phyin ci log bzhi ni mi gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The result of meditation is the abandonment of the four errors, the entry into the peace of the truths, and the separation from the body, etc.

original: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci @146a * //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci @146a * //
translated: The four errors are the apprehension of the impure as pure, of suffering as happiness, of the impermanent as permanent, and of the non-self as self.

original: log tu 'dzin pa spong ba'i phyir lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: log tu 'dzin pa spong ba'i phyir lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms te /
translated: The cultivation of the applications of mindfulness of the body is for the purpose of abandoning the error of apprehending the impure as pure.

original: lus la ni gtso bor mi gtsang ba'i mtshan nyid du bsgom par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: lus la ni gtso bor mi gtsang ba'i mtshan nyid du bsgom par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One taught that the body should be cultivated primarily as having the characteristic of impurity.

original: sdug bsngal la bde bar 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde bar 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms te /
translated: The cultivation of the application of mindfulness of feeling is for the purpose of abandoning the error of apprehending suffering as happiness.

original: ji srid du tshor ba thams cad kyang sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang 'brel to zhes /
analyzed: ji srid du tshor ba thams cad kyang sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum dang 'brel to zhes /
translated: As long as there is feeling, all is related to the three kinds of suffering,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro // mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por /
translated: because the Lord has said so.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms te /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mind is cultivated as the antidote to the error of taking as permanent what is impermanent.

original: sems 'di yang skad cig ma re re la 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems 'di yang skad cig ma re re la 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // bdag med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log spong ba'i phyir /
translated: This mind also is momentary, because it changes from one moment to the next, being sometimes associated with attachment, sometimes not, and so on.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms te ;
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms te ;
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mental qualities is cultivated as the antidote to the error of taking as a self what is not a self.üîΩBecause the mental qualities are the defilements and the purification.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: The defilements are attachment and so on,

original: dad pa la sogs pas ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar zad kyi /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pas ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar zad kyi /
translated: and the purification is faith and so on.

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i byed pa po dang / bdag med pa khong du chud na /
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i byed pa po dang / bdag med pa khong du chud na /
translated: This is the agent that defiles and purifies, and when one understands selflessness,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log dang bral bar 'gyur ro //üîΩbden pa bzhi la 'jug pa ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log dang bral bar 'gyur ro // bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas /
translated: one becomes free from the error of grasping a self.üîΩThe four noble truths are engaged by cultivating the applications of mindfulness.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: One engages the truth of suffering by cultivating the application of mindfulness of the body.

original: lus kyi rang bzhin mthong na skye rga na 'chi la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin mthong na skye rga na 'chi la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one sees the nature of the body, one realizes that it is endowed with the various sufferings of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: One engages the truth of origin by cultivating the application of mindfulness of feeling.

original: tshor ba bde ba la brten nas ni sred pa skye /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba la brten nas ni sred pa skye /
translated: Because craving arises in dependence on pleasant feeling.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba'i rgyus ni zhe sdang skye la /
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba'i rgyus ni zhe sdang skye la /
translated: Aversion arises due to the cause of painful feeling.

original: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i rgyus ni gti mug skye /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i rgyus ni gti mug skye /
translated: And delusion arises due to the cause of neither pleasant nor painful feeling.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyus tshe rabs gzhan gyi phung po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyus tshe rabs gzhan gyi phung po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one understands that the aggregates of other lives arise due to the causes of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: By cultivating the close placement of mindfulness of the mind, one enters the truth of cessation.

original: sems skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i @146b rang bzhin bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong na mya ngan las 'das pa las bdag chad par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sems skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i @146b rang bzhin bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong na mya ngan las 'das pa las bdag chad par 'gyur ro /
translated: If one sees the mind as having the nature of moment-by-moment destruction and the characteristic of selflessness, one would think that one's self would be annihilated in nirvana.

original: zhes 'jig pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'jig pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one would not see the arising of destruction.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: By cultivating the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena, one enters the truth of the path.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs gnyis mthong nas kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs gnyis mthong nas kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir /
translated: Having seen the two sides of affliction and purification, in order to abandon affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos la rten par byed pas so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos la rten par byed pas so //
translated: one relies on the phenomena of purification.

original: bral ba ni lus la sogs pa bsgoms pas /
analyzed: bral ba ni lus la sogs pa bsgoms pas /
translated: As for separation, by cultivating the body, etc.,

original: gnas ngan len pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from all negative tendencies.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na 'jig rten pa dag ni phal cher phung po lnga la phung po tsam mam chos tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na 'jig rten pa dag ni phal cher phung po lnga la phung po tsam mam chos tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pas 'di lta ste /
translated: In another way, since mundane beings generally do not comprehend the five aggregates as mere aggregates or mere phenomena just as they are,

original: bdag de lus la gnas shing tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pas rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag de lus la gnas shing tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pas rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: they grasp the self as abiding in the body, as that which is afflicted by the experience of pleasure and pain and as that which is purified by virtue and nonvirtue.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: In order to reverse that, the four establishments of mindfulness are taught.

original: de la lus ni bdag gi rten gyi dngos po'o zhes rmongs pa bsal ba'i phyir lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la lus ni bdag gi rten gyi dngos po'o zhes rmongs pa bsal ba'i phyir lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan te /
translated: In that regard, the body is the basis of the self. In order to dispel confusion about that, the establishment of mindfulness of the body is taught.

original: lus 'di mi gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: lus 'di mi gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi dngos po yin gyi /
translated: This body is the basis of impurity and suffering.

original: bdag gi dngos po ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the self.

original: tshor ba ni bdag des kun tu myong bar bya ba'i dngos po yin no zhes rmongs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba ni bdag des kun tu myong bar bya ba'i dngos po yin no zhes rmongs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Feeling is the thing that is experienced by that self, in order to dispel confusion.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad de //
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad de //
translated: The mindfulness of feeling is explained.

original: tshor ba thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba yin gyis /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba yin gyis /
translated: All feelings are suffering.

original: bdag des kun tu myong bar bya ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag des kun tu myong bar bya ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the thing that is experienced by that self.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa la bdag gi dngos por 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa la bdag gi dngos por 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the grasping of mind, thought, and consciousness as the self,

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bstan te /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bstan te /
translated: the cultivation of the mindfulness of mind is taught.

original: sems ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: sems ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: The mind has the nature of being momentary.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the nature of the self.

original: chos kyis ni bdag de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed do zhes rmongs pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bshad de /
analyzed: chos kyis ni bdag de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed do zhes rmongs pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bshad de /
translated: The cultivation of the mindfulness of phenomena is explained because of confusion about the fact that phenomena cause the self to be defiled and purified.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs par byed cing /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs par byed cing /
translated: It is only that defilement is caused by desire, etc.,

original: dad pa la sogs pas sems rnam par @147a * //üîΩbyang bar byed par zad kyi /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pas sems rnam par @147a * // byang bar byed par zad kyi /
translated: and the mind is purified by faith, etc.

original: bdag med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: But since it is by nature devoid of self,üîΩit is impossible for it to be defiled or purified.

original: de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba bzhi bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba bzhi bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: After the teaching of the foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts are taught.

original: de la dge slong dag yang dag par spong ba bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong dag yang dag par spong ba bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúMonks, what are the four right efforts?

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / sdig pa'i chos skyes pa spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / sdig pa'i chos skyes pa spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes pa gnas par bya'o //
translated: The four right efforts are: not producing evil and unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, abandoning evil and unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen, producing wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, and increasing wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: brgal ba sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa spong ba ni de gnyis dor bar bya ba'i chos yin pas /
analyzed: brgal ba sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa spong ba ni de gnyis dor bar bya ba'i chos yin pas /
translated: The first two are the virtues of abandoning nonvirtue and not generating nonvirtue that has not yet arisen.

original: yang dag par spong ba zhes bya bar 'os na /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba zhes bya bar 'os na /
translated: Since they are virtues that are to be discarded, they are called perfect abandonment.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa gnas par bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa gnas par bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin na /
translated: The third and fourth are the virtues of generating virtue that has not yet arisen and of abiding in virtue that has already arisen.

original: de la ji ltar yang dag par spong ba zhes gdags /
analyzed: de la ji ltar yang dag par spong ba zhes gdags /
translated: Since they are virtues that are to be accomplished, how can they be called perfect abandonment?

original: lan du gnyis la gdags pa mi rigs pa 'dra mod kyis /
analyzed: lan du gnyis la gdags pa mi rigs pa 'dra mod kyis /
translated: Reply: Although it is true that it is illogical to impute them to two things,

original: dge ba skyed pa dang gnas par bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos skye zhing gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya bas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge ba skyed pa dang gnas par bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos skye zhing gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya bas nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault because abandoning the factors incompatible with generating virtue and abiding in virtue is called perfect abandonment since virtue arises and abides.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first perfect abandonment is taught first because it is the antidote to the first two wrong engagements.

original: de la dge slong dag dge slong sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dge slong dag dge slong sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In this regard, the Buddha said to the monks, ‚ÄúMonks, in order that monks may not generate non-virtuous, negative qualities that have not yet arisen‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las ngan par spyod pa /
analyzed: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las ngan par spyod pa /
translated: In this passage, ‚Äúnon-virtuous, negative qualities‚Äù refers to the negative physical, verbal, and mental actions of the desire realm.

original: lus kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas brdzun dang tshig rtsub po dang phra ma dang / tshig kyal par smra ba dang / yid kyi sgo nas chags sems dang /
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / ngag gi sgo nas brdzun dang tshig rtsub po dang phra ma dang / tshig kyal par smra ba dang / yid kyi sgo nas chags sems dang /
translated: From the perspective of the body, they are killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct; from the perspective of speech, they are lying, harsh words, divisive speech, and idle talk; and from the perspective of the mind, they are covetousness, ill will, and wrong views.

original: gnod sems dang / log par lta ba dang / mi dge ba bcu dang / de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos te /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / log par lta ba dang / mi dge ba bcu dang / de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos te /
translated: The ten non-virtues and the afflictions that give rise to them‚Äîattachment, anger, ignorance, and so forth‚Äîare non-virtuous, negative qualities.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa yin pas sdig pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa yin pas sdig pa'o //
translated: They are negative because they are despised by the ƒÅryas.

original: rnam par smin pa mi bde bar myong bar 'gyur bas na mi dge @147b ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mi bde bar myong bar 'gyur bas na mi dge @147b ba'o //
translated: It is unwholesome because it is experienced as an unpleasant karmic maturation.

original: yang na bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i rgyu byed pa ni sdig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i rgyu byed pa ni sdig pa'o //
translated: Or, it is evil because it functions as the cause of harm to oneself and others.

original: dge ba'i chos dang 'gal ba yin pas na mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos dang 'gal ba yin pas na mi dge ba ste /
translated: It is unwholesome because it is contrary to wholesome dharmas.

original: mi dge ba'i chos de dag mngon du ma gyur cing /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos de dag mngon du ma gyur cing /
translated: Those unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen,üîΩthat have not yet come into being and are not yet manifest,

original: de dag dang phrad cing spyod par ma gyur pa ni ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag dang phrad cing spyod par ma gyur pa ni ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: are called non-arisen.

original: bag chags su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags su gnas pa'o //
translated: They exist as latent impressions.

original: yang na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa nyams shing /
analyzed: yang na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa nyams shing /
translated: Or, the cause that destroys the training in higher morality, the training in higher mind, and the training in higher wisdom,

original: bslab pa gsum nyams par byed pa'i rgyu'i chos la ni /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum nyams par byed pa'i rgyu'i chos la ni /
translated: and the cause that destroys the three trainings,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: is called evil, unwholesome dharmas.

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa nyams pa ni yan lag drug gi tshul khrims nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa nyams pa ni yan lag drug gi tshul khrims nyams pa'o //
translated: Therein, the destruction of the training in higher morality is the destruction of the morality of six aspects.

original: tshul khrims nyams par byed pa'i rgyu yang bcu ste /üîΩdang po nas legs par ma blangs pa dang / lhod par byed pa dang / log par 'dzin pa dang / bag med pa dang / le los yongs su zin pa dang / log par smon pa dang / spyod lam nyams par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams par byed pa'i rgyu yang bcu ste / dang po nas legs par ma blangs pa dang / lhod par byed pa dang / log par 'dzin pa dang / bag med pa dang / le los yongs su zin pa dang / log par smon pa dang / spyod lam nyams par gyur pa dang /
translated: There are ten causes for the degeneration of morality:

original: 'tsho ba nyams par gyur pa dang / mtha' gnyis su lhung ba dang / 'byung bar mi byed pa dang / yi dam blangs pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba nyams par gyur pa dang / mtha' gnyis su lhung ba dang / 'byung bar mi byed pa dang / yi dam blangs pa nyams pa'o //
translated: not taking it up well in the first place, relaxing it, holding it wrongly, carelessness, being overcome by laziness, wrong aspiration, degeneration of conduct, degeneration of livelihood, falling into the two extremes, and not being a refuge.

original: de la ji ltar na dang po nas legs par ma blangs she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na dang po nas legs par ma blangs she na /
translated: How is it that one does not take it up well in the first place?

original: 'di ltar rgyal pos 'jigs pas sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyal pos 'jigs pas sam /
translated: One takes it up out of fear of kings,

original: rkun pos 'jigs pas sam /
analyzed: rkun pos 'jigs pas sam /
translated: fear of thieves,

original: 'tsho ba med pas sam /
analyzed: 'tsho ba med pas sam /
translated: fear of lack of livelihood,

original: de la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyi phyir blangs te /
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyi phyir blangs te /
translated: and for other such reasons.

original: de ltar yang phyis nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang phyis nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one degenerates later.

original: ji ltar lhod par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar lhod par byed ce na /
translated: How does one relax it?

original: 'di ltar kha cig tshul khrims blangs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig tshul khrims blangs nas /
translated: Some, having taken up morality,

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / 'gyod pa chung bas bslab pa'i gnas rnams la dam du mi srung gi nyams bzhin du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / 'gyod pa chung bas bslab pa'i gnas rnams la dam du mi srung gi nyams bzhin du spyod pa ste /
translated: One does not keep the precepts strictly, but violates them as one pleases, because of having little shame, little embarrassment, and little regret.

original: lhod par byed pas nges kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: lhod par byed pas nges kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur bas so //
translated: One's morality is impaired because one does not observe the rules of training strictly, but rather indulges in them, due to a lack of shame, lack of dread of wrongdoing, and small remorse.

original: ji ltar log par 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar log par 'dzin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one is seized by wrong graspings?

original: kha cig log par 'dzin pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig log par 'dzin pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Some are seized by wrong graspings.

original: gnas ma yin pa la 'gyod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la 'gyod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They regret what is not to be regretted,

original: 'gyod pa des dge ba'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir yang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'gyod pa des dge ba'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir yang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur bas so //
translated: and their morality is impaired because that regret becomes an obstacle to their virtue.

original: ji ltar bag med pa dang le los yongs su zin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bag med pa dang le los yongs su zin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one is seized by carelessness and laziness?

original: la la dag dang po nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar dam bcas pa med cing nyes pa byung na yang slar chos bzhin du gso bar mi byed la /
analyzed: la la dag dang po nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar dam bcas pa med cing nyes pa byung na yang slar chos bzhin du gso bar mi byed la /
translated: Some, from the beginning, do not take vows not to commit offenses, and even when they do commit offenses, they do not restore them in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nyal ba dang 'phres pa dang gnyid kyi bde ba rnams lhur @148a * //
analyzed: nyal ba dang 'phres pa dang gnyid kyi bde ba rnams lhur @148a * //
translated: They are devoted to the pleasures of sleep, lying on their backs, and napping.

original: len pa'i sgo nas kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: len pa'i sgo nas kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Also, morality is impaired by the manner of taking it.

original: ji ltar log par smon pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar log par smon pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it impaired by false vows?

original: kha cig tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: kha cig tshul khrims sam /
translated: Some, by false vows,

original: brtul zhugs sam /üîΩdka' thub 'dis lha'am lha las gzhan pa'am /
analyzed: brtul zhugs sam / dka' thub 'dis lha'am lha las gzhan pa'am /
translated: by a vow of asceticism,üîΩby this morality,üîΩwish for heaven, or for a god, or for something other than liberation, or for gain and honor.

original: rnyed pa'am / bkur stir ldan par gyur cig ces log par smon pas rnam par grol ba'i rgyur ma gyur pas kyang tshul khrims nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa'am / bkur stir ldan par gyur cig ces log par smon pas rnam par grol ba'i rgyur ma gyur pas kyang tshul khrims nyams pa'o //
translated: Also, morality is impaired by not being a cause of liberation.

original: ji ltar na spyod lam nyams par gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na spyod lam nyams par gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it impaired by improper conduct?

original: de la kha cig 'chags pa dang 'dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam dang / grong la sogs pa'i spyod yul la bab bab tu 'dug cing 'phral gyi bya ba dang / dge ba la sbyor ba rnams 'jig rten dang mi mthun zhing 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang /
analyzed: de la kha cig 'chags pa dang 'dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam dang / grong la sogs pa'i spyod yul la bab bab tu 'dug cing 'phral gyi bya ba dang / dge ba la sbyor ba rnams 'jig rten dang mi mthun zhing 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang /
translated: Some, by improper conduct, by improper behavior in walking, standing, etc., by improper behavior in the village, etc., by improper behavior in the immediate activity and application to virtue, by conduct contrary to the world, by conduct contrary to the Vinaya,

original: 'dul ba dang mi mthun zhing 'dul ba dang 'gal bas kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang mi mthun zhing 'dul ba dang 'gal bas kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: impair morality.

original: ji ltar na 'tsho ba nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'tsho ba nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one degenerate one's livelihood?

original: 'di la kha cig chog mi shes pa /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig chog mi shes pa /
translated: Some are not content,

original: 'dod pa mang po /
analyzed: 'dod pa mang po /
translated: have many desires,

original: gso dka' ba /
analyzed: gso dka' ba /
translated: are difficult to support,

original: dgang dka' ba ste /
analyzed: dgang dka' ba ste /
translated: and difficult to fill.

original: chos ma yin pa lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa tshol bas kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa tshol bas kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, one degenerates one's morality by seeking the requisites of the religious life such as the begging bowl and robes by means that are not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ji ltar na mtha' gnyis su lhung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mtha' gnyis su lhung zhe na /
translated: How does one fall into the two extremes?

original: 'di ltar kha cig 'dod pa'i bde ba la lhag par zhen nas /üîΩ'dod pa'i chos rnams la bag med par spyod pa dang / la la tsher ma la gnas 'cha' ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig 'dod pa'i bde ba la lhag par zhen nas / 'dod pa'i chos rnams la bag med par spyod pa dang / la la tsher ma la gnas 'cha' ba'am /
translated: Some, attached to the pleasures of desire,üîΩpractice the Dharma of desire without restraint.üîΩSome, through the practice of unbearable austerities such as living on thorns or in the hollows of trees,

original: thal pa'i nang na gnas 'cha' ba la sogs pa dka' thub mi bzad pa dang / chos 'dul ba las byed du ma gnang ba rnams spyad pas kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thal pa'i nang na gnas 'cha' ba la sogs pa dka' thub mi bzad pa dang / chos 'dul ba las byed du ma gnang ba rnams spyad pas kyang tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: and through the practice of what is not permitted in the Dharma and Vinaya, degenerate their morality.

original: ji ltar 'byung bar mi byed pa zhe na /üîΩla la dag tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung bar mi byed pa zhe na / la la dag tshul khrims sam /
translated: How does one not engage in the practice?üîΩSome, through the practice of morality or

original: brtul zhugs sam /
analyzed: brtul zhugs sam /
translated: austerities or

original: lta ba bsnyems te tshul khrims de nyid dam /
analyzed: lta ba bsnyems te tshul khrims de nyid dam /
translated: Or else, they are arrogant about their view and lax in their discipline.üîΩ

original: brtul zhugs de nyid kyis thar pa dang grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtul zhugs de nyid kyis thar pa dang grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, one is proud of one's view and thinks that through that view or through that morality or through that asceticism, one will be liberated and will attain release.

original: zhes log par bzung bas thar pa dang / grol ba'i rgyur ma gyur pa'i phyir yang tshul khrims nyams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes log par bzung bas thar pa dang / grol ba'i rgyur ma gyur pa'i phyir yang tshul khrims nyams pa'o //
translated: Because of this wrong understanding, morality is impaired, since it does not become a cause of liberation and release.

original: ji ltar na yi dam blangs pa nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yi dam blangs pa nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the vow of observance impaired?üîΩSome people, in every way, are shameless and have no fear of wrongdoing and of the dharmas that are not good.

original: la la dag thams cad nas thams cad du ngo tsha med cing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos byed pa la mi 'dzems pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pas sdig pa'i chos can /
analyzed: la la dag thams cad nas thams cad du ngo tsha med cing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos byed pa la mi 'dzems pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pas sdig pa'i chos can /
translated: They are immoral and have evil dharmas.

original: khong rul ba /
analyzed: khong rul ba /
translated: They are rotten within.

original: bong bu'i rjes su @148b 'jug pa /
analyzed: bong bu'i rjes su @148b 'jug pa /
translated: They follow the donkey path.

original: dge sbyong ma yin pa la dge sbyong du dam 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin pa la dge sbyong du dam 'cha' ba'o //
translated: They are not ascetics, but pretend to be ascetics.

original: de la lhag pa'i sems nyams pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa la sogs pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i sems nyams pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa la sogs pa nyams pa'o //
translated: Here, the impairment of higher thought is the impairment of the first, second, etc., meditations.

original: de nyams pa'i rgyu ni chos gos dang / lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad la chags pa mang ba dang / lus la nad mang ba dang / kha zas la brkam pa dang / 'du 'dzin mang po'i nang na gnas par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de nyams pa'i rgyu ni chos gos dang / lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad la chags pa mang ba dang / lus la nad mang ba dang / kha zas la brkam pa dang / 'du 'dzin mang po'i nang na gnas par dga' ba dang /
translated: many illnesses of the body; greed for food; delight in dwelling in the midst of a great deal of social interaction;üîΩdelight in the many activities of the world;

original: 'jig rten gyi las kyi bya ba mang po la dga' ba dang / smra ba mang po la mos pa dang / nyal ba dang 'phres pa la sogs pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi las kyi bya ba mang po la dga' ba dang / smra ba mang po la mos pa dang / nyal ba dang 'phres pa la sogs pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: being devoted to a great deal of talk; delight in sleeping, lying around, etc.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab nyams pa ni lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab nyams pa ni lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The degeneration of superior wisdom is the occurrence of false views.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One grasps the impermanent as permanent, etc.

original: de nyams pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: de nyams pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The causes of its degeneration are:

original: mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bdag dang byed pa po la sogs pa yod par tshul bzhin du ma yin pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bdag dang byed pa po la sogs pa yod par tshul bzhin du ma yin pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: reliance on nonvirtuous friends; listening to non-authoritative teachings; improper attention to the existence of a self, an agent, etc.

original: chos de dag mngon du ma spyod pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag mngon du ma spyod pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The non-practice of these teachings is their non-arising.

original: mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa thams cad nas thams cad du sems la skye bar mi bya'o zhes dam 'cha' zhing thog ma nas sgrims pa ni mos pa skyed pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'bad cing brtson 'grus rtsom pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa thams cad nas thams cad du sems la skye bar mi bya'o zhes dam 'cha' zhing thog ma nas sgrims pa ni mos pa skyed pa zhes bya'o // 'bad cing brtson 'grus rtsom pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: The vow I will not allow any nonvirtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen to arise in my mind and the initial tightening up are called generating interest.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis po don dang sbar dgos pas phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis po don dang sbar dgos pas phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: Exertion, striving, endeavoring, and so on are explained later because they are related to the two kinds of right abandonment.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis po bstan pa'i phyir sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩsdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni gang gong du bshad pa'i 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid dang mi dge ba bcu'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis po bstan pa'i phyir sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni gang gong du bshad pa'i 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid dang mi dge ba bcu'am /
translated: To teach the two kinds of right abandonment, the sutra says, In order to abandon the nonvirtuous phenomena that have arisen and so on.

original: bslab pa gsum nyams par byed pa'i chos so //üîΩchos de dag sems la mngon du gyur cing /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum nyams par byed pa'i chos so // chos de dag sems la mngon du gyur cing /
translated: Nonvirtuous phenomena are those that were explained above as the body, speech, and mind of the desire realm, the ten nonvirtues, or the phenomena that undermine the three trainings.

original: sems la kun tu spyod par gyur pa ni mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sems la kun tu spyod par gyur pa ni mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa'o //
translated: When those phenomena manifest in the mind and are engaged in by the mind, they are called nonvirtuous phenomena that have arisen.

original: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos sems la skyes pa de dag kyang thams cad nas thams cad du sems la gnas par mi bya sems la gzhag par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos sems la skyes pa de dag kyang thams cad nas thams cad du sems la gnas par mi bya sems la gzhag par mi bya zhing /
translated: Whatever sinful, non-virtuous dharmas have arisen in the mind, all of them should not be allowed to remain in the mind, should not be allowed to stay in the mind.

original: rnam par thams cad du dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thams cad du dor bar bya'o //
translated: They should be completely rejected.

original: zhes 'dod pa bskyed pa ni smos pa bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes 'dod pa bskyed pa ni smos pa bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The generation of this desire is called the generation of the will.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag kyang 'das pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / @149a * //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag kyang 'das pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / @149a * //
translated: Those sinful, non-virtuous dharmas arise in relation to objects of the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / da ltar gyi yul la dmigs nas skyes /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / da ltar gyi yul la dmigs nas skyes /
translated: in relation to objects of the future, and in relation to objects of the present.

original: de bas na de dag mdor na lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye ba dang / mngon du gyur pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag mdor na lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye ba dang / mngon du gyur pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye ba ste /

original: rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //

analyzed: de la gang 'das pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / 'das pa'i dngos po la dmigs nas skye ba ni /

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye ba'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye ba'o //

original: gang da ltar gyi yul la dmigs nas skye ba ni mngon du gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang da ltar gyi yul la dmigs nas skye ba ni mngon du gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa'o //

original: de la yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis bsdoms nas don bsdus te bstan pa /üîΩgang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / bskyed pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsam pa ni 'bad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis bsdoms nas don bsdus te bstan pa / gang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / bskyed pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsam pa ni 'bad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The two right efforts are summarized and taught in terms of their object.üîΩExertion is the effort to prevent the arising of evil unwholesome states that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have arisen, by focusing on a hidden object.

original: gang mngon du gyur pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / bskyed pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa ni brtson 'grus brtsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mngon du gyur pa'i yul la dmigs nas skye ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / bskyed pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa ni brtson 'grus brtsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Exertion is the effort to prevent the arising of evil unwholesome states that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have arisen, by focusing on a manifest object.

original: yang na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kha cig rnam par rtog pa'i skabs kyis skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kha cig rnam par rtog pa'i skabs kyis skyes pa yin la /

original: yul gyi stobs kyis skye ba yang yod /
analyzed: yul gyi stobs kyis skye ba yang yod /
translated: Some arise by the power of the object.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kha cig rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kha cig rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa yang yod do //

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis skye ba ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis skye ba ni /

analyzed: gnas pa'i tshe na ste /

analyzed: yul dang ma phrad kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs nas skye ba'o //

analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i stobs dang yul gyi stobs las skyes pa ni /

analyzed: kun du spyod pa'i dus na ste /

original: da ltar byung ba'i dngos po la dmigs shing de na yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung ba'i stobs kyis skye ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dngos po la dmigs shing de na yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung ba'i stobs kyis skye ba'o //
translated: They arise by the power of the occurrence of incorrect mental attention, even when taking as their object a present entity.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis skye ba ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i stobs kyis skye ba ni /
translated: Among them, those produced by the power of thought are

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes ba rnams ni mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba'i phyir bsgrims pa ni 'bad pa zhes bya'o //

translated: those that are undertaken in order to prevent the arising of nonvirtuous actions that have not yet arisen and to eliminate those that have already arisen. This is called ‚Äúexertion.‚Äù

original: gang rnam par rtog pa'i @149b stobs dang / yul gyi stobs kyis skye ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par rtog pa'i @149b stobs dang / yul gyi stobs kyis skye ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'bad pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the power of thought and the power of the object is the exertion of effort.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, there are three kinds of afflictions:

original: chung ngu dang chen po dang 'bring po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang chen po dang 'bring po'o //
