original: yang dag par bsdams pas rab tu spong ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bsdams pas rab tu spong ba ste /
translated: one abandons them by means of perfect restraint.

original: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa de dag phyis ci nas kyang rgyud las mi 'byung bar bsdam pa'i sgo nas spong bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa de dag phyis ci nas kyang rgyud las mi 'byung bar bsdam pa'i sgo nas spong bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One abandons them by means of restraint, so that those evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have arisen do not occur again in the future.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed ces bya ba la sogs pa bsgoms pas rab tu spong pa bstan te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed ces bya ba la sogs pa bsgoms pas rab tu spong pa bstan te /
translated: One abandons them by means of meditation, as indicated by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúOne generates virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams rten pa'i sgo nas bskyed par bya ba dang / skyes pa rnams bsgom pa'i sgo nas thob par bya ba dang / thob pa rnams mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams rten pa'i sgo nas bskyed par bya ba dang / skyes pa rnams bsgom pa'i sgo nas thob par bya ba dang / thob pa rnams mngon du byas nas /
translated: One generates those virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen by means of support. One causes those that have arisen to be obtained by means of meditation.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de rnams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de rnams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One causes those that have been obtained to be manifested, and one causes those that have been manifested to be increased.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su bsrungs pas spang ba bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su bsrungs pas spang ba bstan to //
translated: The teaching of abandonment is by means of the four right efforts, which are:üîΩthe production of non-arisen wholesome factors,üîΩthe maintenance of arisen wholesome factors,

original: gang dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la bag med pas spang ba dang / de'i grogs su gyur pa bag yod pa la brten nas gnas pa dang / rdzogs pa la sogs pa byas na /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la bag med pas spang ba dang / de'i grogs su gyur pa bag yod pa la brten nas gnas pa dang / rdzogs pa la sogs pa byas na /
translated: the removal of arisen unwholesome factors,

original: de la sgrib pa rnams med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmdor na gtang @151a * //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa rnams med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // mdor na gtang @151a * //
translated: and the non-production of unarisen unwholesome factors.üîΩThe first two right efforts are for the abandonment of what is to be abandoned, and the latter two are for the maintenance of what is to be maintained.

original: par bya ba'i dngos po dang / blang bar bya ba'i dngos po gtang ba dang / blang ba'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin te /üîΩde la yang dag pa'i spong ba snga ma gnyis ni gtang bar bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: par bya ba'i dngos po dang / blang bar bya ba'i dngos po gtang ba dang / blang ba'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin te / de la yang dag pa'i spong ba snga ma gnyis ni gtang bar bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: In brief, the four right efforts teach the perfection of the intention to abandon and to maintain, and the perfection of application.

original: yang dag pa'i spang ba phyi ma rnams ni blang bar bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spang ba phyi ma rnams ni blang bar bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The first two right efforts are what is to be abandoned, and the latter two are what is to be maintained.

original: mos pa bskyed ces bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to /üîΩ'bad cing brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: mos pa bskyed ces bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to / 'bad cing brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: The phrase he generates devotion indicates the perfection of attitude.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par smon par byed ces pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par smon par byed ces pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: He exerts himself, he generates enthusiasm, he exerts his energy, he controls his mind, and he correctly aspires. The phrase he exerts himself, he generates enthusiasm, he exerts his energy, he controls his mind, and he correctly aspires indicates the perfection of application.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi la yang dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi la yang dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The four right efforts have five aspects: object, nature, companion, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: de la yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams kyi dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams kyi dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the right efforts?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The object is the nonvirtuous factors that have arisen and those that have not arisen, as well as the virtuous factors that have arisen and those that have not arisen.

original: de la yang dag pa'i spong ba dang po ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma skyes pa la dmigs so //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i spong ba dang po ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma skyes pa la dmigs so //
translated: The first right effort has as its object the nonvirtuous factors that have not yet arisen.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa la dmigs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa la dmigs so //
translated: The second right effort has as its object the nonvirtuous factors that have already arisen.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba gsum pa ni gnyen po ma skyes pa la dmigs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba gsum pa ni gnyen po ma skyes pa la dmigs so //
translated: The third right effort has the nonarising of the antidote as its object.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi pa ni gnyen po skyes pa la dmigs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi pa ni gnyen po skyes pa la dmigs so //
translated: The fourth right effort has the arising of the antidote as its object.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba'i rang bzhin ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba'i rang bzhin ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin par rigs par bya'o //
translated: The nature of right effort should be understood as being the nature of vigor.

original: grogs ni brtson 'grus dang lhan cig ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i mos pa dang dad pa dang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //üîΩde la bsgom pa ni mos pa bskyed pa 'bad cing brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: grogs ni brtson 'grus dang lhan cig ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i mos pa dang dad pa dang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o // de la bsgom pa ni mos pa bskyed pa 'bad cing brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: Its associates are the mental activities that accompany vigor, such as faith, resolve, memory, concentration, and discernment.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par smon pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin cing yang dag par smon pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Cultivation is the generation of will, the exertion of vigor, the control of the mind, and the achievement of right concentration.üîΩThe cultivation of right effort is indicated by these words.

original: tshig de dag gi rten dang bcas pa brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: tshig de dag gi rten dang bcas pa brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: The basis of these words is the exertion of vigor.üîΩCultivation is indicated by the exertion of vigor.

original: bsgom pa bstan te de la mos pa ni brtson 'grus kyi rten no //
analyzed: bsgom pa bstan te de la mos pa ni brtson 'grus kyi rten no //
translated: Faith is the basis of vigor.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod pa dang mos pa yod na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mos pa yod na /
translated: If one has desire and faith, one can generate the will.

original: de'i rgyu las brtson 'grus 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las brtson 'grus 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because effort arises from its cause.üîΩWhen the mind is agitated by the signs of serenity and insight, one should bring to mind the faults of cyclic existence and subdue the mind.

original: de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan mas sems rgod par gyur na 'khor ba'i skyon yid la byas shing sems gdul ba dang / sems rmugs par gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan yid la bya ste /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan mas sems rgod par gyur na 'khor ba'i skyon yid la byas shing sems gdul ba dang / sems rmugs par gyur na de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan yid la bya ste /
translated: When the mind is languid, one should bring to mind the virtues of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: sems gzengs bstod par bya ba'i mtshan ma yid la bya ba med par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'ba' zhig bsgom pa ni 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: sems gzengs bstod par bya ba'i mtshan ma yid la bya ba med par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'ba' zhig bsgom pa ni 'bad pa'o //
translated: When one cultivates only serenity and insight without bringing to mind the signs of elation of the mind, that is called ‚Äúexertion.‚Äù

original: nam sems rgod pa dang rmugs par gyur pa na de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgod pa dang zhum pa'i gnyen por gyur pa zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / lhag mthong gi mtshan ma yid la byed pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde @151b yang phye ste sems g-yengs par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nam sems rgod pa dang rmugs par gyur pa na de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgod pa dang zhum pa'i gnyen por gyur pa zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma dang / lhag mthong gi mtshan ma yid la byed pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde @151b yang phye ste sems g-yengs par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: When the mind is agitated or languid, in order to remove those, the bringing to mind of the signs of serenity and insight that are the antidotes to agitation and languor is called ‚Äúthe exertion of effort.‚ÄùüîΩWhen the mind is distracted, one should bring to mind the signs of serenity and insight that are the antidotes to distraction.

original: zhi gnas yid la byas nas 'jil bar byed pa ni sems rab tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas yid la byas nas 'jil bar byed pa ni sems rab tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The calming of the mind is the right holding of the mind.

original: sems zhum par gyur pa'i tshe lhag mthong yid la byas nas sems gzengs stod par byed pa ni yang dag par smon pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhum par gyur pa'i tshe lhag mthong yid la byas nas sems gzengs stod par byed pa ni yang dag par smon pa'o //
translated: The uplifting of the mind is the right aspiration when the mind is low.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad nyams par bya ba dang / gnyen po'i chos thob par bya zhing 'phel bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad nyams par bya ba dang / gnyen po'i chos thob par bya zhing 'phel bar bya'o //
translated: The result of cultivation is the weakening of all resistances and the attainment and increase of the remedies.

original: de la yang dag pa'i spong ba gong ma gnyis kyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i spong ba gong ma gnyis kyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams par byed pa bstan to //
translated: The first two right efforts show the weakening of resistances.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba gsum pas ni gnyen po'i phyogs thob par byed pa bstan to //üîΩyang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi pas ni gnyen po'i phyogs 'phel bar byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba gsum pas ni gnyen po'i phyogs thob par byed pa bstan to // yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi pas ni gnyen po'i phyogs 'phel bar byed pa bstan to //
translated: The third right effort shows the attainment of the remedies.üîΩThe fourth right effort shows the increase of the remedies.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: After the teaching of the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural powers are taught.

original: de bas na de bshad pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de bshad pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since this is the section explaining the bases of supernatural powers,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúWhat are the four bases of supernatural powers?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa'i sbyor ba rnams la bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa'i sbyor ba rnams la bya ba ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúsupernatural power‚Äù refers to the applications of the superknowledges such as the divine eye and so on.

original: mos pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi ni mngon par shes pa rnams skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen byed pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi ni mngon par shes pa rnams skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen byed pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The four concentrations such as aspiration and so on are called bases of supernatural power because they act as the causes and conditions for the arising of the superknowledges.

original: yang na skyes bu gang la rkang pa yod pa de ni 'gro ba dang 'ongs pa la sogs pa la mthu yod pa bzhin du gang la ting nge 'dzin bzhi yod pa des kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor ba thob pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i mthu yod pas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na skyes bu gang la rkang pa yod pa de ni 'gro ba dang 'ongs pa la sogs pa la mthu yod pa bzhin du gang la ting nge 'dzin bzhi yod pa des kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor ba thob pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i mthu yod pas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, just as a person who has legs has the ability to go and come, one who has the four concentrations also has the ability to attain and actualize supramundane resources, so they are called bases of supernatural power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the first base of supernatural power,

original: dge slong dag mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dag mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Monks, the basis of supernatural power that is accompanied by the concentration of will and the motivating factors of exertion is called ‚Äúthe basis of supernatural power.‚Äù

original: gang gi sdug bsngal dang stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa la mos shing yid ches pa gtsor byas nas brtson 'grus la gus pa bskyed pa de bsgrims nas zhugs pa la sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi sdug bsngal dang stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa la mos shing yid ches pa gtsor byas nas brtson 'grus la gus pa bskyed pa de bsgrims nas zhugs pa la sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa ni /
translated: One who is primarily interested in and believes in suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and so on, and who generates respect for effort, when he or she is engaged in concentration, touches one-pointedness of mind.

original: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //üîΩyang na mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa bskyed par bya ba dang / dge ba'i chos bskyed pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o // yang na mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa bskyed par bya ba dang / dge ba'i chos bskyed pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This is called the concentration of will.

original: mos pa dang dad pa cher skyes pa las sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa dang dad pa cher skyes pa las sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the concentration of will is the one-pointedness of mind that arises from the great interest and faith in the non-production of non-virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, the abandonment of non-virtuous dharmas that have arisen, the production of virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, and the maintenance of virtuous dharmas that have arisen.

original: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa de la nyes pa rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa de la nyes pa rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are five faults in cultivating the meditative stabilization of aspiration.

original: nyes pa lnga spang ba'i phyir @152a * //
analyzed: nyes pa lnga spang ba'i phyir @152a * //
translated: For the purpose of abandoning the five faults,

original: gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate the eight applications which abandon the antidotes.

original: nyes pa rnam pa lnga ni le lo dang / gdams ngag nyams pa dang / zhum rgod dang / 'du mi byed pa dang / 'du byed pa dang lnga'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa lnga ni le lo dang / gdams ngag nyams pa dang / zhum rgod dang / 'du mi byed pa dang / 'du byed pa dang lnga'o //
translated: The five faults are laziness, forgetting the instruction, discouragement and agitation, non-application, and application.

original: de la zhum rgod gnyis ni nyes pa gcig tu bsdu'o //
analyzed: de la zhum rgod gnyis ni nyes pa gcig tu bsdu'o //
translated: Among those, discouragement and agitation are counted as one fault.

original: de la le lo ni mi dge ba spong ba dang / dge ba bsgrub pa la mi 'jug pa ni le lo ste /
analyzed: de la le lo ni mi dge ba spong ba dang / dge ba bsgrub pa la mi 'jug pa ni le lo ste /
translated: Laziness is not engaging in abandoning non-virtue and accomplishing virtue.

original: des dang po nyid du dge ba la mi sbyor ba'i dus la sgrib pa ni nyes pa'o //
analyzed: des dang po nyid du dge ba la mi sbyor ba'i dus la sgrib pa ni nyes pa'o //
translated: Its fault is that it obscures the time of not applying to virtue in the first place.

original: gdams ngag mi brjed pa ni ji skad du bstan pa'i bsam gtan gyi man ngag tshig dang don du brjed par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag mi brjed pa ni ji skad du bstan pa'i bsam gtan gyi man ngag tshig dang don du brjed par gyur pa ste /
translated: Forgetting the instruction is forgetting the words and meanings of the instructions of concentration as they have been taught.

original: de'i bsam gtan sbyor ba la zhugs pa na bsam gtan gyi don brjed pas ni sgrib par gyur pa'i phyir nyes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bsam gtan sbyor ba la zhugs pa na bsam gtan gyi don brjed pas ni sgrib par gyur pa'i phyir nyes pa'o //
translated: When one is engaged in the preparatory practice of meditation, forgetfulness of the meaning of meditation is a fault, because it becomes an obstruction.

original: sems ni bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba la zhugs nas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i tshe na sems zhum pa dang / rgod pa rab tu gcod pa na nyes pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba la zhugs nas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i tshe na sems zhum pa dang / rgod pa rab tu gcod pa na nyes pa ste /
translated: When the mind is engaged in the preparatory practice of meditation and has become one-pointed, slackness and excitedness are faults in the cutting off of the mind.

original: de gnyis byung na sems las su rung ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis byung na sems las su rung ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When those two occur, the mind does not become serviceable.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa byung ba'i dus na de sel bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yid la mi byed pa ni nyes pa ste /
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa byung ba'i dus na de sel bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yid la mi byed pa ni nyes pa ste /
translated: When slackness and excitedness occur, the non-attention to the sign of their removal is a fault.

original: de gnyis ma gsal na sems ma zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ma gsal na sems ma zhi bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When those two are not clear, the mind does not become calm.

original: nam zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang bral nas sems mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i tshe mngon par 'du byed pa nyes pa ste /
analyzed: nam zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang bral nas sems mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i tshe mngon par 'du byed pa nyes pa ste /
translated: When the mind is in equipoise, free from slackness and excitedness, the application of effort is a fault.

original: mnyam pa nyid las bskyod na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid las bskyod na /
translated: When one is moved from equipoise,

original: sems g-yengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems g-yengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the mind becomes distracted.

original: nyes pa rnam pa lnga spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa lnga spong ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the five faults,

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad ni mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / bag yangs dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad ni mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / bag yangs dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: The eight formative factors of abandonment are: will, vigor, faith, serenity, mindfulness, awareness, volition and equanimity.

original: de la mos pa ni bdag gis ting nge 'dzin gang gi dus na yongs su rdzogs par bya /
analyzed: de la mos pa ni bdag gis ting nge 'dzin gang gi dus na yongs su rdzogs par bya /
translated: Will is the desire to perfect the meditative concentration at a certain time,

original: bag la nyal ba rnams kyang ji ltar spong bar bya //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba rnams kyang ji ltar spong bar bya //
translated: to abandon the latent states and

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyang ji ltar dor bar bya zhes 'dod pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyang ji ltar dor bar bya zhes 'dod pa skye ba'o //
translated: to eliminate evil and unwholesome states.

original: brtson 'grus ni ji srid du gnyen po bsgom pa la rgyun mi chad par 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni ji srid du gnyen po bsgom pa la rgyun mi chad par 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Vigor is the uninterrupted application of the counteragent for as long as necessary.

original: dad pa ni rgyun mi chad par zhugs shing gnas pa las yon tan gong ma rnams thob par bya bar dad pa skye zhing yid ches par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni rgyun mi chad par zhugs shing gnas pa las yon tan gong ma rnams thob par bya bar dad pa skye zhing yid ches par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Faith is the arising of confidence and the desire to attain the higher virtues through uninterrupted application and abiding in the virtues that have been attained.

original: de la bag yangs ni gang dad pa mngon du byung bas rgyu byas nas sems dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: de la bag yangs ni gang dad pa mngon du byung bas rgyu byas nas sems dga' ba skye'o //
translated: Serenity is the joy of mind that arises from the performance of the cause, namely, the manifestation of faith.

original: sems dga' ba las lus bde bar 'gyur ro //üîΩlus bde ba las yid bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dga' ba las lus bde bar 'gyur ro // lus bde ba las yid bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From a joyful mind, the body becomes comfortable.üîΩFrom a comfortable body, the mind becomes happy.

original: yid bde bar gyur na sems las su rung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid bde bar gyur na sems las su rung bar 'gyur la /
translated: When the mind is happy, it becomes workable.

original: sems las su rung bar gyur pa de sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gnas ngan len gyi phyogs bsal ba ni bag yangs so //
analyzed: sems las su rung bar gyur pa de sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gnas ngan len gyi phyogs bsal ba ni bag yangs so //
translated: When the mind becomes workable, it is free from the negative influences of sinful, nonvirtuous qualities.

original: de la dran pa ni zhi @152b gnas kyi phyogs su gtogs pas sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni zhi @152b gnas kyi phyogs su gtogs pas sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Among these, mindfulness is included in meditative serenity and consists of the nine mental states.üîΩThe nine mental states are:üîΩplacing the mind,üîΩcontinually placing the mind,üîΩclose placement,

original: rnam pa dgu ni nang du sems 'jog par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog pa dang / kun tu 'jog pa dang / nye bar 'jog pa dang / dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ni nang du sems 'jog par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'jog pa dang / kun tu 'jog pa dang / nye bar 'jog pa dang / dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: calming,üîΩfully calming,üîΩcomplete pacification,üîΩone-pointedness, and

original: gcig tu byed pa dang mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu byed pa dang mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: meditative equipoise.

original: de la phyi'i dmigs pa las sems bsdus nas nang du mi yengs pa'i tshul du sems dang po nyid du bsdus pa ni 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi'i dmigs pa las sems bsdus nas nang du mi yengs pa'i tshul du sems dang po nyid du bsdus pa ni 'jog pa'o //
translated: Placing the mind is the first gathering of the mind, which is done by withdrawing the mind from external objects and not allowing it to be distracted outward.

original: sems dang po nyid du bsdus pa las phyi'i dmigs pa rnams la sems g-yo la /üîΩrags pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po nyid du bsdus pa las phyi'i dmigs pa rnams la sems g-yo la / rags pa 'byung ste /
translated: The mind is first concentrated, and then it is distracted by external objects.üîΩThe gross mind is collected inwardly.

original: rags pa'i sems de phrar nang du sdud pa ni yang dag par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: rags pa'i sems de phrar nang du sdud pa ni yang dag par 'jog pa'o //
translated: This is correct placement.

original: de ltar gzhag pa las dran pa nyams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gzhag pa las dran pa nyams pa'i phyir /
translated: From such placement, mindfulness is lost,

original: sems g-yengs par gyur pa slar yang sdud pa ni kun tu 'jog pa'o //üîΩde nas dang po nyid du sems phyi rol du mi g-yengs pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa ni nye bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: sems g-yengs par gyur pa slar yang sdud pa ni kun tu 'jog pa'o // de nas dang po nyid du sems phyi rol du mi g-yengs pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa ni nye bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: and the mind becomes distracted. Again collecting it, it is correctly placed.üîΩThen, for the first time, the mind obtains the characteristic of not being distracted externally. This is close placement.

original: thog ma nyid nas g-yengs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la skyon dang bcas par mthong ba'i 'du shes kyi dbang du byas nas sems 'phro bas sbyin par mi byed pa ni dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma nyid nas g-yengs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la skyon dang bcas par mthong ba'i 'du shes kyi dbang du byas nas sems 'phro bas sbyin par mi byed pa ni dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: From the very beginning, the mind is not distracted by the faults of objects such as form. This is control.

original: sems 'khrugs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la skyon dang bcas par mthong nas sems 'phror mi ster ba ni zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems 'khrugs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la skyon dang bcas par mthong nas sems 'phror mi ster ba ni zhi bar bya'o //
translated: When one sees the fault in the secondary defilement of discursive thought, which is the cause of mental disturbance, and does not allow the mind to scatter, then one pacifies.

original: dran pa nyams pa las rnam par rtog pa kun tu skyes par gyur na yang de gnas par mi byed pa ni nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa las rnam par rtog pa kun tu skyes par gyur na yang de gnas par mi byed pa ni nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: When discursive thought arises due to the loss of mindfulness, and one does not allow it to remain, then one completely pacifies.

original: 'bad pa dang bcas pa ni skabs dang bar chad med par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la rtag tu gnas pa ni gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa dang bcas pa ni skabs dang bar chad med par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la rtag tu gnas pa ni gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: When one always remains in the stream of concentration without interruption and without effort, then one unifies.

original: ting nge 'dzin legs par bsgoms pas mngon par 'du bya ba med cing lhun gyis grub pa nyid du ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la rgyun du gnas pa ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin legs par bsgoms pas mngon par 'du bya ba med cing lhun gyis grub pa nyid du ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun la rgyun du gnas pa ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: When one remains continuously in the stream of concentration without exertion and spontaneously, due to the good cultivation of concentration, then one has a concentrated mind.

original: de la shes bzhin ni gang lhag mthong gi phyogs su gyur pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: de la shes bzhin ni gang lhag mthong gi phyogs su gyur pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Herein, vigilance is the wisdom that is on the side of insight.

original: de yang chos rnams rnam par 'jig pa dang / rab tu 'jog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / kun tu tshol ba ste /
analyzed: de yang chos rnams rnam par 'jig pa dang / rab tu 'jog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / kun tu tshol ba ste /
translated: Furthermore, it is fourfold:üîΩdiscernment,üîΩestablishment,

original: rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: investigation, andüîΩseeking.

original: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos ji snyed pa yod pa shes par byed pa ni rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos ji snyed pa yod pa shes par byed pa ni rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the knowledge of the existence of all things, such as the aggregates and elements.

original: chos de dag kyang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du shes par byed pa ni rab tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du shes par byed pa ni rab tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: Establishment is the knowledge of things as they are, such as impermanence and suffering.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyis dang po chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid tshol ba ni kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyis dang po chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid tshol ba ni kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: Investigation is the initial search for the characteristics of things by means of conceptual knowledge.

original: de'i 'og tu zhib tu rtog pa ni kun tu tshol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhib tu rtog pa ni kun tu tshol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Seeking is the subsequent thorough investigation.

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
translated: Thought is the mental disposition toward something.

original: @153a * // sgrib pa skyes sam ma skyes pa dang / spangs sam ma spangs pa brtags nas de spong ba la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: @153a * // sgrib pa skyes sam ma skyes pa dang / spangs sam ma spangs pa brtags nas de spong ba la 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the engagement in the elimination of that which is to be eliminated, after having examined whether the obscurations have arisen or not, and whether they have been eliminated or not.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems kyi las so //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems kyi las so //
translated: It is a mental activity that is in harmony with serenity and insight.

original: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam par gyur pa las mi g-yo ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam par gyur pa las mi g-yo ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the stability of the mind in its natural state, without wavering.

original: de la le lo spang ba'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed rnam pa bzhi bsgoms te /
analyzed: de la le lo spang ba'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed rnam pa bzhi bsgoms te /
translated: In order to eliminate laziness, one cultivates four kinds of formative influence that are in harmony with elimination.

original: mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / bag yangs so //
analyzed: mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / bag yangs so //
translated: They are: interest, zeal, faith, and serenity.

original: de la mos pa ni 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la mos pa ni 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Among them, interest has the characteristic of desire.

original: brtson 'grus ni 'bad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni 'bad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Zeal has the characteristic of exertion.

original: dad pa ni yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dad pa ni yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Faith has the characteristic of conviction.

original: bag yangs ni las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bag yangs ni las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Serenity has the characteristic of serviceability.

original: bzhi po de dag ji ltar na le lo'i gnyen por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ji ltar na le lo'i gnyen por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do these four become the antidote to laziness?

original: des brtson 'grus kyi gnas dang / rten dang / mtshan ma dang / 'bras bu bsten pa'i sgo nas 'gyur te /
analyzed: des brtson 'grus kyi gnas dang / rten dang / mtshan ma dang / 'bras bu bsten pa'i sgo nas 'gyur te /
translated: They do so by means of the basis, support, sign, and result of zeal.

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi gnas ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyi gnas ni mos pa'o //
translated: Among them, interest is the basis of zeal.

original: de la brten pa ni brtson 'grus nyid do //
analyzed: de la brten pa ni brtson 'grus nyid do //
translated: and the basis of that is effort.üîΩ

original: 'dod pa yod na brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa yod na brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Effort is based on desire, because one undertakes the practice of effort when there is desire.

original: 'dod pa'i mtshan ma dang rgyu ni dad pa dang / yid ches pa yod na 'dod pa dang mos pa skye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbrtson 'grus kyi 'bras bu ni bag yangs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mtshan ma dang rgyu ni dad pa dang / yid ches pa yod na 'dod pa dang mos pa skye ba'i phyir ro // brtson 'grus kyi 'bras bu ni bag yangs te /
translated: The signs and cause of desire are faith and conviction, because desire and resolve arise when there is faith and conviction.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams nas lus las su rung bas sems las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid bag yangs skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams nas lus las su rung bas sems las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid bag yangs skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The result of effort is ease, because when one has undertaken effort, ease arises, which is characterized by physical and mental workability.

original: bag yangs skyes nas le lo med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag yangs skyes nas le lo med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When there is ease, there is no laziness.

original: lhag ma nyes pa bzhi'i gnyen por ni spong ba'i 'du byed bzhi rnams rim bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: lhag ma nyes pa bzhi'i gnyen por ni spong ba'i 'du byed bzhi rnams rim bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The remaining four applications of abandoning are to be connected sequentially with the four remaining faults.

original: gdams ngag brjod pa'i gnyen po ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag brjod pa'i gnyen po ni dran pa'o //
translated: The antidote to forgetting the instruction is mindfulness.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po ni shes bzhin te /üîΩnam sems zhum pa dang rgod pa byung na /
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po ni shes bzhin te / nam sems zhum pa dang rgod pa byung na /
translated: The antidote to laziness is effort.

original: shes bzhin gyis de rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis de rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The antidote to forgetting is introspection.üîΩThe antidote to desire and discontent is equanimity.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i gnyen po ni sems pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i gnyen po ni sems pa ste /
translated: The antidote to non-exertion is volition.

original: gang gi zhum pa dang rgod pa sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhum pa dang rgod pa sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which removes slackness and restlessness.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i gnyen po ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i gnyen po ni btang snyoms so //
translated: The antidote to exertion is equanimity.

original: nam g-yo bar 'dod pa na mi g-yo bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: nam g-yo bar 'dod pa na mi g-yo bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is that which, when one wishes to move, causes one to remain unmoving.

original: de ltar nyes pa lnga spong ba'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang bcas par bsgom pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyes pa lnga spong ba'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang bcas par bsgom pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the foot of psychic power which is the concentration of will, accompanied by the abandonment of the eight faults and the eight formative forces of abandonment, is called the foot of psychic power.

original: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan par bsgom pa yin par bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan par bsgom pa yin par bsten pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, that concentration of will is cultivated in association with the four noble truths.

original: dben pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dben pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúHe dwells secluded, detached from sensual desires and unwholesome states. ‚Äù

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sdug bsngal gyi yul mthong na de dang 'bral bar 'dod pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la gnas pa'i dus na ni dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sdug bsngal gyi yul mthong na de dang 'bral bar 'dod pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la gnas pa'i dus na ni dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one sees the object of the truth of suffering, one wishes to be separated from it. Therefore, when one is abiding in the truth of suffering, it is called ‚Äúabiding in seclusion.‚Äù

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni 'dod chags @153b sred pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni 'dod chags @153b sred pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The truth of origination has the characteristic of desire and craving.

original: de ni spang bar bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: de ni spang bar bya ba yin pas /
translated: It is to be abandoned.

original: de la dmigs pa'i tshe ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i tshe ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when one focuses on it, it is called ‚Äúabiding in freedom from desire.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa yin pas na bde ba ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa yin pas na bde ba ste /
translated: Since cessation is the abandonment of all suffering, it is happiness.

original: de la dmigs pa'i dus na ni 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i dus na ni 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o//
translated: Therefore, when one focuses on it, it is called ‚Äúabiding in cessation.‚Äù

original: lam gyi bden pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni /
translated: The truth of the path

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byed la /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byed la /
translated: is that which causes the truth of cessation to be realized.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad spong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad spong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: It is that which causes the abandonment of all suffering.

original: de la dmigs pa na ni rnam par spong bar bsngos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa na ni rnam par spong bar bsngos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when one focuses on it, it is called ‚Äúbeing dedicated to complete abandonment.‚Äù

original: bsgom pa de yang mos pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa sems 'dus pa dang g-yengs pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa yongs su spong bar bya ba'i rnam par bsgom pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa de yang mos pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa sems 'dus pa dang g-yengs pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa yongs su spong bar bya ba'i rnam par bsgom pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Furthermore, in order to demonstrate the meditation that completely abandons the causes of the mind's internal contraction and external distraction, which are adverse to interest and so forth,

original: bdag gi mos pa rab tu zhen pa dang / rab tu 'dzin par ma gyur cig ces sgom par byed pa dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gi mos pa rab tu zhen pa dang / rab tu 'dzin par ma gyur cig ces sgom par byed pa dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he says, May my interest not be weak, not be seized, not be held.

original: de la sems nang du 'du ba'i rgyu ni lhag mthong dang bral bas gnyid dang rmugs pa dang le lo'i dbang du sems nang du 'dus shing zhum par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems nang du 'du ba'i rgyu ni lhag mthong dang bral bas gnyid dang rmugs pa dang le lo'i dbang du sems nang du 'dus shing zhum par gyur pa'o //
translated: Therein, the cause of the mind's internal contraction is the mind's internal contraction and depression due to the influence of sleep, languor, and indolence, because of being devoid of insight.

original: de yang spang dgos pa'i phyir bdag gi mos pa rab tu zhan par ma gyur cig ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang spang dgos pa'i phyir bdag gi mos pa rab tu zhan par ma gyur cig ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Since that must be abandoned, he says, May my interest not be weak.

original: sems g-yengs pa'i rgyu ni mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang bral bas gtsang ba la sogs par mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i sgo nas yul la sems 'phros pa ste /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa'i rgyu ni mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang bral bas gtsang ba la sogs par mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i sgo nas yul la sems 'phros pa ste /
translated: The cause of the mind's external distraction is the mind's scattering toward objects by way of apprehending signs such as purity, because of being devoid of the notion of impurity.

original: de yang spang dgos pa'i phyir rab tu 'dzin par ma gyur cig ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang spang dgos pa'i phyir rab tu 'dzin par ma gyur cig ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Since they must be abandoned, it is said, ‚ÄúMay they not become over-exerted.‚Äù

original: de gnyis kyi gnyen po yang sems zhum pa dang zhan pa spang ba'i phyir lhag mthong bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi gnyen po yang sems zhum pa dang zhan pa spang ba'i phyir lhag mthong bsgom pa'o //
translated: The antidote to those two is cultivating insight in order to abandon a depressed, weak mind.

original: sems g-yengs pa dang rab tu 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir ni zhi gnas sam lus la mi gtsang bar brtag pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa dang rab tu 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir ni zhi gnas sam lus la mi gtsang bar brtag pa bsgom mo //
translated: In order to abandon a distracted mind and over-exertion, cultivate serenity or the contemplation of the body as impure.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the second basis of supernormal power,

original: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúendowed with the meditative stabilization of effort and the will to strive.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: When, in order to not produce non-virtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen, to abandon those that have arisen, to produce virtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen, and to increase those that have arisen,

original: brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rtag tu brtsam pa la sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rtag tu brtsam pa la sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa ni /
translated: The touching of one-pointedness of mind in the uninterrupted and constant practice of diligence is

original: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: called the samadhi of diligence.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no @154a * //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no @154a * //
translated: The application of the abandonment factors and so forth are as explained above.

original: 'dzin 'phrul gyi rkang pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin 'phrul gyi rkang pa gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the third foot of magical powers,

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúThe samadhi of mind that is endowed with the application of abandonment.‚Äù

original: gang tshe rabs gzhan du ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i sa bon la brten nas tshe 'dir ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dang / 'dir bsgom pa las yang snga ma snga ma'i mthus phyi ma phyi ma'i mthu che zhing ting nge 'dzin gyi sa bon brtas pa la brten nas 'bad mi dgos par sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gang tshe rabs gzhan du ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i sa bon la brten nas tshe 'dir ting nge 'dzin sgom pa dang / 'dir bsgom pa las yang snga ma snga ma'i mthus phyi ma phyi ma'i mthu che zhing ting nge 'dzin gyi sa bon brtas pa la brten nas 'bad mi dgos par sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa ni /
translated: When, based on the seed of samadhi cultivated in other lives, one cultivates samadhi in this life, and based on the cultivation in this life, through the power of the former, the power of the latter is greater, and based on the growth of the seed of samadhi, the touching of one-pointedness of mind without effort is

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the meditative stabilization of mind.

original: gzhan yang gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be seen as explained above.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the four bases of supernatural powers,

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he taught the meditative stabilization of analysis, which is endowed with the formative force of abandonment, and so on.

original: gang gzhan dag gi chos bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rab tu 'byed pa la the tshom dang bral nas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gang gzhan dag gi chos bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rab tu 'byed pa la the tshom dang bral nas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa ni /
translated: When one is free from doubt with regard to the differentiation of the characteristics of the teachings of others and the teachings, and one's mind becomes one-pointed,

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the meditative stabilization of analysis.

original: yang na bsgom par bya ba'i yul gyi don bshig cing btsal ba las rnyed par gyur nas de nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bsgom par bya ba'i yul gyi don bshig cing btsal ba las rnyed par gyur nas de nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, when one has found the object of meditation by destroying and investigating the object of meditation, and one's mind abides one-pointedly on that object, this is called the meditative stabilization of analysis.

original: gzhan yang gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gong du bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be seen as explained above.

original: 'dir yang rnam pa lngar gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam pa lngar gzhag ste /
translated: Here, it is also presented in five aspects.

original: dmigs pa dang ; rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩde la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yul lam /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ; rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o // de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yul lam /
translated: 1. the object, 2. the nature, 3. the associates, 4. the practice, and 5. the result of the practice.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pas gang las su bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i 'phrul lo ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pas gang las su bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i 'phrul lo ;
translated: The object of the bases of psychic power is the object of concentration or the psychic power that is to be created by perfecting concentration, such as the supernormal accomplishments of the eye, ear, etc.

original: / rang bzhin gang zhe na /
analyzed: / rang bzhin gang zhe na /
translated: What is their nature?

original: mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang sems dang / dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang sems dang / dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of will, vigor, mind, and investigation.

original: grogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: grogs gang zhe na /
translated: What are their associates?

original: de ting nge 'dzin de bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'dod pa dang 'dod mi chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'dod pa dang 'dod mi chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the mind and mental activities associated with those four concentrations, such as faith, desire, resolution, contact, and feeling.

original: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is their practice?

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad la goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad la goms par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of the eight formative forces of abandonment.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of their practice?

original: gang 'dod pa de thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de thob pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of whatever one desires.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the teaching of the four bases of supernatural powers,

original: dge slong dag 'di ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he said, ‚ÄúMonks, these are the four bases of supernatural powers.‚Äù

original: rdzu 'phrul @154b gyi rkang pa bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul @154b gyi rkang pa bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After teaching the bases of supernatural powers,

original: dbang po lnga bstan te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga bstan te /
translated: he taught the five faculties.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to explain them as they were taught,

original: de la dge slong dag dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dge slong dag dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: he said, ‚ÄúMonks, what are the five faculties?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: dbang po lnga zhes grangs smos pa'i ming so sor phye ste bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po lnga zhes grangs smos pa'i ming so sor phye ste bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the five faculties by explaining their names individually, he said,

original: dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThe faculty of faith‚Äù up to

original: shes rab kyi dbang po zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //üîΩde la yod pa dang yon tan can dang nus pa'i dbang po la rim bzhin du yid ches pa dang / rab tu dang ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa ni /üîΩdad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so // de la yod pa dang yon tan can dang nus pa'i dbang po la rim bzhin du yid ches pa dang / rab tu dang ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa ni / dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe faculty of wisdom.‚ÄùüîΩAmong them, faith is the confidence,üîΩclarity, and longing for what exists, what has good qualities, and what is possible.

original: mtshan nyid de yod pa la ni yid ches so ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid de yod pa la ni yid ches so ;
translated: One has confidence in the characteristics of what exists.

original: / yon tan la ni sems dad pa'o //
analyzed: / yon tan la ni sems dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in the virtues.

original: nub pa la 'dod pa skye ba ste /
analyzed: nub pa la 'dod pa skye ba ste /
translated: Desire arises in regard to what is lost.

original: de bas na 'dod pa dang mos pa gnyis don gcig pas dad pa'i dbang po ni mos pa'i dbang po'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa dang mos pa gnyis don gcig pas dad pa'i dbang po ni mos pa'i dbang po'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, since desire and faith have the same meaning, the faculty of faith has controlling power over the meditative concentration of faith.

original: dge ba sgrub pa dang mi dge ba spong pa la brtson pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: dge ba sgrub pa dang mi dge ba spong pa la brtson pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ste /
translated: The faculty of effort is the exertion in the accomplishment of the wholesome and the abandonment of the unwholesome.

original: de bas na brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos ni brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po la dbang byed do //
analyzed: de bas na brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos ni brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po la dbang byed do //
translated: Thus, the faculty of effort has controlling power over the meditative concentration of effort.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya ba'i yul sems kyi gsal bar mthong zhing ma brjed pa ni dran pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya ba'i yul sems kyi gsal bar mthong zhing ma brjed pa ni dran pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the clear perception and non-forgetting of the object that is cultivated in meditative concentration.

original: de bas na dran pa'i dbang pos ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed do //üîΩsems rtse gcig tu gnas shing /
analyzed: de bas na dran pa'i dbang pos ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed do // sems rtse gcig tu gnas shing /
translated: Thus, the faculty of mindfulness has controlling power over the meditative concentration of mind.üîΩThe faculty of meditative concentration is the single-pointed abiding of mind.

original: phyi rol du ma g-yengs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du ma g-yengs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ste /
translated: It is the non-distraction of mind towards external objects.

original: des kyang sems kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid la dbang byed do //
analyzed: des kyang sems kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid la dbang byed do //
translated: and that in turn controls the concentration of the mind.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu 'byed pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu 'byed pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the discernment of the characteristics of things.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi dbang pos ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi dbang pos ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the faculty of wisdom controls the concentration of investigation.

original: yang na 'khor ba nyes pa dang bcas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yon tan dang bcas par dad par yid ches na /
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba nyes pa dang bcas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yon tan dang bcas par dad par yid ches na /
translated: Or else, when one has confidence in the faith that the lifecycle has faults and that nirvana has virtues,

original: 'khor ba las 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba las 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: one undertakes the effort to leave the lifecycle.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom ste gang yid ches pa ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom ste gang yid ches pa ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of faith is the confidence in that.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of effort is the undertaking of that.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams nas lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams nas lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnams 'byung ste /
translated: When one has undertaken the effort, the virtues of superior morality and superior wisdom arise.

original: de la bya ba dang mi bya ba mtshan nyid dran pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la bya ba dang mi bya ba mtshan nyid dran pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the mindfulness of the characteristics of what is to be done and what is not to be done.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //üîΩlhag pa'i shes rab kyi @155a * //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o // lhag pa'i shes rab kyi @155a * //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the training in the higher mind.

original: bslab pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bslab pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the training in the higher wisdom.

original: yang na mdo 'di nyid kyi gnas rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi bshad de /
analyzed: yang na mdo 'di nyid kyi gnas rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi bshad de /
translated: Or else, in this very s≈´tra, the four branches of stream entry are explained:

original: kun tu rig pa'i dad pa bzhi la gnas pa nyid dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: kun tu rig pa'i dad pa bzhi la gnas pa nyid dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of faith is the very state of abiding in the four kinds of faith that are fully understood.

original: yang dag par spong pa bzhi la gnas pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la gnas pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong pa bzhi la gnas pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la gnas pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of diligence is the state of abiding in the four correct abandonments.üîΩThe faculty of mindfulness is the state of abiding in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: bsam gtan bzhi la gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi la gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the state of abiding in the four concentrations.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the knowledge of the four truths of the noble ones.

original: dbang po'i don ni dbang byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: dbang po'i don ni dbang byed pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of faculty is the meaning of controlling power.

original: ci la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: ci la dbang byed ce na /
translated: With regard to what does it have controlling power?

original: dad pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa dad pa dang / brtson 'grus kyang dran pa dang shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed de dad pa'i dbang gis chos de rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa dad pa dang / brtson 'grus kyang dran pa dang shes rab dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed de dad pa'i dbang gis chos de rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Vigor also controls mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom, because those dharmas arise through the power of faith.

original: brtson 'grus kyang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gsum la dbang byed de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gsum la dbang byed de /
translated: Vigor also controls the three of mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: dran pa yang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gnyis la dbang byed do //
analyzed: dran pa yang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gnyis la dbang byed do //
translated: Mindfulness also controls the two of wisdom and concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin kyang shes rab la dbang byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin kyang shes rab la dbang byed do //
translated: Concentration also controls wisdom.

original: shes rab ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mngon du bya ba la dbang byed de /
analyzed: shes rab ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mngon du bya ba la dbang byed de /
translated: Wisdom controls the realization of supramundane dharmas.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i mthus rnam par shes pa skye ba bzhin du ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i mthus rnam par shes pa skye ba bzhin du ;
translated: Just as consciousness is generated through the power of the eye faculty, etc.,

original: chos de dag kyang gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pas na dbang po zhes bya'o / yang na dad pa zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la blo gnyis med par mos shing dad pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pas na dbang po zhes bya'o / yang na dad pa zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la blo gnyis med par mos shing dad pa'o //
translated: Or else, faith is the non-doubting adherence to and confidence in the Three Jewels.

original: yang na yon tan dang yon tan gyi gnas la dga' ba mngon du byas pa las sems dang ba skye ba ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na yon tan dang yon tan gyi gnas la dga' ba mngon du byas pa las sems dang ba skye ba ni dad pa'o //
translated: Or else, faith is the clarity of mind which arises from the manifestation of delight in virtue and the virtuous.

original: yang na las dge ba dang mi dge ba las 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal myong ba yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na las dge ba dang mi dge ba las 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal myong ba yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Or else, faith is the conviction that happiness and suffering result from virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

original: lus dang sems las phongs pa med par mi dge ba'i chos spangs ba dang / dge ba'i chos mngon du bya bar sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: lus dang sems las phongs pa med par mi dge ba'i chos spangs ba dang / dge ba'i chos mngon du bya bar sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Vigor is the mental state of enthusiasm for abandoning non-virtuous dharmas and for realizing virtuous dharmas, without physical or mental languor.

original: yan na las dam pa la brtson pa'i lus dang ngag gi las la brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yan na las dam pa la brtson pa'i lus dang ngag gi las la brtson 'grus zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, vigor is the physical and verbal action of one who is engaged in the highest action.

original: de ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos byed pa la brtson pa ni le lo nyid kyis brtson 'grus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos byed pa la brtson pa ni le lo nyid kyis brtson 'grus ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the enthusiasm for committing sinful, non-virtuous dharmas is not vigor, but rather laziness.üîΩRecollection is the non-loss of an object that has been grasped by the mind.

original: sngon myong ba'i dngos po brjed pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: sngon myong ba'i dngos po brjed pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: Memory is the non-forgetting of an experienced object.

original: yang na dmigs pa'i dngos po sems la gsal ba ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa'i dngos po sems la gsal ba ni dran pa'o //
translated: Or, memory is the clarity of the object of meditation in the mind.

original: @155b yang na mtshan ma yid la gzung ba ma nyams par byed pa dang / nyams na yang slar mngon gsum du byed pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: @155b yang na mtshan ma yid la gzung ba ma nyams par byed pa dang / nyams na yang slar mngon gsum du byed pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: Or, memory is the non-deterioration of the retention of the sign of the object of meditation, and the re-actualization of it when it has deteriorated.

original: yang na dran pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na dran pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Or, there are four kinds of memory:

original: yi ge mi brjed par 'dzin pa'i dran pa dang / yi ge gzung ba las don mi byed par 'dzin pa'i dran pa dang / don gzung ba las rgyun du yid la byed pa mi gtong ba'i dran pa dang / rgyun du yid la byas pa las don mngon sum du gsal bar byed pa mthong bar byed pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge mi brjed par 'dzin pa'i dran pa dang / yi ge gzung ba las don mi byed par 'dzin pa'i dran pa dang / don gzung ba las rgyun du yid la byed pa mi gtong ba'i dran pa dang / rgyun du yid la byas pa las don mngon sum du gsal bar byed pa mthong bar byed pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: the memory that holds the letters without forgetting them; the memory that holds the meaning without forgetting the letters; the memory that does not let go of the constant mental attention to the meaning; and the memory that makes the meaning clear and evident through constant mental attention.

original: sems gnas pa'i rnam pa dgu ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i rnam pa dgu ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The nine aspects of mental stability are concentration.

original: yang na khang pa rlung med pa'i mar me g-yo ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i rlung rnams kyis ma bskyod par sems kyi ngang rgyud gcig tu 'byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang na khang pa rlung med pa'i mar me g-yo ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i rlung rnams kyis ma bskyod par sems kyi ngang rgyud gcig tu 'byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Or else, concentration is the continuity of the mind in a single cognitive object, without being disturbed by the winds of the defilements, like a lamp in a windless place.

original: bden pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ni shes rab bo //üîΩyang na shes rab la rgya gar skad du pradzny'a zhes 'byung ste /
