analyzed: chos gang la ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos rtse gcig tu byas pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i dbang pos mi brjed pa'i dge ba'i chos la ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos rgyun du rtse gcig tu gzhag pa'o // shes rab kyi dbang pos chos de dag gi so sor rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba ni so sor khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The phrase that phenomenon is made one-pointed by the faculty of meditative concentration means that the faculty of meditative concentration causes the virtuous phenomenon that is being remembered by the faculty of memory to be continuously focused on in a one-pointed manner.üîΩThe phrase the faculty of wisdom sees the individual characteristics of those phenomena means that it discerns them.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid mthong ba ni /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid mthong ba ni /
translated: The phrase the faculty of wisdom sees the general characteristics of those phenomena means that it realizes their nature.

original: chos de dang de rnams la mngon sum du shes pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdbang po lnga yang dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: chos de dang de rnams la mngon sum du shes pa zhes bya'o // dbang po lnga yang dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: It is called direct knowledge of those dharmas.

original: rnam pa lngar gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam pa lngar gzhag go //
translated: The five faculties are established in five ways: in terms of object, nature, assistance, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: dbang po lnga rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: The object of the five faculties is the four noble truths.

original: dbang po'i dus na yang de bzhi la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i dus na yang de bzhi la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have that as their object at the time of the faculties.

original: rang bzhin ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Their nature is the essence of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: grogs ni chos de dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan rnams so //üîΩbsgom pa ni dad pa'i dbang pos bden pa bzhi la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: grogs ni chos de dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan rnams so // bsgom pa ni dad pa'i dbang pos bden pa bzhi la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: Their assistance is the mind and other mental factors that are associated with those dharmas.üîΩTheir cultivation is the cultivation of the aspect of conviction in the four truths by the faculty of faith.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos ni bden pa la bzlog pa'i brtson 'grus rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos ni bden pa la bzlog pa'i brtson 'grus rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of exertion in the four truths is by the faculty of vigor.

original: dran pas ni bden pa la mi brjed par rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: dran pas ni bden pa la mi brjed par rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: By mindfulness, one cultivates the truths without forgetting them.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni bden pa la mi g-yeng ba'i rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni bden pa la mi g-yeng ba'i rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: By concentration, one cultivates the truths without distraction.

original: shes rab kyis ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa @157b rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa @157b rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: By wisdom, one cultivates the realization of the general and specific characteristics of the truths.

original: 'bras bu ni bden pa bzhi rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bden pa bzhi rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The result is the realization of the four noble truths.

original: stobs kyi skabs su dmigs pa la sogs pa gang bden pa yang gcig ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi skabs su dmigs pa la sogs pa gang bden pa yang gcig ste /
translated: In the context of the powers, the object, etc. are the same as before.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi zil gyis mi non pa tsam gyis bye brag tu dbye bar zad do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi zil gyis mi non pa tsam gyis bye brag tu dbye bar zad do //
translated: They are distinguished merely by the fact that they cannot be overwhelmed by adverse factors.

original: dbang po lnga bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po lnga bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the teaching on the five faculties,

original: 'di ni dge slong dag dbang po rnams so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong dag dbang po rnams so zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúMonks, these are the faculties.‚Äù

original: dbang po lnga'i 'og tu stobs lnga bstan te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i 'og tu stobs lnga bstan te /
translated: After the five faculties, the five powers are taught.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to explain them as they are taught,

original: de la dge slong dag stobs lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dge slong dag stobs lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúMonks, what are the five powers? And so on.

original: dbang po lnga po nyid mi brdzi ba dang / mi tshugs par gyur pas na stobs lngar gzhag ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga po nyid mi brdzi ba dang / mi tshugs par gyur pas na stobs lngar gzhag ste /
translated: The five powers are so called because the five faculties are unassailable and invincible.

original: dad pa'i stobs kyang dad pa mi brdzi bar gyur ba rnams ni 'jig rten 'dir lha'i bdud dam /
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs kyang dad pa mi brdzi bar gyur ba rnams ni 'jig rten 'dir lha'i bdud dam /
translated: The power of faith is so called because faith is unassailable.

original: tshangs pa 'am gzhan yang 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa 'am gzhan yang 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par gyur pa 'am /
translated: In this world, neither Mara,

original: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa rnams kyis dad pa zlog par mi nus pas na dad pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa rnams kyis dad pa zlog par mi nus pas na dad pa'i stobs so //
translated: Brahma, nor anyone else can turn away the faith of those whose faith is unassailable.

original: dad pa'i stobs mngon du byas pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i chos bzhi yang stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs mngon du byas pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i chos bzhi yang stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: The four qualities of effort, etc., which arise from the cause of manifesting the power of faith, are also called powers.

original: stobs dang ldan zhing bdud kyi grogs su gyur ba'i bdud rnam pa bzhi'i stobs bcom nas /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan zhing bdud kyi grogs su gyur ba'i bdud rnam pa bzhi'i stobs bcom nas /
translated: They are called powers because they destroy the four powers of Mara, which are powerful and assist Mara,

original: zag pa zad pa mngon du byed pas na stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon du byed pas na stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: and manifest the destruction of the contaminants.

original: yang na dbang po'i dus na ni dbang po lnga'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa dang / le lo dang dran pa nyams pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / shes bzhin med pa rnams skabs su 'dre zhing 'byung ba las /
analyzed: yang na dbang po'i dus na ni dbang po lnga'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa dang / le lo dang dran pa nyams pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / shes bzhin med pa rnams skabs su 'dre zhing 'byung ba las /
translated: Or else, at the time of the faculties, it is the strength of the antidotes to the resistances of the five faculties, i.e. lack of faith, laziness, loss of mindfulness, distraction, and lack of full awareness.

original: nam mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams skabs su 'byung bar mi byed de /
analyzed: nam mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams skabs su 'byung bar mi byed de /
translated: It is the strength of the antidotes to the resistances that do not arise at the time of the faculties.

original: gnyen po 'ga' zhig gi phyogs gcig tu skyes pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po 'ga' zhig gi phyogs gcig tu skyes pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the strength of the arising of the antidotes in place of the resistances.

original: de la dkon mchog gsum la bsam pa mi phyed par gyur pa ni dad pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: de la dkon mchog gsum la bsam pa mi phyed par gyur pa ni dad pa'i stobs so //
translated: Among them, the strength of faith is the unshakable attitude toward the Three Jewels.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams rgyun du bsgom pa ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams rgyun du bsgom pa ni brtson 'grus kyi stobs so //
translated: The strength of vigor is the constant cultivation of the factors of enlightenment.

original: gang mnyan cing bsam pa'i chos nam du yang mi brjed pa ni dran pa'i stobs so ;
analyzed: gang mnyan cing bsam pa'i chos nam du yang mi brjed pa ni dran pa'i stobs so ;
translated: The strength of mindfulness is never to forget the Dharma that one has heard and reflected upon.

original: / zhum pa dang rgod pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs so //
analyzed: / zhum pa dang rgod pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs so //
translated: The strength of concentration is not to fall under the sway of discouragement or excitedness.

original: chos gang la yang the tshom med par shes pa ni shes rab kyi stobs so //
analyzed: chos gang la yang the tshom med par shes pa ni shes rab kyi stobs so //
translated: The power of wisdom is the knowledge that is free from doubt with regard to any phenomenon.

original: de la dad pa'i stobs kyis ni mthong ba'i lam thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i bdag gi lus la chags pa spong bar byed do //üîΩbrtson 'grus kyi @158a * //
analyzed: de la dad pa'i stobs kyis ni mthong ba'i lam thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i bdag gi lus la chags pa spong bar byed do // brtson 'grus kyi @158a * //
translated: By the power of faith, one abandons attachment to one's own body, which is an obstacle to attaining the path of seeing.

original: stobs kyis ni bdag gi yo byad la chags pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: stobs kyis ni bdag gi yo byad la chags pa spong bar byed do //
translated: By the power of diligence, one abandons attachment to one's own possessions.

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni sngon byas pa dang smad pa'i lam la rtogs pa'i sems spong bar byed do //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ni sngon byas pa dang smad pa'i lam la rtogs pa'i sems spong bar byed do //
translated: By the power of mindfulness, one abandons the mind that regrets what was done in the past and the path that is despised.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni zhum pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa che long du byung ba'i zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni zhum pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa che long du byung ba'i zil gyis gnon to //
translated: By the power of concentration, one suppresses the arising of coarse afflictions such as laxity and excitement.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni bag chags thams cad rtsad nas 'dod to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni bag chags thams cad rtsad nas 'dod to //
translated: By the power of wisdom, one eradicates all habitual tendencies.

original: stobs lnga bstan pa'i 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bstan te /
analyzed: stobs lnga bstan pa'i 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bstan te /
translated: After teaching the five powers, the seven factors of awakening are taught.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to explain them as they are taught, it is said:üîΩThe seven factors of awakening are mindfulness, investigation of phenomena, diligence, joy, pliancy, concentration, and equanimity.

original: de la dge slong dag byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dge slong dag byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
translated: The Buddha said, ‚ÄúMonks, what are the seven factors of awakening?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.üîΩüîΩ

original: de la byang chub ba ni bden pa bzhi khong du chud nas zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub ba ni bden pa bzhi khong du chud nas zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pa ste /
translated: Awakening is the realization of the four noble truths and the attainment of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.

original: byang chub de yang gang zag gi khyad par gyis na nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //üîΩbyang chub thob par byed pa'i grogs su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub de yang gang zag gi khyad par gyis na nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste rnam pa gsum du gzhag go // byang chub thob par byed pa'i grogs su gyur pa'am /
translated: Awakening is classified as three types, based on the distinctions among the individuals who attain it: the awakening of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the awakening of the pratyekabuddhas, and the perfect, complete awakening of the buddhas.

original: de'i rten du gyur pa'i chos ni byang chub kyi yan lag ste /üîΩdper na lus kyi grogs su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pa'i chos ni byang chub kyi yan lag ste / dper na lus kyi grogs su gyur pa'am /
translated: The factors that are the supports for attaining awakening or that are the bases for awakening are the factors of awakening.

original: rten du gyur pa dang rkang pa dang / lag pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi yan lag ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rten du gyur pa dang rkang pa dang / lag pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi yan lag ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the limbs of the body are called ‚Äúlimbs‚Äù because they are the supports for the body or the bases of the body.

original: 'dir yan lag gi gtso bo gang yin na bdun po 'di dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dir yan lag gi gtso bo gang yin na bdun po 'di dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gzhag go //
translated: Here, the seven factors that are the principal limbs are posited as the factors of awakening.

original: smras pa chos rab tu 'byed pa ni de kho na mngon par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yan lag gtso bo dang yan lag gnyi gnyi gar gzhag go //
analyzed: smras pa chos rab tu 'byed pa ni de kho na mngon par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yan lag gtso bo dang yan lag gnyi gnyi gar gzhag go //
translated: He said: Since the differentiation of phenomena is the essence of the realization of reality, it is posited as both the principal branch and the two branches.

original: dran pa la sogs pa drug ni de dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i grogs yin pas yan lag bdun du gzhag go //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa drug ni de dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i grogs yin pas yan lag bdun du gzhag go //
translated: The six, beginning with mindfulness, are posited as the seven branches because they are the assistants that conform to that.

original: de la byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos bsgom zhing mngon sum du byas pa rnams chud mi gzon cing mi brjed par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos bsgom zhing mngon sum du byas pa rnams chud mi gzon cing mi brjed par byed pa ni /
translated: The cultivation and realization of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are not wasted and are not forgotten by

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ste /
translated: the branch of enlightenment called right mindfulness.

original: dben pa la gnas pa la sogs pa'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: dben pa la gnas pa la sogs pa'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: The meaning of abiding in solitude and so on should be viewed as explained above.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni lhag mthong gi tshogs dang zung du 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni lhag mthong gi tshogs dang zung du 'brel ba ste /
translated: The branch of enlightenment called the discernment of phenomena is the accumulation of insight and is combined with it.

original: gang mthong ba'i lam gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rnams kyi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i lam gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rnams kyi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the path of seeing is the unmixed knowledge of the characteristics of the side of affliction and the side of purification.

original: brtson 'grus byang chub kyi yan lag ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus byang chub kyi yan lag ni /
translated: The limb of enlightenment of effort

original: yon tan gong ma khyad par can rnams len par byed cing yon tan la bsgribs pa'i nyes pa @158b rnams spong bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan gong ma khyad par can rnams len par byed cing yon tan la bsgribs pa'i nyes pa @158b rnams spong bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: has the characteristic of taking up the higher special qualities and abandoning the faults that are hindrances to the qualities.üîΩThe limb of enlightenment of joy

original: dga' ba byang chub kyi yan lag ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid gang zag la bdag med pa dang po mthong nas lus dang sems la sim pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba byang chub kyi yan lag ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid gang zag la bdag med pa dang po mthong nas lus dang sems la sim pa thob pa'o //
translated: has the characteristic of that, which is the attainment of physical and mental pliancy after seeing the selflessness of the person for the first time.üîΩThe limb of enlightenment of pliancy

original: shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni lus las su rung ba dang / sems las su rung bar gyur la ste ;
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni lus las su rung ba dang / sems las su rung bar gyur la ste ;
translated: is the physical pliancy and mental pliancy that have arisen.

original: gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba'i lus dang sems las gzhan du gyur pas rang gi bya ba la spyod pa spang ba dang / sems gnas gzhan du gyur pas dmigs pa'i yul thogs pa med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba'i lus dang sems las gzhan du gyur pas rang gi bya ba la spyod pa spang ba dang / sems gnas gzhan du gyur pas dmigs pa'i yul thogs pa med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The limb of vigor is the vigor of the will, the vigor of the effort, the vigor of the mind, and the vigor of the investigation.üîΩThe limb of joy is the joy of the body, the joy of the mind, and the joy of the faith that is born from the realization of the good qualities of virtue.üîΩThe limb of pliancy is the pliancy of the body, the pliancy of the mind, and the pliancy of the faculties.üîΩThe limb of concentration is the concentration of the body, the concentration of the mind, and the concentration of the faculties.

original: ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa rtag tu ma nyams pa gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa rtag tu ma nyams pa gnas pa'o //
translated: The limb of equanimity is the equanimity of the body, the equanimity of the mind, and the equanimity of the faculties.üîΩThe limb of investigation of phenomena is the limb of the path that is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe limb of discrimination of phenomena is the limb of the path that is the antidote to the secondary afflictions.üîΩThe limb of vigor is the limb of the path that is the antidote to laziness.üîΩThe limb of joy is the limb of the path that is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe limb of pliancy is the limb of the path that is the antidote to the secondary afflictions.

original: btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag ni /üîΩzhum rgod la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad spangs pas rtag tu bya ba med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'o //üîΩbyang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams yan lag sngar bzhag ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag ni / zhum rgod la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad spangs pas rtag tu bya ba med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'o // byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams yan lag sngar bzhag ste /
translated: The limb of concentration is the limb of the path that is the antidote to distraction.üîΩThe limb of equanimity is the limb of the path that is the antidote to the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: rten gyi yan lag dang / rang bzhin gyi yan lag dang / nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: rten gyi yan lag dang / rang bzhin gyi yan lag dang / nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag dang / rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The limbs of the path are the limb of the path that is right view, the limb of the path that is right thought, the limb of the path that is right speech, the limb of the path that is right action, the limb of the path that is right livelihood, the limb of the path that is right effort, the limb of the path that is right mindfulness, and the limb of the path that is right concentration

original: de la dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni /
analyzed: de la dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni /
translated: The branch of enlightenment of mindfulness is as follows.üîΩ

original: rten gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: rten gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Mindfulness as a spiritual benefactor is the basis of enlightenment,

original: dran pa'i dbang gis gang la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa de nas gzhan du mi g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang gis gang la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa de nas gzhan du mi g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro // chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag ni /
translated: because it prevents the mind from straying from its object by the power of mindfulness.

original: rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
translated: The analysis of phenomena as a spiritual benefactor is the nature of enlightenment,

original: byang chub kyi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the knowledge of the general and specific characteristics of the phenomena of enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus byang chub kyi yan lag ni nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus byang chub kyi yan lag ni nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The effort of enlightenment is the benefactor that causes one to leave behind,

original: brtson 'grus kyi mthus so so'i skye bo'i sa las yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mthus so so'i skye bo'i sa las yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by the power of effort one passes beyond the stage of the common man.

original: dga' ba byang chub kyi yan lag ni rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba byang chub kyi yan lag ni rjes su bsngags pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The joy of enlightenment is the benefactor that is praised,

original: des lus dang sems la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des lus dang sems la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it benefits both body and mind.

original: bag yangs dang ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag gsum ni /
analyzed: bag yangs dang ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag gsum ni /
translated: The three branches of complete nobility, meditative absorption, and equanimity are the antidotes to the three flaws of laziness, excitement, and laxness.üîΩ

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The three branches of enlightenment, namely, serenity, concentration, and equanimity, are the branches of non-affliction.

original: de gsum gyis nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gleng gzhi dang rten dang rang @159a * //
analyzed: de gsum gyis nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro // de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gleng gzhi dang rten dang rang @159a * //
translated: Because these three are the antidotes which destroy the afflictions.

original: bzhin rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: bzhin rnam pa gsum du gzhag go //
translated: Moreover, non-affliction is established in three ways: as a basis, as a support, and as a nature.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gleng gzhi ni shin tu byang ba byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gleng gzhi ni shin tu byang ba byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: The basis of non-affliction is the branch of enlightenment of complete tranquilization,

original: shin tu byang bas ni gnas ngan len pa dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms par byed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu byang bas ni gnas ngan len pa dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms par byed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because complete tranquilization is the cause which destroys the negative reflex actions and the afflictions which are their cause.

original: de yang ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di lar lus dang sems las su mi rung ba ni gnas ngan len te /
analyzed: 'di lar lus dang sems las su mi rung ba ni gnas ngan len te /
translated: Here, the unserviceability of body and mind is a negative reflex action.

original: de yod na sems rtse gcig pa mi 'byung bas sems g-yengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na sems rtse gcig pa mi 'byung bas sems g-yengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it exists, the mind is distracted because one-pointedness of mind does not occur.

original: sems g-yengs nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye ste /üîΩde bas na gnas ngan len ni /
analyzed: sems g-yengs nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye ste / de bas na gnas ngan len ni /
translated: When the mind is distracted, the afflictions such as passion arise.üîΩTherefore,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the cause of affliction is the unwholesome.

original: shin tu byang ba ni lus dang sems las su rung ba yin pas /üîΩdes gnas ngan len sel bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu byang ba ni lus dang sems las su rung ba yin pas / des gnas ngan len sel bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the body and mind are serviceable when they are very pure,üîΩaffliction is eliminated by that.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gleng gzhir gzhag go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gleng gzhir gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the basis of non-affliction is established.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rten ni ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rten ni ting nge 'dzin byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: The basis of non-affliction is the enlightenment factor of concentration.

original: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung na sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung na sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the body and mind are serviceable, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa skyes na /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa skyes na /
translated: When the mind is concentrated, knowledge arises that is in accordance with reality.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs te /
translated: When that occurs, affliction is abandoned.

original: de bas na ting nge 'dzin ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: de bas na ting nge 'dzin ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, concentration is the basis of non-affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rang bzhin btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rang bzhin btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: The nature of non-affliction is the enlightenment factor of equanimity.

original: btang snyoms kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar byed la /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar byed la /
translated: and it eliminates the afflictions of equanimity.

original: rtag tu'ang nyon mongs pa med pa dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu'ang nyon mongs pa med pa dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it always abides in the absence of afflictions and in accordance with that absence.

original: yan lag bdun po 'di yang rnam pa gsum du bsdus te /
analyzed: yan lag bdun po 'di yang rnam pa gsum du bsdus te /
translated: These seven members are also included in three:

original: zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang gnyis ka'i phyogs so //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs dang gnyis ka'i phyogs so //
translated: those that are on the side of calm, those that are on the side of insight, and those that are on the side of both.

original: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba gsum lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
analyzed: de la chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba gsum lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
translated: Among them, the three members of full awareness, diligence, and joy are on the side of insight.

original: de la gang shin tu byang ba dang / gang ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: de la gang shin tu byang ba dang / gang ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms byang chub kyi yan lag gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
translated: Among them, the three members of pliancy, concentration, and equanimity are on the side of calm.

original: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs te /
analyzed: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs te /
translated: Mindfulness is on the side of both.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //üîΩbyang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba zhes bya'o // byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù because it is associated with all the members.üîΩThe members of enlightenment are also established in five ways:

original: rnam pa lngar gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam pa lngar gzhag go //
translated: object, nature, aid, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag @159b rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag @159b rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four noble truths are the object of the limbs of enlightenment.

original: mthong ba'i lam na bden pa bzhi rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam na bden pa bzhi rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the four noble truths are known and perceived just as they are on the path of seeing.

original: rang bzhin ni dran pa dang / chos rab tu 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni dran pa dang / chos rab tu 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: Their nature is mindfulness, full discernment of dharmas, effort, joy, pliancy, equanimity.

original: grogs ni byang chub kyi yan lag de dag dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems la byung ba dad pa la sogs pa gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: grogs ni byang chub kyi yan lag de dag dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems la byung ba dad pa la sogs pa gzhan rnams so //
translated: Their companions are the other mental factors such as faith that accompany those limbs of enlightenment.

original: bsgom pa ni dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa ste /üîΩdben pa la gnas pa 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /üîΩ'gog pa la gnas pa /üîΩrnam par spong bar bsngos pa /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa ste / dben pa la gnas pa 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa / 'gog pa la gnas pa / rnam par spong bar bsngos pa /
translated: Their cultivation is the cultivation of the limb of enlightenment of mindfulness.üîΩOne cultivates the four noble truths themselves, as stated in the sutra:

original: sgom par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa bden pa bzhi nyid bsgom par gsungs so //
analyzed: sgom par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa bden pa bzhi nyid bsgom par gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne cultivates the limb of enlightenment of mindfulness that is based on seclusion, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and that is fully matured by renunciation.üîΩOne cultivates the limb of enlightenment of full discernment of dharmas, based on seclusion, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and that is fully matured by renunciation.‚ÄùüîΩAnd so on, up to:üîΩ‚ÄúOne cultivates the limb of enlightenment of equanimity, based on seclusion, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and that is fully matured by renunciation.‚Äù

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni mthong bas spangs par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni mthong bas spangs par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The result of cultivation is the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After teaching the seven factors of awakening,

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad bstan te /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad bstan te /
translated: he taught the eightfold noble path.

original: de bas na ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Therefore, wishing to explain it in the same order as it was taught,

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, Monks, what is the eightfold noble path? And so on.

original: de la 'phags pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa slob pa'i gang zag rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa slob pa'i gang zag rnams la bya ste /
translated: Here, noble refers to the persons in training who have attained the fruit of stream-entry and so on.

original: de dag bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa spang pa dang / rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir yan lag brgyad dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de dag bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa spang pa dang / rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir yan lag brgyad dang ldan zhing /
translated: Because they possess the eight factors for abandoning all afflictions to be abandoned by cultivation, and for actualizing liberation,

original: yan lag brgyad kyis bsdus pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad kyis bsdus pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and because the path is included within the eight factors,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the eightfold noble path.

original: 'di lta ste yang dag par lta ba dang zhes bya ba la gang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi skabs su 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud pa thob ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste yang dag par lta ba dang zhes bya ba la gang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi skabs su 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud pa thob ste /
translated: In the context of the seven factors of awakening, one attains the realization of the four noble truths.

original: de nyid la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la dmigs pa ni /
translated: That very [realization] is the focus of

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: right view.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid gtsor byas nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la yang dag par rtog cin 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang 'tshe ba'i rtog pa spangs nas 'dod pa med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa la rtog pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid gtsor byas nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la yang dag par rtog cin 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang 'tshe ba'i rtog pa spangs nas 'dod pa med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa la rtog pa ni /
translated: Having made that right view primary, one contemplates the phenomena that arise from it, abandoning thoughts of desire, ill will, and harmfulness, and contemplates the absence of desire, the absence of ill will, and the absence of harmfulness.üîΩThis is called

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ste /üîΩgal te rtog pa zhig ni sems @160a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ste / gal te rtog pa zhig ni sems @160a * //
translated: right thought.

original: 'jug par 'dod na yang rnam pa de lta bu'i chos la rtog go //
analyzed: 'jug par 'dod na yang rnam pa de lta bu'i chos la rtog go //
translated: If one wishes to engage the mind in thought, one should contemplate phenomena in that way.

original: brgya la smra ba zhig la sems 'jug par 'dod na yang dag pa'i lta ba nyid mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: brgya la smra ba zhig la sems 'jug par 'dod na yang dag pa'i lta ba nyid mngon du byas nas /
translated: If one wishes to engage the mind in speech, one should manifest right view.

original: dge ba'i chos la rnam par brtag pa'i chos de nyid gzhan la gtam du smra ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la rnam par brtag pa'i chos de nyid gzhan la gtam du smra ste /
translated: He also teaches to others the Dharma that he has examined, the Dharma that is virtuous.

original: de ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa'i ngag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called right speech.

original: gal te chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang mal cha dang stan dang na ba'i rkyen sman la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams dgos par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang mal cha dang stan dang na ba'i rkyen sman la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams dgos par gyur na /
translated: If he needs Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, a seat, medicine for curing the sick, and other necessities,

original: de yang 'tshol ba'i dus na 'gro ba dang slar 'ong ba'i tshe shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / lta ba dang / rnam par lta ba dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed 'dzin pa dang / bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de yang 'tshol ba'i dus na 'gro ba dang slar 'ong ba'i tshe shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / lta ba dang / rnam par lta ba dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed 'dzin pa dang / bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: he should go out to search for them. When he goes out, he should do so mindfully. When he returns, he should do so mindfully. He should act mindfully when looking and when looking around. He should act mindfully when extending and when retracting his limbs. He should act mindfully when holding his Dharma robes and his alms-bowl. He should act mindfully when eating, drinking, consuming, and tasting.

original: 'chags pa dang 'dug pa dang / nyal ba la sogs pa'i tshe shes bzhin du spyod de /
analyzed: 'chags pa dang 'dug pa dang / nyal ba la sogs pa'i tshe shes bzhin du spyod de /
translated: He should act mindfully when going, coming, standing, sitting, falling asleep, waking up, talking, and remaining silent.

original: de ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called right action.

original: gang chos gos dang na ba'i rkyen sman la sogs pa tshol ba yang g-yo dang sgyus tshol ba spangs nas /
analyzed: gang chos gos dang na ba'i rkyen sman la sogs pa tshol ba yang g-yo dang sgyus tshol ba spangs nas /
translated: He seeks the Dharma robes, medicine for the sick, and so on, without deceit or pretense.

original: chos bzhin du tshol te /
analyzed: chos bzhin du tshol te /
translated: He seeks them in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúright livelihood.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la brten nas bsgom pa la zhugs pa na mos pa dang brtson 'grus dang 'bad pa la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod cing bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la brten nas bsgom pa la zhugs pa na mos pa dang brtson 'grus dang 'bad pa la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod cing bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba la 'jug pa ni /
translated: When one who has undertaken meditation on the basis of right view, right thought, right speech, right action, and right livelihood, engages in the elimination of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by cultivation, he does not interrupt his effort, which consists of devotion, perseverance, and exertion.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúright effort.‚Äù

original: dran pa nyer bar gzhag pa bzhi la brten nas phyin ci ma log par bsdu ba'i dngos po gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyer bar gzhag pa bzhi la brten nas phyin ci ma log par bsdu ba'i dngos po gsal ba'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of the clarity of the unerring collection of things is called ‚Äúright mindfulness,‚Äù based on the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The nine mental states are called right concentration.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad po de dag kyang mdor na rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad po de dag kyang mdor na rnam pa gnyis su gzhag ste /
translated: These eightfold noble paths are, in brief, established as two kinds:

original: spyod pa'i tshe gang bya ba dang ; gnas pa'i tshe gang bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i tshe gang bya ba dang ; gnas pa'i tshe gang bya ba'o //
translated: that which is to be done while one is active, and that which is to be done while one is in a state of rest.

original: spyod pa'i tshe ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la ma gtogs pa gzhan 'chags pa dang 'dug pa la sogs pa spyod lam la gnas pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: spyod pa'i tshe ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la ma gtogs pa gzhan 'chags pa dang 'dug pa la sogs pa spyod lam la gnas pa'i dus na ste /
translated: While one is active, that is, while one is in a state of rest, such as walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, other than when one is cultivating concentration,

original: de'i tshe na ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba la gnas par bya'o //
translated: at that time one should be engaged in right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: gnas @160b pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas @160b pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni /
translated: While one is in a state of rest,

original: ting nge 'dzin du snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus na ste /
translated: that is, while one is in a state of meditative concentration,

original: de na yang zhi gnas bsgom pa dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis bya'o //
analyzed: de na yang zhi gnas bsgom pa dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis bya'o //
translated: at that time one should cultivate two things: the cultivation of serenity and the cultivation of transcendent insight.

original: de la gang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gsum ni lhag mthong gi phyogs 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gsum ni lhag mthong gi phyogs 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Among them, the three right views, right thought, and right effort are insight and its retinue.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni lhag mthong nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni lhag mthong nyid do //
translated: Right view is insight itself.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / rtog pa gnyis ni de'i phyogs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / rtog pa gnyis ni de'i phyogs so //
translated: Right effort and right thought are its retinue.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Right mindfulness and right concentration are serenity and its retinue.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni zhi gnas kyi sgo nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni zhi gnas kyi sgo nyid do //
translated: Right concentration is the door of serenity itself.

original: dran pa ni de'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni de'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is included in its retinue.

original: de ltar bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal ma lus par spang bar bya ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dam pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal ma lus par spang bar bya ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dam pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to completely abandon the latent states that are to be abandoned by cultivation and to manifest the holy fruit of arhatship,

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa la brten nas slob pa'i gang zag dag dus dus su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sgom par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa la brten nas slob pa'i gang zag dag dus dus su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sgom par byed do //
translated: Relying on right speech, right action, and right livelihood, the person in training cultivates serenity and insight from time to time.

original: yang na mi shes pa dang the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa med pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: yang na mi shes pa dang the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa med pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Or else, the absence of the knowledge of non-knowing, the knowledge of doubt, and the knowledge of error is right view.

original: de la mi shes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mtshan nyid du khong du ma chud pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi shes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mtshan nyid du khong du ma chud pa'o //
translated: Among them, non-knowing is not comprehending the characteristics of the four noble truths.

original: the tshom gyi shes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yin nam ma yin snyam du the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi shes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yin nam ma yin snyam du the tshom za ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of doubt is doubting whether the four noble truths are so or not.

original: log pa'i shes pa ni mi rtag pa la rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa ni mi rtag pa la rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of error is grasping impermanence as permanence, etc., in the opposite way.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is called right thought?

original: rgya gar skad du samyag sam kalpa zhes 'byung ste //üîΩsamya ka ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgya gar skad du samyag sam kalpa zhes 'byung ste // samya ka ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don to //
translated: In Sanskrit, it appears as samyak-sa·πÉkalpa.üîΩSamyak means the meaning of non-error.

original: sam ni mnyam pa'i don no //
analyzed: sam ni mnyam pa'i don no //
translated: Sa·πÉ means the meaning of equality.

original: kalpa ni rjes su rtog pa'i don te /
analyzed: kalpa ni rjes su rtog pa'i don te /
translated: Kalpa means ‚Äúto conceive in accord with.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas mthong ba'i chos la phyin ci ma log par chos rnams kyi rang bzhin stong ba dang mi rtag pa la sogs par mthun par rjes su rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas mthong ba'i chos la phyin ci ma log par chos rnams kyi rang bzhin stong ba dang mi rtag pa la sogs par mthun par rjes su rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù Right thought is the conception in accord with the nature of things, such as impermanence, that one has seen through the correct view.

original: brdzun la sogs pa'i nyes pa bzhi spangs pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag go //
analyzed: brdzun la sogs pa'i nyes pa bzhi spangs pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag go //
translated: Right speech is the abandonment of the four faults of speech, lying, etc.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus kyi las ngan pa gsum las log pa ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o //üîΩsdig pa mi dge bas 'tsho ba med pa @161a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus kyi las ngan pa gsum las log pa ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o // sdig pa mi dge bas 'tsho ba med pa @161a * //
translated: Right action is the avoidance of the three bad actions of body, killing, etc.

original: ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ste /üîΩdge bsnyen la sogs pa'i khyim na gnas pa yang dug dang mtshon cha la sogs pa 'tshong ba la sogs pa las slar log pa'o //
analyzed: ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ste / dge bsnyen la sogs pa'i khyim na gnas pa yang dug dang mtshon cha la sogs pa 'tshong ba la sogs pa las slar log pa'o //
translated: Right livelihood is the absence of a livelihood that is sinful and unwholesome.üîΩIt is the avoidance of selling intoxicants, poisons, weapons, and so on, even for a layperson.

original: rab tu byung ba la yang kha gsag dang tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa las slar log pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba la yang kha gsag dang tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa las slar log pa'o //
translated: It is the avoidance of flattery, hypocrisy, and so on, even for a monk.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos bsgrub pa la brtson 'grus ha cang drag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos bsgrub pa la brtson 'grus ha cang drag pa yang ma yin /
translated: He is not over-zealous in abandoning negative actions and in accomplishing positive actions.

original: dal ba yang ma yin te /üîΩmnyam du rtsol ba ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: dal ba yang ma yin te / mnyam du rtsol ba ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
translated: Right effort is neither too lax nor too tense in abandoning negative actions and in accomplishing positive actions.

original: yid gsal bar gyur pas dmigs par bya ba'i yul la ma rmongs pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa ste /
analyzed: yid gsal bar gyur pas dmigs par bya ba'i yul la ma rmongs pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa ste /
translated: Right mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the object of meditation due to the clarity of mind.

original: rgyu drug gi dran pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu drug gi dran pa skye ba'o //
translated: It arises from six causes:

original: rgyu drug ni dran pa mthong ba dang / mi 'dra ba dang / goms pa dang / gcig gi don du rtogs pa dang / zhi gnas kyi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs so //
analyzed: rgyu drug ni dran pa mthong ba dang / mi 'dra ba dang / goms pa dang / gcig gi don du rtogs pa dang / zhi gnas kyi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs so //
translated: the seeing of mindfulness, the non-similarity, the familiarization, the realization for the sake of one, the power of tranquility, and the power of the cause.

original: de la 'dra ba mthong ba las dran pa skye ste /
analyzed: de la 'dra ba mthong ba las dran pa skye ste /
translated: Mindfulness arises from the seeing of similarity.

original: bu dang 'dra ba la la mthong ba na bu dran pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bu dang 'dra ba la la mthong ba na bu dran pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one sees someone similar to one's son, one remembers one's son.

original: mi mthun pa las kyang dran pa skye ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa las kyang dran pa skye ste /
translated: Mindfulness also arises from dissimilarity.

original: tsha ba dang grang ba dran pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tsha ba dang grang ba dran pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one remembers cold when one is hot.

original: goms pa las kyang dran pa skye ste /
analyzed: goms pa las kyang dran pa skye ste /
translated: Mindfulness arises from familiarization.üîΩFor example, one remembers what one has studied.

original: bklag pa la sogs pa la goms par byas pa las gang goms pa de nyid phyis kyang dran pa skye ste /
analyzed: bklag pa la sogs pa la goms par byas pa las gang goms pa de nyid phyis kyang dran pa skye ste /
translated: Memory arises later from the habit of reading, etc.

original: gcig gi don du rtogs pa las dran pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gcig gi don du rtogs pa las dran pa 'byung ste /
translated: Memory arises from the understanding of one thing,

original: aa mra'i 'bras bu mthong ba las skyur ba dran pa'o //
analyzed: aa mra'i 'bras bu mthong ba las skyur ba dran pa'o //
translated: as when one remembers sour from seeing a mango.

original: zhi gnas kyi stobs kyang dran pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi stobs kyang dran pa 'byung ste /
translated: Memory arises from the power of calm abiding,

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams tshe rabs snga ma'i gnas rnams rjes su dran pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams tshe rabs snga ma'i gnas rnams rjes su dran pa skye ba'o //
translated: as when yogins who are mindful of past lives, mindful of death, and mindful of the destruction of the contaminants remember their past lives.

original: rgyu'i stobs las kyang dran pa skye ste ;
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs las kyang dran pa skye ste ;
translated: Memory arises from the power of cause,

original: bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams tshe rabs gzhan dran pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩg-yeng rgod thams cad spangs nas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams tshe rabs gzhan dran pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro // g-yeng rgod thams cad spangs nas /
translated: as when the virtuous remember their past lives.üîΩWhen the mind is straight, or even,

original: sems drang po'am mnyam par gnas na ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems drang po'am mnyam par gnas na ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: it is right concentration.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po rim pa de ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po rim pa de ltar bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the eightfold noble path explained in that order?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams thog mar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la ltos te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams thog mar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la ltos te /
translated: The yogis who attain nirvana first rely on the four noble truths.

original: de'i phyir dang po yang dag pa'i lta ba bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po yang dag pa'i lta ba bstan to //
translated: Therefore, right view is taught first.

original: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du /
translated: After seeing them,

original: phyis de nyid yin nam ma yin rtog pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: phyis de nyid yin nam ma yin rtog pa 'byung ste /
translated: later one doubts whether they are so or not.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o//
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o//
translated: Therefore, right thought follows that.

original: @161b ji ltar rtag pa bzhin du tshig 'byin te /
analyzed: @161b ji ltar rtag pa bzhin du tshig 'byin te /
translated: After thinking, one speaks as one has thought.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i ngag go //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i ngag go //
translated: Therefore, right speech follows right thought.

original: ji ltar smras pa de bzhin du phyis las byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar smras pa de bzhin du phyis las byed de /
translated: After speaking, one later acts as one has spoken.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i ngag gi 'og tu yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i ngag gi 'og tu yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, right action follows right speech.

original: yang dag pa'i las byas pa rnams 'tsho ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las byas pa rnams 'tsho ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who perform right action will have pure livelihood.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Therefore, right livelihood follows right action.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams ni dge ba'i phyogs la brtson 'grus rtsom zhing brtson 'grus 'phel te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams ni dge ba'i phyogs la brtson 'grus rtsom zhing brtson 'grus 'phel te /
translated: Those who have morality undertake and increase effort in the side of virtue.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
translated: Therefore, right effort is taught after right livelihood.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa rnams la dran pa nyams pa 'byung mi srid pas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa rnams la dran pa nyams pa 'byung mi srid pas /
translated: Since it is impossible for those who have effort to have degeneration of mindfulness,

original: de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: right mindfulness is taught after that.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa rnams ni sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur bas mjug tu yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad do //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa rnams ni sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur bas mjug tu yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad do //
translated: Since those who have mindfulness have one pointed minds, right concentration is taught at the end.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad du bshad /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad du bshad /
translated: Why are the eightfold noble path explained?

original: 'jig rten pa'i log pa'i lta ba nas log pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa brgyad yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i log pa'i lta ba nas log pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa brgyad yod de /
translated: There are eight mundane wrong paths from wrong view to wrong concentration.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyir yang yang dag pa'i lta ba nas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du brgyad bshad do //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyir yang yang dag pa'i lta ba nas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du brgyad bshad do //
translated: In order to counteract them, the eightfold noble path is explained from right view to right concentration.

original: yang na yang dag pa'i lta ba dang dran pa ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin te /
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i lta ba dang dran pa ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin te /
translated: Again, right view and right mindfulness are on the side of insight.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni ma rig pa dang bral na shes rab rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni ma rig pa dang bral na shes rab rnam par grol lo //
translated: Its result is that when one is free from ignorance, one is liberated by wisdom.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs te /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs te /
translated: The remaining members are on the side of serenity.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni 'dod chags dang bral nas sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni 'dod chags dang bral nas sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Its result is that when one is free from passion, one is liberated by mind.

original: yang na yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba gsum ni tshul khrims kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba gsum ni tshul khrims kyi phung po ste /
translated: Again, the three members of right speech, right action, and right livelihood are the aggregate of morality.

original: des ni gtsor zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par byed do //
analyzed: des ni gtsor zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par byed do //
translated: By them one severs the root of demerit which is hatred.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po ste /
translated: The two members of right mindfulness and right concentration are the aggregate of concentration.

original: des ni gtsor 'dod chags mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod do //
analyzed: des ni gtsor 'dod chags mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod do //
translated: By them one severs the root of demerit which is passion.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / rtsol ba dang lta ba gsum ni shes rab kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / rtsol ba dang lta ba gsum ni shes rab kyi phung po ste /
translated: The three members of right view, right thought, and right effort are the aggregate of wisdom.

original: des ni gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod do //
analyzed: des ni gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod do //
translated: By them one severs the root of demerit which is delusion.

original: de la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po 'di dag yan lag drug tu gzhag ste /üîΩyan lag drug ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag dang / gzhan thob par byed pa'i yan lag dang / gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag dang / nyon @162a * //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po 'di dag yan lag drug tu gzhag ste / yan lag drug ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag dang / gzhan thob par byed pa'i yan lag dang / gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag dang / nyon @162a * //
translated: The eightfold noble path is established as having six members.

original: mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag dang / yon tan khyad par can 'thob pa la sgrib pa yongs su sbyong ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag dang / yon tan khyad par can 'thob pa la sgrib pa yongs su sbyong ba'i yan lag go //
translated: The six members are: the member that is a thorough discernment, the member that causes the attainment of another, the member that causes the conviction of another, the member that purifies the obscurations of the afflictions, the member that purifies the obscurations of the secondary afflictions, and the member that purifies the obscurations to the attainment of special good qualities.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right view is the member that is a thorough discernment.

original: mthong ba'i lam na bdag dang sems can dang srog la sogs pa med par khong du chud pa de nyid la bdag gi de dag rnam pa 'di lta bur khong du chud do zhes mthong ba'i lam gyi chos nyid la gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam na bdag dang sems can dang srog la sogs pa med par khong du chud pa de nyid la bdag gi de dag rnam pa 'di lta bur khong du chud do zhes mthong ba'i lam gyi chos nyid la gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a thorough discernment because it is a thorough discernment of the reality of the path of seeing, thinking, ‚ÄúI have thoroughly discerned that the self, sentient beings, and life do not exist in this way.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan la thob par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan la thob par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right thought is the branch that causes others to obtain it.

original: ma brtags ma dpyad pas tshig mi 'byin pas yang dag pa'i lta bas ji ltar mthong ba'i chos rnam par brtags nas de nyid gzhan la 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtags ma dpyad pas tshig mi 'byin pas yang dag pa'i lta bas ji ltar mthong ba'i chos rnam par brtags nas de nyid gzhan la 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not utter words without examining and investigating, one teaches others the Dharma that one has examined and seen through right view.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba gsum ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba gsum ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right speech, right action, and right livelihood are the three branches that cause others to have faith.

original: rim bzhin du lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / 'tsho ba dag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim bzhin du lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / 'tsho ba dag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has faith in the purity of view, morality, and livelihood, respectively.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gi ni lta ba rnam par dag par yid ches par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gi ni lta ba rnam par dag par yid ches par 'byung ste /
translated: Faith in the purity of view arises from right speech.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yang dag pa'i ngag gis ji ltar chud pa'i chos rnams gzhan la lung ston pa na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag gis ji ltar chud pa'i chos rnams gzhan la lung ston pa na /
translated: When one teaches the Dharma to others through right speech,

original: gzhan gyis brgal ba'i lan gdab pa dang / bshad pa la gsal zhing phyin ci ma log par bstan pa pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brgal ba'i lan gdab pa dang / bshad pa la gsal zhing phyin ci ma log par bstan pa pas /
translated: The response to the objections of others and the explanation are clear and unmistaken.

original: gzhan dag 'dis ni chos kyi don gtan la dbab pa dang / 'gal ba med pa dang / gsal bar ston pa dang sbyar na de kho na khong du chud do zhes yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'dis ni chos kyi don gtan la dbab pa dang / 'gal ba med pa dang / gsal bar ston pa dang sbyar na de kho na khong du chud do zhes yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, others will believe that one has understood reality, since one has ascertained the meaning of the Dharma, is free from contradiction, and teaches clearly.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni tshul khrims rnam par dag par yid ches par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni tshul khrims rnam par dag par yid ches par 'byung ste /
translated: One will be believed to have pure morality, since one has right action.

original: 'dir srog gcod pa la sogs pa ngan par spyod pa rnams srog gi phyir yang mi byed pa dang sbyar na 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan no zhes yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir srog gcod pa la sogs pa ngan par spyod pa rnams srog gi phyir yang mi byed pa dang sbyar na 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan no zhes yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since one does not commit evil actions such as killing even to save one's life, one will be believed to have the morality that delights the Aryas.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnam par dag par yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnam par dag par yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: One will be believed to have pure livelihood, since one has right livelihood.

original: ji lta zhe na chos gos la sogs pa yang chos bzhin du tshol gyi g-yo dang sgyus mi tshol la /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na chos gos la sogs pa yang chos bzhin du tshol gyi g-yo dang sgyus mi tshol la /
translated: How so? One seeks Dharma robes and so on in accordance with the Dharma, not through deceit or fraud.

original: yo byad mang po 'dzin pa spangs pas 'tsho ba rnam par dag go zhes gzhan dag yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yo byad mang po 'dzin pa spangs pas 'tsho ba rnam par dag go zhes gzhan dag yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: One‚Äôs livelihood is pure because one has abandoned hoarding many possessions.

original: de la @162b yang dag pa'i lta bas ni mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la @162b yang dag pa'i lta bas ni mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, one has realization through right view,
